Juda is committed to rebuild her devastated life.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Zebougou, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréales et de condiments. Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur seizième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente AWA, personne au milieu dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de riz. Elle compte acheter 1 sac de riz chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 12 000Fcfa, qui sera en parti réinvesti dans l’activité et le reste assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The Benkadi Group is made up of married women with an average age of 38 and four children each. They all live within the frameworks of traditional families in the village of Zebougou, in the commune of Massigui, Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative area of the Republic of Mali). They all know each other through the bonds of family, community and friendship. They work in the restaurant business and the commerce of cereals and condiments. This will be the sixteenth loan for the women of the Benkadi Group.

In order to satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso. The requested loan amount will go towards the aforementioned merchandise (i.e. cereals). 

Awa, the woman in the middle of the standing row, is illiterate. She currently works as a rice vendor. She plans on buying one sack of rice from the wholesalers at the weekly market. She sells her stock for cash out of her own home to a mixed customer base. She plans on making a monthly profit of 12,000 FCFA, which will be partially reinvested into her business, with the rest going towards her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for school fees at University of East Africa Baraton

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a liquefied petroleum gas stove.

loans.name: Maria Catalina

texts.es:
Maria tiene 32 años de edad, estudio séptimo grado en la escuela de la comunidad pues su familia era muy pobre y no pudo continuar sus estudios, actualmente esta acompañada y su pareja se dedica trabajar como agente policial. Tiene tres hijos, de los cuales solo dos estudian y el otro todavía no, por lo tanto sus hijos dependen de ella.

   Maria se dedica a los oficios domésticos, sus ingresos dependen de la ayuda que tiene de su esposo. Antes cuando vivian en otra ciudad trabajaba en una pupuseri, pero por lo peligroso de la zona tuvieron que migrar a donde viven actualmente y perdió su trabajo

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar el piso y el techo de su casa que se encuentra en malas condiciones, comprara lamina, cemento, arena. 

Su sueño es construir  formalmente su vivienda y tenerla más segura para ella y su hijas,  ya que ellas van creciendo y necesitan privacidad. También pretende darles educación hasta donde sea posible y un día encuentren un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 32 years old and studied up to Grade 7 in the local school. Her parents were poor and she could not continue her studies. She is in a common-law relationship and her husband is a police agent. She has three children. Two of them study, the other isn't old enough yet to study. All the children are dependent on her.

Maria does the housework. All the income she has depends on her husband. Before when she lived in another city she work in a pupusa shop, but because of the danger in that area she had to move to where she lives now and she lost that job.

Maria needs this loan to buy construction materials to improve the floor and the roof of the house which are in bad condition. She will buy laminate, cement and sand. Her dream is to formally construct her house to have more security for her children and herself. Her children are getting bigger and need privacy. She also wants to provide them with as much education as she can so that they can one day enjoy a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy laminate, cement ans sand to improve the roof and floor of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for clean and efficient cooking energy from liquefied petroleum gas.

loans.name: Munguntsetseg

texts.en:
Munguntsetseg, 38 years old, lives with her husband and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a traditional Mongolian  ger (a portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land.

She has been running a house renovation service to people of the slum district since 2011. Her husband runs a taxi service for local people to make a  living.

Munguntsetseg is requesting a loan of 2,750 USD to buy an electric car for transportation. The advantages of an electric car are that the pollutants it emits into the air are harmless and it wastes less fuel compared to other cars. She will use this environmentally friendly car for transporting building materials such as fiberglass, hardwood floors and wallpapers.

loans.use: to buy an electric car

loans.name: Usaha Ternak Group

texts.en:
One month earlier, Wayan, head of the Usaha Ternak group, already informed the members to prepare for repayment, with a 12,000,000 IDR (Indonesian rupiah) loan amount and the number of members at eight. Wayan succeeded in selling all of her pigs. With the profit of 2,500,000 IDR, she is very grateful for the acquisition and will use the profits for the preparation of her children's education and also for their daily needs.

With eight members, the Usaha Ternak group continues their loan of 12,000,000 IDR, and each will receive 1,500,000 IDR. They decided to continue the loan until they have enough savings.

Wayan will use her loan to purchase three superior piglets for fattening. According to her plan, the pigs will be ready to sell in the fifth month. The profit will be used to buy a sow. She has a plan to become a piglet seller, especially local pigs.

She hopes her plan will come true and she can improve her business by selling piglets to other breeders.

loans.use: to purchase three superior piglets

loans.name: Billy

texts.en:
Billy is 49 years old and lives in Barangay Sta. Maria, Tangub City. He is married with three school-age children. Billy has been engaged in a buying and selling of bananas business for five years. He applied for a loan with PMPC for additional capital for his business. He will restock his inventories of bananas. Billy also wants to increase his sales in his business.

He hopes to provide for the school needs of his children and give them a good future someday.

loans.use: to restock his banana inventory

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Evangeline works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell food supplement business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice. 

Evangeline is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional food supplements for her buy and sell food supplement business.

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional food supplement products to sell for her business.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel,39, is a married woman with two children who are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Liezel has a buy and sell recyclable materials business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Liezel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more recyclable materials to sell. In the future, Liezel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more recyclable materials to sell.

loans.name: Nanet

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nanet works hard to support her family.

She has a farming rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Nanet is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her farming rice business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Nanet has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is 57 years old, married, and has eight children. With three children currently in school, Lucresia works very hard to provide for them.

Lucresia runs a general store in the Philippines. Lucresia has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as soy sauce, vinegar, detergent soap, noodles, shampoo, etc.  

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like soy sauce, vinegar, detergent soap, noodles, shampoo, etc. to sell.

In the future, Lucresia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soy sauce, vinegar, detergent soap, noodles, shampoo, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Neria

texts.en:
Neria works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and has been with NWTF since 2010. Now she is requesting a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Neria will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Neria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Nerma

texts.en:
Nerma works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and has been with NWTF since 2010. Now she requesting a PHP 9,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Nerma will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Nerma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Relinda

texts.en:
Relinda is 46 years old and married with six children. With five children currently in school, Relinda works very hard to provide for them. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store. She has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, cooking oil, bread, eggs, canned goods, etc. 

In the future, Relinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Anabel works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of scrap materials business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Anabel is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy more scrap materials to sell for her buying and selling of scrap materials business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Anabel has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials to sell

loans.name: Deogracia

texts.en:
Deogracia works hard to support her family. Deogracia is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Deogracia requested a 24,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

Deogracia has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Deogracia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde works hard to support her family. Matilde is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Matilde requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food-production business.

Matilde has been in this business for nine years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Matilde would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 50 years old and married with two children, and she works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Perlita has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns some income from food vending.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor is 28 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Flor is borrowing 22,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Flor has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Santos Evenor

texts.es:
Santos tiene 35 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, esta casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domesticos, y tiene un hijo que estudia en la escuela.

Santos se dedica a trabajar como albañil, el aprendio este oficio ya que su familia es muy humilde y de escasos recursos, el abandono sus estudios para poder ayudar economicamente en el hogar y sacar adelante a sus hermanos menores, además el se dedica a la agricultura, esto lo aprendio de su padre que fue su principal instructor en este rubro, asi como el de la albañilería, con este trabajo el ha podido salir adelante llevando a su familia el dinero para la compra de alimentos.

El credito lo necesita para ampliar una granja de pollos con la cual obtiene un ingreso extra su familia ya que mientras el trabaja en la agricultura y como albañil su madre y su esposa se encargan del cuidado de las aves de esta manera tambien le ayudan a generar un ahorro en mano de obra asi como en el cuido oportuno de los animales. 

En un futuro el desea poder tener una granja mas grande que le genere mas rentabilidad para que sus ingresos sean mayores, que su familia y en especial su madre pueda pasar descansando sus ultimos dias ya que es de una edad avanzada.
texts.en:
Santos is 35 years old and completed up to ninth grade at school. He is married; his wife takes care of the household chores. The couple has one son who is at primary school.

Santos makes a living as a builder. He learned this trade because his family is very humble and poor. Santos left school in order to help the family financially, and to help his younger sibling to get ahead. Santos also works in farming, work that he learned, along with building, from his father. This work has allowed Santos to get ahead and to bring home money for his family to buy food.

Santos needs this loan in order to expand his chicken farm. This will give him an extra income for his family as, while Santos is farming, his wife and mother can look after the birds. He can also save money on labourers, who would otherwise need to look after the animals.

In the future, Santos would like to have a larger and more profitable chicken farm, so that he can earn more money. He wants his family - and particularly his mother, who is now quite old - to be able to rest in their final days.

loans.use: to expand his chicken farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a liquefied petroleum gas stove system.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for clean and efficient cooking energy from liquefied petroleum gas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies and to pay labourers to look after her corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuya, 39 years old, lives with her husband in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling foodstuffs at a food market for one year. Her husband renders transportation service to local people. 

Using her previous loan, she has taken full ownership of the automobile her husband uses for the taxi service. Now she is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to buy foodstuffs in large amounts, so that she can continue to run her business without worrying about inventory shortage. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en:
Mr. Batjargal, 51 years old, lives with his wife and son in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. He has been running a small taxi company since 2008. Initially, he was a taxi driver himself, and using his accrued income, he purchased three more cars and rented them to local people for taxi service. His wife is a regulator of the road network. 

He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to buy potato and carrot seeds. Every year, he plants vegetables for household use. Growing vegetables on his own will save money, and also, it will contribute to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to buy potato and carrot seeds to grow

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Jose vive en chincha, trabaja como chofer demototaxi, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante cada día, el labora alrededor de 9 horas y puede atender hata 50 clientes en el día, el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable y cuidadoso en su trabajo.

Jose esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar algunas mejoras en su vehículo, mantenimiento y poder solventar algunos gastos personales, asi podrá seguir trabajando y esforzándose para poder realizar su gran sueño:” Mejorar su calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Jose lives in Chincha, he works as a moto-taxi chauffeur, with which he makes his earnings to carry him day to day. He works around 9 hours and could have up to 50 customers in a day. He believes that it goes well in his job because he is responsible and careful in his work. 

Jose is grateful with Kiva investors because thanks to their help he has been able to make some improvements to his vehicle, as well as maintenance and cover some of his personal expenses. In this way he will be able to continue working and striving to fulfill his great dream of “improving his quality of life.”

loans.use: to improve his vehicle and cover personal expenses

loans.name: Dúo Bellos Horizontes Group

texts.es:
Dúo Bellos Horizontes
El señor Sergio Otoniel,vive en la comunidad de Patzicia, es una persona muy trabajadora, el tienen un trabajo fijo pero también tiene un negocio puesto de venta de comida, ya que tiene hijos y tiene la responsabilidad  de velar por ellos, por esa razón se dedica a trabajar fuerte, ´pero debido a que el sueldo no le alcanza para invertir en su negocio, es por eso que acude a FAPE para que se le otorgue un crédito y poder así invertir en su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias ya que su sueño es mejorar su casa, tener su negocio mas grande y que sus hijos logren graduarse mas adelante, es por esa razón que se esfuerza en trabajar cada dia, mientras Dios les da vida, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para la elaboracion de comida para la venta.
texts.en: The "Dúo Bellos Horizontes" group. Sergio Otoniel lives in the community of Patzicia.  He is a hard-working person. He has a regular job and he also has a business selling meals. He has children and has the responsibility of taking care of them. So he works hard but his salary does not allow him enough to invest in his business. So he has come to FAPE to get a loan to invest in his business and make more income. His dreams are to improve his house and have a bigger business. He hopes that his children can graduate from school in the future. These are the reasons he puts his effort into work every day, as long as God grants him life. He is requesting this loan to buy food products to prepare food for sale.

loans.use: to buy food to prepare and sell meals.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: La señora Cecilia tiene 29 años y es casada con 2 hijos de las edades de 10 y 6 años, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras, legumbres y tubérculos al por mayor, tiene su puesto de venta en uno de los mercados de la zona de Chasquipampa es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La señora Cecilia va a usar este préstamo para la compra de una caja para su movilidad ya que este presenta algunas fallas y es quien le ayuda a transportar su mercadería a su puesto de venta y con el saldo comprara verduras  al por mayor y así de esta manera surtir su puesto de venta,  La señora Cecilia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el tener que levantarse temprano para ir a abastecerse de mercadería que lo hace en el mercado campesino donde venden al por mayor directamente del productor a consumidor y esto lo realiza a la semana dos veces, lo que implica un constante traslado de mercadería y gasto monetario en transporte,  va a utilizar los beneficios  seguir comprando mercadería para surtir su negocio, para la venta de sus productos. Su deseo para su negocio es  mejorar sus ingresos para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Cecilia is 29 years old and married. She has two children who are 10 and 6 years old. She earns her living selling greens, legumes, and tubers at wholesale. She has her sales location in one of the markets in the Chasquipampa area. This is her first lending cycle within the institution.

Señora Cecilia is going to use this loan for the purchase of a transmission for her vehicle, since it is failing; that's what helps her to transport her merchandise to her sales location. With the balance, she will buy vegetables at wholesale to stock her stand. 

Señora Cecilia faces challenges in her business, like having to get up early to go stock up her merchandise, which she does in the farmers' market where they sell at wholesale directly from the producer to the consumer. She does this twice a week, which means constant transport of merchandise and monetary transportation expenses. She is going to use the profits to continue buying merchandise to stock her business in order to sell her products. Her wish for her business is to improve her income in order to offer a better quality of life to her children.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle and purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies to help with her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken, plates, vegetables, cutlery, oil, breading, bullion cubes, soft drinks and soda.

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
Melisa is 47 years old and married with six children.  With three children in school, Melisa works very hard to provide for them.

Melisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Melisa has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Melisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOTOGNONTALA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Beleda, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de l’habillement, de produit cosmétique et de vanne. Les femmes du groupe KOTOGNONTALA  sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente SAFIATOU, deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement restauratrice. Elle compte acheter du riz, de la farine boulangère et des condiments chez les grossistes à Massigui. La vente des plats se fait en espèce dans sa gargote sise au marché du village à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 22 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Kotognontala Group is made up of married women with an average age of 33 and and an average of three children each. They all live within the frameworks of traditional families in the village of Beleda, in the commune of Massigui, Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They all know each other through the bonds of family, community and friendship. They work in the restaurant business, as well as in the commerce of clothing, cosmetic products and wicker items.

This will be the first loan for the women of the Kotognontala Group. In order to satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso.

Safiatou, the woman standing second from the right, is illiterate. She currently owns her own restaurant. She plans on buying rice, baker's flour and condiments from the wholesalers in Massigui. She sells food for cash out of her restaurant located in the village market to a mixed customer base. She plans on making an average monthly profit of 22,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested into her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for their restaurant

loans.name: Heremakono Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe HEREMAKONO est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Zebougou, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréales, de condiments et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe HEREMAKONO sont à leur vingtième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente AMINATA , personne assise est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’article divers. Elle compte acheter 1 sac de sucre, 1 carton de thé, du sachet plastique, des cartons de piles et de Lipton chez les grossistes à Massigui. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle dans son étale à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Heremakono group is composed of married women averaging 38 years of age, with four children. They all live in traditional families in the Zebougou village, Massigui community, Doila Prefecture, Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of Mali).
They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They cook food for sale and sell cereals, condiments and miscellaneous articles. The group members are on their 20th solidarity loan.

With the goal of meeting huge customer demand, they have reached out to Soro Yiriwaso. Their loans will be used to buy merchandise mentioned above. 
Our client Aminata, the one seated in the photo, is illiterate. She currently works selling miscellaneous items. She plans to buy one bag of sugar, one box of tea, some plastic bags, some boxes of batteries and Lipton tea bags from wholesalers in Massigui. She sells retail, for cash, from a stand by her house, to a mixed clientele. She plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 45,000 West African francs, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Jose Simeon

texts.es:
José tiene 50 años de edad,  estudio hasta segundo grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a lo domestico, tiene 4 hijos los mayores están acompañados y trabajan para ellos y sus familias, y los otros dos le ayudan en el trabajo y estudian.  

José se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos,  desde  muy joven aprendió el oficio pues sus padres lo enseñaron desde que era un pequeño, lo llevaban al campo y él se fijaba como sus padres trabajaban fue así como aprendió y sin tener otra actividad que le generara ingresos  decidió ser agricultor. El lugar donde trabaja le queda a 20 minutos de su casa y viaja a pie. Su esposa y su tercer hijo son los que ayudan indirectamente en las actividades.

Con el financiamiento comprara los insumos agrícolas como: 3 quintales de fórmula, 4 quintales de sulfato, dos litros de amina y con el resto pagara la mano de obra para las  diferentes actividades que requieren los cultivos. Con el crédito tendrá la oportunidad de ampliar el área donde trabajaba antes lo cual puede generarle más producción 

El sueño de José es seguir trabajando con CrediCampo, para que en seguida se le dé un nuevo crédito y ampliar aún más sus áreas productivas ya que no tiene otra actividad más que la agricultura pero disfruta ver como hace producir la tierra
texts.en:
José is 50 years old. He studied until second grade. He is in a relationship and his partner works at home. He has four children, the older ones are in relationships and work for themselves and their families. The other two help him in his work and study.     

José works in the cultivation of basic grains. His parents taught him when he was very young. They took him to the fields, and he watched them work; that's how he learned. He did not have another way to generate income so he decided to become a farmer. The place where he works is 20 minutes from his house, and he travels by foot. His partner and his third son are the ones who help indirectly in the activities. 

With the financing he will buy farming supplies like 3 quintals of Formula, 4 quintals of Sulfato, 2 liters of Amina(fertlizers and herbicides) and with the rest he will pay the labor cost for the different work that the plants require. With the loan he will have the opportunity to increase the area where he works so then he can generate more production. 

José's dream is to continue working with CrediCampo so that next he gets a new loan to increase his production even more because he doesn't have other means besides farming, but he enjoys seeing what the land produces.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies like: 3 quintals of Formula, 4 quintals of Sulfato, 2 liters of Amina(fertilizers and herbicides) and with the rest he will pay for labor cost.

loans.name: Leonardo Antonio

texts.es:
Leonardo tiene 52 años d edad, estudio solo primer grado, esta casado y vive junto a su  esposa y sus 3 hijas las cuales  están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad, su esposa se dedica a realizar los oficios del hogar mientras que el trabaja como jornalero para llevar el ingreso a su casa. 

 Leonardo se dedica a trabajar como jornalero, el aprendió este oficio ya que su familia es muy humilde y de escasos recursos, el abandono sus estudios para poder ayudar económicamente en el hogar y sacar adelante a sus hermanos menores, además de esto el se dedica a la corta del maguey esto lo aprendió de su padre que fue su principal instructor en este rubro asa como el de la agricultura, con la realización de estos trabajos él puede obtener el ingreso necesario para darles a su familia el alimento diario.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas para aplicarlos a tiempo en sus cultivos y obtener una buena cosecha, que le genere un ingreso a su familia ya que mientras el trabaja en la corta de maguey  la esposa y sus hijas en horas de la tarde le ayuden en el proceso de siembra.

En un futuro el desea poder tener una parcela mas grande de cultivos  que le genere mas rentabilidad para que sus ingresos sean mayores, y que su familia puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Leonardo is 52 years old. He only has a first-grade education. He is married and lives together with his wife and their three daughters, who go to the community school. His wife takes care of the household duties while he works as a day laborer to bring income to their household.

Leonardo earns his living as a day laborer. He learned this trade because his family is of modest means and scares resources. He quit school to be able to economically help his household and support his younger siblings. In addition to that, he works cutting agave, which he learned from his father, who was his main instructor in this field as well as in farming. He knows that with these jobs, he can obtain the income necessary to feed his family every day.

He needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies to apply to his crops in time so he can obtain a good harvest, which will generate an income for his family. While he works cutting agave, his wife and his daughters help him with the farming process in the afternoons.

In the future, he hopes to have a larger parcel to farm, which will generate more profitability so that his income will be larger. He also hopes that his family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and apply them to his crops in time and obtain a good harvest.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Victor vive en la ciudad de Chincha, es un hombre muy trabajador y cada día se esfuerza mucho en su negocio como chofer de mototaxi, con lo cual trabaja alrededor e 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes, lo cual le permite tener ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia.

Victor esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejorar en su vehículo y solventar algunos gastos personales, de esta manera podrá tener un vehículo en buenas condicione y podrá trabajar mas tranquilo y seguirá esforzándose por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia”.
texts.en:
Victor lives in the city of Chincha. He is a very hardworking man and every day he puts great effort into his business as a mototaxi driver. He works about nine hours a day and can serve up to twenty customers, which allows him to have income to support his family.

Victor is grateful for the Kiva loans, since thanks to the help that they have provided him, he will be able to make improvements to his vehicle and cover some personal expenses. This way, he will be able to have his vehicle in good condition, be able to work with less stress, and continue striving toward realizing his big dream: improving the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to improve his vehicle and cover personal expenses

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel de 61 años de edad, estudio hasta 6° grado por falta de recursos económicos, esta acompañado y su pareja se dedica a cuido del hogar, sus dos hijos están estudiando y nadie mas vive con ellos.
 
Fidel se dedica al a agricultura desde que tenia 12 años, trabajo que aprendió de su padre, ademas tiene 15 años de  trabajar como vigilante de una empresa,  para llegar a su trabajo tiene que caminar 20 minutos para luego tomar el bus, trabaja 24 horas y luego descansa otras 24 horas, su día libre lo utiliza para cultivar maíz.

El crédito sera invertido en la compra de dos vacas. 

Fidel sueña en que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales a futuro y tener unas cinco vacas lecheras ademas poner luz eléctrica a su casa.
texts.en: Fidel is 61 years old and studied up to Grade 6 due to a lack of economic resources. He is in a common-law relationship and his wife takes care of the house. His two children study and no one else lives with them. Fidel has farmed since he was 12 years old, something he learned from his father. He has also been working as a security guard in a company for 15 years. To get to his work he has to walk for 20 minutes and then take a bus. He works for 24 hours and then gets 24 hours off. On his free days he grows corn. The loan will be invested in buying two cows. Fidel dreams of his children studying and becoming professionals in the future. He wants to own 5 milk cows and install electricity in his house.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Hector Osmin

texts.es:
Héctor tiene 34 años de edad, estudio solo segundo grado no pudo terminar sus estudios como el quería debido a las condiciones económicas en las que vivía su familia, actualmente está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tiene 2 hijos de los cuales están estudiando en la escuela. 

Héctor se dedica al cuido de ganado, además trabaja en la agricultura que es su principal fuente de trabajo en la temporada de invierno, el aprendió dicho oficio debido a la necesidad con la que sus padres contaban, desde niño aprendió a trabajar en el cultivo de maíz y frijol y esto le ha generado tener el alimento en su casa todos los días así ha podido darles a sus hijos el estudio con la venta de los granos que cosecha.
. 
El crédito que solicita a CrediCampo lo necesita para comprar  insumos agrícolas para la siembra de granos básicos, abono, insecticida, pesticidas y todo lo necesario para el tratamiento del cultivo.

Para un futuro el sueña con comprar un terreno para poder construir su propia vivienda ya que por el momento esta alquilando y quiere darles a sus hijos una vivienda digna donde ellos puedan disponer libremente, desea enseñarles a sus hijos a trabajar la agricultura para que ellos puedan tener una fuente de ingresos y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Héctor is 34 years old. He has a second-grade education. Héctor was not able to finish school like he wanted to because of his family's financial circumstances. Héctor is married. His wife tends to the work around the house. They have two children who are both in elementary school. 

Héctor makes a living raising livestock. In addition, he farms, which is his principal source of income during the winter season. Héctor learned this trade out of necessity from his parents. When he was young, he learned to work growing corn and beans. The sales from this activity have allowed Héctor to bring home food for his family each day as well as provide his children with an education. 

The loan Héctor is requesting from CrediCampo will be used to buy farming supplies to help with sowing his grains: fertilizer, pesticide, insecticides, and everything necessary for treating his crops. For the future, Héctor dreams of buying a plot of land on which to build his own home since he is currently renting his family's home. Héctor wants to provide his children with a dignified life. He hopes to teach his children to farm so that they will have a means of earning an income and getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to sow his grains such as fertilizer, insecticides, pesticides, and everything necessary to treat his crops.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia es soltera pero tiene dos hijos Ella vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad La señora se dedica al oficio de vivandera y necesita un prestamo  para comprar quintales de arroz, azucar y fideo, ademas de un horno, todo será usado para su negocio. Sonia es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Sonia is single and has 2 children. She lives in La Paz in a brick and cement house which belongs to her. 

She is a street vendor and needs a loan to purchase quintals (220 lbs.) of rice, sugar and noodles as well as an oven all which will be used for her business. 

Sonia’s earnings is the only source of income for her household and that is why she needs help.

loans.use: to purchase quintals (220 lbs.) of rice, sugar and noodles as well as an oven for her business.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala tiene 54 años de edad, estudio solo segundo grado en la escuela, es madre soltera de 2 hijos ellos ya son mayores de edad y le ayudan un poco en los gastos del hogar ya que el hijo mayor se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura para otras personas y así obtiene un salario diario que ayuda a los ingresos, su otra hija se dedica a trabajar como domestica donde una vecina de esta manera también tiene un ingreso con el cual aporta en los gastos del hogar. 

Pascuala se dedica a trabajar en el hogar haciendo los oficios, ella le lava y le plancha la ropa a sus dos hijos mientras ellos trabajan fuera de casa, también ella para obtener un ingreso propio lava y plancha ajeno a vecinas de la zona quienes por su tiempo no lo pueden hacer, ella toda la vida ha sido una señora de hogar y siempre se ha dedicado al cuido de sus hijos pues que su madre así le enseño a realiza el oficio.

El crédito lo necesita para  comprar  insumos agrícolas para que su hijo siembre milpa para el consumo de ellos ya que si no lo hace le tocaría comprar los granos en un lugar particular y eso no le ayudaría en mucho a su economía, ellos cultivaran 1 hectárea de maíz con la cual esperan una buena cosecha y tener suficientes granos en su vivienda para la temporada de verano.

Ella sueña que en un futuro puede tener una parcela grande para poder cultivar no solo maíz sino también hortalizas y de esta manera al venderlas tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Pascuala is 54 years old. She attended school only until the second grade.  She is a single mother of two children who are now adults and help her a little with household expenses. Her oldest child, a son, farms for other people and earns a daily salary that helps with income, while her other child, a daughter, works as a domestic for a neighbor and in this way also has an income from which she contributes to household expenses.

Pascuala works at home doing household tasks: she washes and irons her two children’s clothes while they work outside the home; also, in order to earn her own income, she washes and irons clothes for neighbors in the area, who don’t have time to do so for themselves. She has always been a stay at home mother all of her life and has devoted herself to caring for her children since that was the way her mother taught her to perform that role.

She needs a loan to purchase farming supplies so that her son can plant corn for their own consumption since if he does not do so, they would have to purchase it at a particular location and that would not help her finances much. They farmed 1 hectare (2.47 acres) of corn and hope to have a good harvest with sufficient corn at home for the winter season. 

She dreams that in the future she will have a large parcel of land so that she can cultivate not only corn but also vegetables and sell them in order to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies so her son can plant corn.

loans.name: Solongo

texts.en:
Mrs. Solongo, 44 years old, lives with her three children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling recyclable materials to local people since 2006. 

Using her previous loan, Solongo managed to purchase an electric heater and she reduced her family's coal usage. 

This time, she is requesting a loan of MNT 1,500,000 to buy wallpaper, an air conditioning system, and tiles. Using those materials, she will make her house's first flat cafeteria, in order to generate additional income. 

Her youngest daughter will commence high school next year and family expenses are expected to rise. Good renovation of the first flat will increase customer satisfaction and reduce energy costs.

loans.use: to buy wallpaper, tiles, and an air conditioning system.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIESSIRI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Beleda, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de lait, de l’habillement, de produit cosmétique et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente ASSAN, première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’habits  pour enfants. Elle compte acheter 40 complets chez ses fournisseurs  à Dioïla. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et parfois ambulante a une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 21 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Tiessiri Group is made up of married women with an average age of 39 and and an average of four children each. They all live within the frameworks of traditional families in the village of Beleda, in the commune of Massigui, Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They all know each other through the bonds of family, community and friendship. They earn a living through buying and selling milk, clothing, cosmetic products and various other items.

This will be the first loan for the women of the Tiessiri Group. In order to satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso. The requested loan amount will go towards the aforementioned merchandise.

Assan, the first woman standing to the left of the photo, is illiterate. She currently works as a vendor of children's clothing. She plans on buying 40 sets of clothes from her suppliers in Dioïla. She sells her items for cash out of her own home, and sometimes as a travelling merchant, to a mixed customer base. She plans on making an average monthly profit of 21,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested into her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia Isabel continua dedicándose al  negocio de picantería ,la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, a la vez la socia continua dedicandose a la ganaderia,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como carne, aceité, arroz entre otros.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Isabel continues dedicating herself to her  picantería [restaurant serving traditional food and beverages]. She has been working in her business awhile, and she does well thanks to the determination that she puts every day into her business. At the same time she continues working in the catte industry. She is a responsible and tenacious person, and in this way she is moving her family forward. She requests the loan to buy supplies like meat, oil, and rice among other things. She is very thankful to KIVA for allowing her to give her family a better quality of life, and she is committed to completing her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies like meat, oil, and rice among other things.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn previously accessed a PHP 34,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

Jocelyn would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of PHP 36,000, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell should result in greater profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jocelyn dreams to have a grocery store and hopes to give her children a good life and education. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Tony Angel

texts.es:
Tony tiene 27 años de edad, estudio hasta 9° grado, no termino sus estudios ya que su padre se enfermo y tuvo que dedicarse a trabajar para llevar el alimento a su familia, actualmente está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar y el cuido de sus dos hijos.

Tony se dedica a trabajar como panificador en una panadería ubicada en la ciudad, su horario de trabajo es de 4:00 AM hasta las 5:00 PM, por ser un trabajo muy pesado y el horario muy extenso el no puede trasladarse a su casa, así que el solo labora de lunes a sábado, para trasladarse de su casa al trabajo el lunes tiene que irse a las 3:00 AM para estar a la hora exacta en el trabajo y durante la semana el se queda en ese lugar, además de esto el se dedica a trabajar la agricultura ya que antes de ser panificador se había dedicado a trabajar la agricultura y el cuido de ganado, cuando él está en el trabajo semanal la esposa se hace cargo del cuido de los cultivos y de una vaca que ellos poseen.

El crédito solicitado lo necesita para comprar los fertilizantes y herbicidas para el cultivo de maíz, así como el pago de mano de obra.

El quiere para su futuro que sus hijos crezcan en un lugar sano y que sean personas de bien, desea darles el estudio que el no pudo tener por dedicarse a trabajar para darles el alimento a su familia, y desea tener una mejor producción de granos básicos
texts.en:
Tony is 27 years old. He studied through the 9th grade; he was not able to finish school because his father fell ill and Tony had to begin working in order to support his family. Currently, he is married. His wife attends to work around the house and taking care of their two children. Tony makes a living as a baker in a bakery in the city. His work schedule is from 4 a.m. to 5 p.m. He has a very heavy schedule and the long hours prevent him from commuting from home. For this reason, he works from Monday to Saturday. In order to travel to work on Mondays, Tony must leave at 3 a.m. in order to be at work on time. During the week, he sleeps at work. 

In addition to this, Tony also works as a farmer since this is how he made a living before he was hired by the bakery. While Tony is at work during the week, his wife takes care of the crops and the cow they possess. This loan will help Tony to buy fertilizers and weed killer to help cultivate his corn crops as well as to pay for labor. 

Tony hopes for the future that his children will grow up in a healthy environment and become good people. He wishes to give them the good education that he was not able to have because he had to work to feed his family. Tony also hopes to achieve a better production of basic grains.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and weed killers to cultivate corn crops and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Yoly Esther

texts.es:
Yoly es una mujer de 44 años, con grandes aspiraciones y es testigo de que el esfuerzo y perseverancia lleva a las personas a conseguir grandes cosas.
Desde hace algún tiempo viene desempeñándose como administradora de su propio negocio que consiste en una tienda de víveres y abarrotes en Montería, Colombia. Inicio con una pequeña tienda y poco apoco fue aumentando sus ingresos hasta conseguir una mediana tienda bien consolidada.
Actualmente dese seguir expandiendo su servicio y atender un mayor número de clientes, por esta razón solicita apoyo económico para compra un gran surtido de productos básicos de la canasta familiar para abastecer sus estanterías. De esta forma podrá tener un inventario más amplio de productos disponibles para vender a sus clientes.
Su sueño es poder mantener su establecimiento a flote en el tiempo y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yoly is a 44 year old woman with great aspirations and she is a believer that effort and perseverance lead people to accomplish great things.

For a while she has been the administrator of her own business which is a store selling supplies and groceries in Monteria, Colombia. She started with a small store and little by little she increased her earnings until she accomplished having a well consolidated mid-size store.

She currently wants to continue expanding her service and serve a greater number of customers. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy a large selection of basic household goods to stock her shelves. In this manner she will be able to have a diverse inventory of products available to sell to her customers.

Her dream is to keep her establishment afloat throughout time and to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of household goods to increase her inventory

loans.name: Juan Gabriel

texts.es:
Juan tiene 38 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, pues sus padres eran muy pobres y no le tomaron importancia al estudio.- Esta casado y su esposa se dedica al cuidado del hogar y le ayuda en siembras de maíz, tienen 4 hijas y 2 están en la escuela y las otras 2 todavía no, y nadie mas vive con ellos.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenia 7 años, trabajo que aprendió con su padre pues el decía que era mejor aprender a trabajar que estudiar, pero el piensa distinto, pues le hace falta saber leer, por otra parte le agradece a su padre por haberle enseñado a trabajar pues le ha servido para sacar adelante a su familia, el siembra maíz y maicillo. Su día comienza a las 4:30 AM  donde se levanta para ordeñar una vaca que tiene y luego llevarla al potrero.

Para llegar donde el trabaja tiene que caminar 30 minutos luego labora 6 horas y regresa a casa, por las tardes trabaja en los cultivos.

El crédito sera invertido en la compra de semilla, abono y veneno.

Su sueño es que sus hijas se preparen en el estudio, ya que el no tuvo esa oportunidad, también desea comprar un solar y construir su casa ( hoy vive en la casa de su suegro) y pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Juan is 38 years old.  He did not have the opportunity to attend school as his parents were very poor, and didn’t place importance on education.  He is married, and his wife takes care of the home and helps him with the corn planting. He has four children, two are in school and the other two have not started school yet.  No one else lives with them.

Juan has worked in farming since he was seven years old, and he learned the work from his father who said that it was better to learn to work than to study.  But Juan thinks differently because he is unable to read. On the other hand, he is grateful to his father for having taught him the work as it has served him in getting his family ahead.  He plants corn and sorghum, and his day begins at 4:30 a.m. He arises early to milk his cow and then take her back to the pasture.  It takes him thirty minutes to walk to his job, where he works for six hours and returns home.  In the evenings, he works on the crops.  He will invest the loan in the purchase of seeds, manure, and weed killer.  

His dream is for his daughters get an education and be prepared for the future, since he didn’t have that opportunity.  He also wishes to purchase a piece of and build a home (currently, he lives with his father-in-law), and pay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, and weed killer for the crops.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Adelaida works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig-fattening and a general store. Adelaida is borrowing PHP 9,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle transportation business.

Adelaida has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en:
Mr. Erdenebat, 53 years old, lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering a taxi service to local people since 2004. He has five children and all of them live separately. 

His youngest daughter studies at medical college and is currently facing financial difficulty. So, Erdenebat is requesting a loan of MNT 1,800,000 for his daughter. His daughter will spend the money on her studies and will pay for dormitory fees.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's studies and dormitory fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase traditional skirts, ponchos, sheets, etc.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites previously accessed a PHP 12,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of PHP 17,000 to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell should result in greater profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marites dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to have their own house. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn, 48, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Dante, an electrician, and they have children. Together with her husband, Evelyn manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Evelyn maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. Evelyn's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, Evelyn is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. 

Evelyn dreams to expand her business more and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Ruhshona

texts.ru: Рухшона очень добрая и способная девушка. Она окончила среднюю школу с отличием. Еще со школьной скамьи она мечтала стать учительницей и работать в школе как ее учителя. После окончания средней школы она продолжила свою учебу. Данное время она работает в средней школе своего кишлака. Она преподает средним классам. Одновременно с педагогической деятельностью, она учится в университете для того, чтобы получить высшее образование. Она данное время нуждается финансовой поддержке, так как она должна оплатить за учебный договор. Рухшона запрашивает займ на сумму 2300 сомони для оплаты учебы в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ruhshona is a very kind and capable young woman. She graduated from a secondary school with excellence. Since the school desk, she dreamed of becoming a teacher and working at a school just like her teachers. After completing the secondary school, she continued her studies. At the present time, she works at a secondary school in her village. She teaches middle grades. Concurrently with her school work, she attends a university in order to get a higher education. She currently needs financial assistance to pay for her university tuition. Ruhshona is requesting a loan in the amount of 2300 somoni to pay for her university studies. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is 47 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Nona works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like biscuits, bread, spices and vegetables. Nona has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from clothing sales and food vending.

Nona aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like biscuits, bread, spices and vegetables.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is 46 years old and married with six children, five of whom are in school. Alberta works very hard to provide for them.

Alberta's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Alberta has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. Alberta has taken a 9,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using the this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Alberta is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future, would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Santos Maritza

texts.es:
Santos tiene 47 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, esta casada y su esposo se dedica a la albañilería, tienen 4 hijos pero 2 ya están acompañados y solo 2 viven con ellos y ninguno estudia.

Santos se dedica a los trabajos domésticos, desde que tiene 12 años pero hace 19 años trabaja de oficios varios en la clínica de la mujer y los fines de semana hace pupusas en su casa, antes de tener ese trabajo en la clínica, ella vendía frutas de forma ambulante y se dedicaba a lavar y planchar etc, y para llegar a su trabajo actual hace un recorrido de 10 minutos a pie.



El crédito sera invertido para reparar el techo de su casa, comprara, madera nueva y tela. 

Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda, comprar terreno para dejarles a sus hijos donde construir su casa y pagar el crédito para tener las puertas abiertas.
texts.en:
Santos is 47 years old. She finished high school. She is married and her husband is a mason. She has four children, however two are married and only two live with them and none are in school.

Santos has made a living in domestic work since she was 12 years old but for 19 years she has been performing different tasks in the women’s clinic and on weekends she makes pupusas at home. Before she had work at the clinic, she sold fruit as a street vendor and she washed and ironed, etc. In order to arrive at her current job she has a ten minute walk.

The loan will be used to repair the roof of her house. She will buy new wood and fabric. Her dream is to improve her dwelling, to purchase land to leave to her children where they can build their houses and to pay the loan in order to keep the doors open to future loans.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her house and buy new wood and fabric.

loans.name: Dúo Genesis 2 Group

texts.es: Dúo Genesis 2  Conformado por la señora Elvia de 35 años de edad, quien es propietaria de una tortillería y madre de 4 hijos de los cuales el ultimo es un niño especial la señora Elvia tiene aproximadamente 12 años de tener su negocio de tortillas menciona ella que le ha ayudado pues con las ganancias que ella ha obtenido ha podido contribuir con la construcción  de su casa, la señora Elvia no quiere ni desea que sus hijos tengan un nivel de vida como el que ella en su niñez tuvo si no que sueña y desea que sus hijos crezcan estudien y se conviertan en personas profesionales pero a la vez esta consiente que eso solo lo lograra con mucho esfuerzo y mucha perseverancia por lo que toca las puertas de FAPE  para que se le otorgue  en crédito para la compra  de materia prima para su negocio  ya que el comprar por mayor cuenta con dicha de obtener descuentos y desde ya agradece que se le tome en cuenta dicha solicitud.
texts.en:
A member of Duo Genesis 2, Mrs. Elvia is 35 years old.  She is the proprietor of a tortilla shop and the mother of 4 children, the youngest of whom is a special child. For approximately 12 years, Elvia has had her tortilla business. She says that it has helped her, since with these earnings, she has been able to contribute to the construction of her house.

Elvia neither wants nor desires that her children should have to face the level of life she did in her youth. Rather, she wants and dreams that her children should grow and study, becoming professional people. And at the same time, she is aware that this can only be achieved with great effort and perseverance. 

For that reason, she knocked on the doors at FAPE, requesting a loan for purchasing prime materials for her business, since buying in larger quantities, results in discounts. She will be very grateful if her request is seriously considered.

loans.use: to buy corn at a discount for making and selling tortillas.

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en: Tuya is 39 years old and lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been making and selling silk dresses to local people since 2009. Her husband works for the police department. She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as cement, steel, and bricks in order to build a garage. The high-quality garage will guarantee the safe operation of her automobile and reduce the smoke emitted.

loans.use: to build a garage

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La socia Lucia sigue dedicándose al negocio de elaboración de artes, pulseras entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su  negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales como pulseras, hilos entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Member Lucia continues to dedicate her efforts to creating works of art, including bracelets among other things. She has for some time dedicated herself to the business, which brings her satisfaction, economic as well as personal. Lucia wishes to continue working in this manner, and to continue helping her family.

Lucia is requesting a small loan to purchase materials such as bracelets and thread, among other things.

Lucia feels grateful for the offer of a loan and promises to comply with her established schedule of payments.

loans.use: to buy materials such as bracelets, and thread, among other items.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Konobougou, commune Konobougou, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments, de poisson fumé, de bois, de chaussure et de sachet plastique. Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente INA , deuxième personne à partir de la gauche est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de chaussure en plastique. Elle compte acheter 120 paires de chaussures pour femme chez les grossistes à Bamako. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Benkadi Group is made up of married women with an average age of 36 and three children each. They all live within the frameworks of traditional families in the village of Konobougou, in the commune of Konobougou, Baroueli Prefecture, Ségou Region (the fourth administrative area of the Republic of Mali). They all know each other through the bonds of family, community and friendship. They work in the restaurant business and in the commerce of condiments, smoked fish, wood, shoes and plastic bags.

This will be the eighth loan for the women of the Benkadi Group. In order to satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso. The requested loan amount will go towards the aforementioned merchandise.

Ina, the woman standing second from the left in the photo, is illiterate. She currently sells plastic shoes. She plans on buying 120 pairs of shoes from the wholesalers in Bamako. She sells her stock for cash out of her own home and at market to a mixed customer base. She plans on making a monthly profit of 80,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested into her business.

loans.use: Achat de chaussures

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to his home and to pay for personal expenses.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is a responsible mother who owns and manages a small retail store to help her husband in gaining income. She is 42 years old and blessed with six children. Flora aims to improve her retail store and increase her income to support the education of her children. Having inadequate capital, she wants to borrow PHP10,000.00 to purchase rice, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, beverages, seasonings, snack foods, and soft drinks to sell. Through this financial assistance, she believes someday she will improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase rice, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, beverages, seasonings, snack foods, and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Elve

texts.en:
Elve is 30 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Elve is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Elve has been raising pigs for three years and also earns income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 26 years old and has one child in school.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Analyn is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Analyn has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. 

With your help, Analyn can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 8,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Anita will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 48 years old, and married with four children. Loreta lives in Purok 6 Clarin, Philippines.
Loreta sells assorted goods to earn a living and has had this business for seven years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 from her business. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to restock her store with basic commodities.
Loreta has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Loreta hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is married with four children. Anecita is 64 years old and lives in Situbo, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Anecita is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested additional working capital to purchase fertilizers.

Anecita hopes have good production of corn this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en: Feliciana is 59 years old, married, and is from Garang, Tangub City. She farms a rice field as a primary source of income. With her determination and hard work, she sent all her children to college to earn bachelor degrees. Feliciana has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for six years. She borrowed PHP 12,000.00 to pay for her son's safety at sea course required of all seamen. She does believe that the success of being a mother is to see all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to pay for her son's seaman course

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 55 years old and married with five children. Elvie lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Philippines.
Elvie sells assorted goods to earn a living and has had this business for six years. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000 from her business. She has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy needed materials and equipment to repair her house. Elvie has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, Elvie hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy needed materials and equipment for house repair

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a resident of Pasay, Philippines. She is 46 years old and she is happily married to Venancio, who works as jeepney driver. God has blessed them with three loving children and all of them are still studying. Life indeed is hard. But by the grace of God, they were able to raise their children well and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Lilibeth owns a variety store.This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the store is just connected to or just inside their house. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg and other things. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price, then she will sell it per piece for a higher price to have profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passerby and the people in the community. She earns Php 300 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Lilibeth desires that her business will continue to grow, and she dreams for her children to finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. She also draws strength from studying the word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 32 years old and married with three children, two in school. Emelia works very hard to provide for them.

Emelia's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Emelia has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with a safe shelter.
