Emelia has taken out a PHP 8,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Emelia is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a cost-effective and clean-cooking liquefied petroleum gas energy package.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is 57 years old, married, and has four children.  

Florenda and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

She is taking out a housing loan amounting to Php 8,500 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Florenda has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her general store.

With your help, Florenda can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. 

In future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of 12 children, four in school, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening and farming sugarcane. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 60,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: La Fe Group

texts.en:
The six entrepreneurial women of the Faith group live in the small community of El Triunfo, Santa Lucia Milpas Altas, about 20 minutes away from the city of Antigua, Guatemala. They named their group Faith because they have faith that working with Namaste will have a significant effect on their businesses. They will be provided with basic financial training, a business advisor to help them develop and follow a business plan, and a small loan. Within the group there are a variety of businesses such as tortilla sales, making and selling furniture, selling shirts, and a very small store.
Dora (second from left), the woman with the small store, is 52 years old, married and has four grown children, who have finished their education and live with their own families.  She looks after two of her grandchildren. Dora has a fourth grade education and her husband works as a metal worker to contribute to the family income. In her little storefront she sells goods people want daily such as food, drinks and snacks.  She is open every day and doesn’t have much competition because she is one of the few stores in her neighborhood.  She buys her products in Antigua to get a better price.
Her current net profit is 800 Guatemalan Quetzales and she is projecting a 50% increase to 1200 Guatemalan Quetzales by the end of the nine-month loan cycle.  She will be using her loan to buy more products for her store and also for a new shelf so she can display more of her wares.

loans.use: to buy more products for her store and also for a new shelf so she can display more of her wares

loans.name: Orbelina

texts.es: Orbelina tiene 49 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus cuatro hijos. Orbelina es una mujer muy trabajadora quien se gana la vida por medio de la prestación de servicios domésticos y es así como junto a su compañero de vida quien es albañil llevan el sustento a su hogar. Orbelina desea introducir el servicio de agua potable en su vivienda pero no cuenta con los recursos económicos suficientes para hacer el desembolso por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en instalación del vital líquido que tanta falta le hace y así dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Orbelina is 49 years old and lives with her life partner and their 4 children in their own home. Orbelina is a very hard-working woman who makes her living by doing domestic work and together with her life companion who is a bricklayer they manage to support their household. Orbelina wants to add running water to her house but does not have sufficient economic resources for this expenditure. So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the installation of this precious liquid that they lack and doing so improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to install running water in her house.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 47 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is separated, and has three children who are now adults.
 
Elsa is engaged in managing a little store, and has been selling groceries and other consumable products for five years already. She earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional groceries and other consumable products to sell.

Elsa has been a member of PMPC for nine years. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries and other consumable products to sell.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Buying and reselling of fruits and vegetables is the primary activity of Melita within her community. She is 41 years old and blessed with five children. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Melita wants to make her business more profitable in order to satisfy the necessities of her family and support the schooling of her children. 

Having inadequate capital, Melita wants to avail herself of a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy additional stocks of cucumbers, squashes, tomatoes, onions, cabbages, beans, and potatoes to sell. Being a patient and industrious mother, she believes that she will be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of cucumbers, squashes, tomatoes, onions, cabbages, beans, and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 48 years old and lives in Catadman, Ozamiz City. She is married, with three children. 

Judith requested a loan to buy a variety of fruits to sell. She is hopeful of earning more money, with enough inventory. Judith hopes to save more money in the future.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits to sell.

location.town: Ozamis-P9 Catadman, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 45 years old and married with five children.

Judy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Judy has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years, and also earns an income from rice retailing.

She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Siguidolo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SIGUIDOLO est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Konobougou, commune Konobougou, préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de poisson fumé, de lait et de bijou. Les femmes du groupe SIGUIDOLO sont à leur vingtième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente KARIDIATOU, première personne à partir de la gauche est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de poisson fumé. Elle compte acheter 1 carton de poisson chez les grossistes à Ségou. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce à Konobougou à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Siguidolo Group is made up of married women with an average age of 34 and three children each. They all live within the frameworks of traditional families in the town of Konobougou, in the commune of Konobougou, Barouéli Prefecture, Ségou Region (the fourth administrative area of the Republic of Mali). They all know each other through the bonds of family, community and friendship. They earn a living from the buying and selling of condiments, smoked fish, milk and jewellery.

This will be the twentieth loan for the women of the Seguidolo Group. In order to satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso. The requested loan amount will go towards the aforementioned merchandise.

Karidiatou, the first woman on the left, is illiterate. She currently works as a vendor of smoked fish. She plans on buying one carton of fish from the wholesalers in Ségou. She sells her stock for cash in Konobougou to a mixed customer base. She plans on making a monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested into her business.

loans.use: to purchase smoked fish

loans.name: Bartolome

texts.en:
Bartolome is 37 years old and lives in Carmen, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married, with three children now at their school age. 

Bartolome has been engaged in managing a little sari-sari store, together with his wife, for two years already. The family is also earning income from a parcel of cocoland. He earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month from doing this type of work. At present, he is also an elected Barangay official. 

Bartolome has requested a loan to be used to acquire an additional parcel of cocoland that is pawned to him. Bartolome has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for two years. 

In the future, Bartolome hopes to acquire more parcels of cocoland to add to his family's income.

loans.use: to acquire an additional parcel of cocoland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural products for his corn crops.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Marivic works hard to support her family.

Marivic has a food vending business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from pig fattening. She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Marivic has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Los Jardines Group

texts.es:
Soraida Doménica, tiene 26 años de edad, tiene dos niños pequeños. Ella forma parte del grupo "Los Jardines" que está formado por seis integrantes. 
Hace aproximadamente dos años ella se dedica a la elaboración de chompas, decorado y bordado de sabanas y colchas. Gracias a su habilidad en las manualidades éste negocio le permite cubrir los gastos de sus hijos.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de hilos, lana, y accesorios de decoración para los trabajos solicitados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Soraida Doménica is 26 years old and has two small children. She is a part of the group "Los Jardines", which is made up of 6 members.  For approximately two years she has made a living producing sweaters and decorating and embroidering sheets and bedspreads.
 
Thanks to her skill in handicrafts, this business allows her to cover her children's expenses.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of thread, wool, and decorative accessories for the work solicited by her clients.

loans.use: to invest in materials for handicrafts, such as thread, wool and other materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish constructing an annex for a room which he will plaster, tile, and install zinc metal sheeting onto.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
To generate income, Jocelyn engages in buying and reselling fish and meat within her community. She is 33 years old and single. She is industrious and acts like a gentle person. Her ambition in life is to become successful and financially stable in the future. She operates her motorcycle transport to deliver her goods within the local community.

She wants to acquire more stock of the said products to sell, but she has not enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000. She will use it to purchase more stock, including fish, pork, frozen foods, and chicken to sell. Through this financial assistance, Jocelyn believes that she will make her business more viable and profitable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock, including fish, pork, frozen foods, and chicken

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is 64 years old and lives in Lupagan, Clarin, Philippines. She is single without children. 

Leonor has a medicine business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to buy more medicines to cater customer needs.

Leonor has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, Leonor hopes to supplement her family's income and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more medicines to cater to customer needs

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is married with five children. Minda is 61 years old and lives in Lupagan, Clarin, Philippines.

Minda sells variety of goods to earn a living and has had this business for 15 years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to restock her store with basic commodities.

Minda has been a member of PMPC for six years.  In the future, Minda hopes to supplement her family's income and to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline earns a living, offering several products for sale. She is 53 years old, married, and lives in Bolos, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is well-known for the nice quality of service she offers. She has already purchased some new shoes, bags and accessories for her direct-selling activity, and was able to save from it. Her business is self-sustaining and has become profitable, with a net profit of about PHP 5,000 per month.

Evangeline is seeking a PHP 5,000 loan. She would like to use the loan to purchase additional shoes, bags and accessories to sell. Evangeline is very diligent and loves accuracy, which adds to her effective management of her venture.

loans.use: To purchase additional shoes, bags and accessories to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for clean cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for clean and efficient cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum gas

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 55 years old and married with four children. Angelina works very hard to provide for them.

Angelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Angelina has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Angelina would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Martiso

texts.en:
Martiso is 35 years old and married; she has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for three years, and she also earns income from rice retailing.

Martiso has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it in order to purchase more groceries to sell at her general store. She has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF, before this loan.

Martiso aspires to save money, to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 51 years old and married. She has four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in business for twenty years.

Luz requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to buy more fish to sell, at her food stall.

In the future, Luz would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hair extensions, shoes and fabrics

loans.name: Salvador De Jesus

texts.es: Don salvador de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cinco hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, Don salvador esta solicitando un  crédito para la compra de: semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas y de mas herramientas para poder tener un buen cultivo, y asi el podrá tener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a darle  a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Salvador is 58 years old; he lives in his own home with his wife and five children. He grows corn and beans and sells his products in the different markets that are found near his place of residence. 

Mr. Salvador is requesting this loan to buy: seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest controls, herbicides and other tools to have a good harvest and that way have better earnings which will help him give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy: seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest controls, herbicides and other tools

loans.name: Savath

texts.en:
Savath is 35 years old. She is a married woman with two children.  They live in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She is a factory laborer and her husband is a farmer. Both of them earn approximately $11 per day. 

She would like to apply for loan of $600 USD to purchase cows to breed. In the future, she hopes that she can build a house as soon as possible and her children can earn a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase cows to breed.

loans.name: Maria Riza

texts.en:
Maria Riza is 41 years old, married and a resident of Bita-ug, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor. She earns a living through selling longganisa and hotdogs. 

She has been a member of PMPC for almost one year and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional ingredients for longganisa processing.

Maria Riza deeply wishes to remain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingedients for longganisa processing.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 65 years old and lives in Lupagan Clarin, Philippines. She is married with five children.
 
Ester has a motorcycle business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to pay for the repair of her motorcab.

Ester has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Ester hopes to save for consumption.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of her motorcab

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative ("PMPC") in the year 2012. She appreciates the programs, services, and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that PMPC offers.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 6,000. This loan is intended to purchase additional feed and piglets.

Bebelyn dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life, and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and piglets.

loans.name: Marrieta

texts.en:
Marrieta is 53 years old and lives in Poblacion Sinacaban, Philippines. She is married and has three children.

Marrieta has a motor and vehicle business. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this work. She has requested a loan to purchase needed equipment for her motor/vehicle shop.

Marrieta has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Marrieta hopes to supplement her family's income and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase needed equipment for her motor/vehicle shop

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is married and has five children. She is 60 years old and lives in Sinuza, Tudela, Philippines.

Antonia is a farmer, and she grows corn crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizer and for labor expenses.

Antonia has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Antonia hopes to save for future emergencies and to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for farm labor

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 55 years old and lives in Naga, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 2 adult children.
 
Lorna has been in the food processing and vending  business for 2 years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP each month. 

She has requested a loan to purchase meat, spices and seasonings for her food vending business. 

Lorna has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. In the future, Lorna hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: to purchase meat, spices and seasonings.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 42 years old, married, and has four children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years.

Mary Jane requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more fish to sell to customers.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José tiene 57 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado en la escuela, actualmente está acompañado y su pareja es ama de casa tiene un hijo que le ayuda en el trabajo en el campo el cual no estudia por la situación económica. 

José se ha dedicado a la ganadería  y agricultura desde hace 25 años, él lo aprendió desde pequeño junto a su padre, por lo cual decidió dedicarse a esto.
El trabajo le queda a una distancia de 30 minutos de su casa y viaja caminando, el horario de trabajo es de seis de la mañana a una de la tarde. 

Necesita el crédito para cultivar más porque de esa forma podrá vender más productos y tener mejores ingresos, la necesidad satisfecha será que podrá comprar los abonos, fertilizantes y así tener lo principal para hacer su cultivo. 

El sueña con mejorar su casa, también desea volver a estudiar pues piensa que nunca es tarde.
texts.en:
Jose is 57 years old, he has 2nd grade studies, he currently has a partner, she is a housewife, he has a son that helps him with work at the farm.  His son doesn’t study because of the economic situation.

Jose has worked in livestock and agriculture for 25 years, he learned this activity from his father when he was a kid, reason why he decided on it as his activity.

Work is a 30 minute commute from home and he walks to get there, his work schedule is from six in the morning to one in the afternoon.

He needs the loan to grow more crops because this way he will be able to sell more products and have more income, he will be able to purchase the fertilizers he needs and have the main inputs to get his crops.

He dreams to improve his house, he also wishes to study again because he thinks that it’s never too late to do so.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to increase his crop production.

loans.name: Bark-Wende Group

texts.fr:
Mme WENDINDA représente le groupe  BARK-WENDE. Mariée, elle est mère d’un (01) enfant. Il est âgé de 02ans.
Mme vend des chaussures et habits  depuis 04ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. 
Mme veut s’acheter 03douzaines de chaussures et 03douzaines d’habits.
Avec  ses bénéfices, elle veut renforcer son activité. Mme ambitionne ouvrir une grande boutique pour son activité.
texts.en:
Wendinda represents the Bark-Wende group. She is married and the mother of a two-year-old child. 

Wendinda has been selling shoes and clothing for 4 years. She stocks up at the market in her area. Wendinda wants to purchase 3 dozen pairs of shoes and 3 dozen articles of clothing. With the proceeds, she wants to expand her business. Her goal is to open a large shop for her business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 dozen pairs of shoes and 3 dozen pieces of clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for clean and efficient cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 52 years old, married, and has eleven children. Josephine has a retail business to sell a variety of items. 

She experiences ups and downs in her business but she works hard for the sake of her family. She became a member of PMPC to expand her business. She applied for a loan to purchase dry goods and plasticware to sell.

Josephine wishes to sustain her business and continually provide for the needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase dry goods and plasticware to sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 51 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has children, all of whom are now at their adult age.

Rosario has been engaged in her hog-fattening activity for three years, already. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month, doing this business activity. She has requested a loan, to be used in purchasing an additional eight sacks of booster and grower feeds, for her existing business.

Rosario has been a member of PMPC for almost four years. In the future, Rosario hopes to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of booster and grower feeds for pigs

loans.name: Calixta

texts.en:
Calixta is 50 years old and lives in Mialem, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children; 2 are adults and 1 attends school.
 
Calixta has raised hogs for 8 years and earns approximately 1,000.00 PHP each month. She has requested a loan to purchase construction materials to repair her home.
 
Calixta has been a member of PMPC for almost 1 year. In the future, Calixta hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to repair her house.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es: Tomas de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos, el se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, Tomas estas solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía, para poder continuar con sus cultivos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: Tomas, 61, lives in his own home with his wife and children.  He is a farmer who cultivates corn and beans.  He sells his products in the various markets near his home.  Tomas is requesting a loan to buy seeds, chemical and organic fertilizers, and pesticides, and to pay for improving the soil on the land in the photograph.  This way, he can continue to grow his crops and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides, and to improve the soil on his land

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 56 years old and married with 3 children, one attends school, Lilia works very hard to provide for them.

Lilia's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Lilia has restarted her business and needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Lilia has taken a 9,500 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family's home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for the costs of construction.

Lilia is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Lorylin

texts.en:
Lorylin is 33 years old with two  children, one attends school. Lorylin works very hard to provide for them.

Lorylin's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Lorylin has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Lorylin has taken a 45,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family's home.

She is using the this loan purchase building materials and pay the costs of construction.

Lorylin is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future, would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and requests a 5,500 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Jessica will be able to rebuild her devastated life.

In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 47 years old and married with five children; one child attends school. 

She is a very hard working entrepreneur and has been selling fist for twenty years.  Nilda has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

 In the future, Nilda would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is a 46-year-old married woman with seven children. Two of her children attend school. 

Cresencia has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Cresencia requested 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Cresencia has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Cresencia would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna de 43 años de edad, es viuda ya que su esposo padecía de una enfermedad que le arrebato la vida en un instante.

Ella tiene su pequeña granja desde hace 5 años, la cual la monto con su esposo y junto a sus hijos ha luchado para mantenerla hasta que pudo construir una galera formal como la que actualmente tiene donde haya mejores condiciones para los pollos y esta mejor estructurado ya que tiene dividido por semanas a cada camada de pollos y asi puede llevar un mejor control de ellos y de las enfermedades que los atacan. 

El préstamo se empleara para la compra de un vehículo para el transporte de los pollos para su respectivo reparto a los clientes, lo necesiten ya que actualmente nos poseen uno para dicho propósito.

Su sueño a futuro son incrementar la producción y ya tener contrato con comedores y restaurantes de la zona.
texts.en:
Reyna is a 43 year old widow since her husband suffered from an illness which snatched away his life in an instant.

She has had a small chicken farm for 5 years which she put together with her husband. She, along with her children, struggled to maintain it until she could construct a formal chicken pen like the one she currently has. There are better conditions for the chickens and it is structured better since she has each flock of chickens separated out by week. In this way she can better keep track of them and of the sicknesses which attack them.

The loan will be used to buy a vehicle to transport and distribute the chickens to the corresponding customers. They need this since they do not currently possess a vehicle for this purpose. 

Her future dream is to increase production and to have contracts with eateries and restaurants in the area.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle for transporting chickens.

loans.name: Rutilio Antonio

texts.es: Rutilio de 54 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz. Se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante 20 años de su vida y es así como se gana el pan de cada día. Él es un hombre trabajador, responsable y muy conocido en la zona por su enorme corazón y amabilidad para con los demás. Rutilio vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos. Debido a que ya es temporada de siembra tomo la decisión de comenzar a prepararse. Es por esa razón que ha decidido solicitar este nuevo crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía. Lo que más desea es que su cosecha sea abundante y mejor que las anteriores, ya que esta es la forma en que él consigue el sustento para su familia. Confía en Dios que con su ayuda, su dedicación y empeño en el  trabajo lograra el sueño de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rutilio, 54, is a farmer who cultivates corn.  He's been doing this for the last 20 years of his life; this is how he earns a living.  He is a hardworking and responsible man who is well known in the area for his great heart and kindness to others.  Rutilio lives in his own house with his wife and children.  

Because this is the planting season, he decided to start to make preparations.  This is why he decided to request this new loan from Integral to invest in seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, etc, and to improve his soil on the land shown in the photograph.  What Rutilio wants most is to have an abundant harvest, better than in previous years, because this is how he supports his family.  Rutilio trusts that with God's help, and with hard work and dedication, he will achieve his dream of improving his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to improve his soil

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, comercializa sus productos en las agencias de compra venta de granos básicos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Manuel esta solicitando un crédito para la  y asi poder tener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Manuel is 43 years old, he lives in his own house with his wife and their four children. He makes a living farming corn and sorghum and he sells his product in the buying and selling agencies for staple grains. He manages to afford some household expenses with what he earns from his sales. Manuel is asking for a loan to be able to have a larger income and to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest controls, etc.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel de 45 años de edad se dedica desde hace 20 años al cultivo de maíz, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona y tiene mucha clientela por la calidad y los buenos  precios, Miguel está solicitando un crédito para la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: controles de plagas, abonos, herbicidas, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. y también para mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y asi darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Miguel, 45, has been farming for 20 years, cultivating corn.  He sells his products in the areas surrounding his neighborhood, and he has many customers because of his good quality and prices.  Miguel is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies that he needs, such as: pesticides, chemical and organic fertilizers, herbicides, seeds, etc.  He will also use the loan to improve the soil on the land shown in the photograph.  This way, he can give his family everything they need.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to improve the soil on his land

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet and her family live in a rural community. She is 39 years old and has three school-aged children. 

She buys and sells fruit and vegetables and her husband works on their farm. She aims to make her business more profitable in order to satisfy the necessities of her family and educate her children. 

Due to insufficient capital, she wants to borrow 20,000.00 PHP to purchase potatoes, tomatoes, beans, squash, eggplant, cabbages\, and onions to sell.
 
Juliet is a patient and industrious mother who believes that she will make her business profitable.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, tomatoes, beans, squash, eggplant, cabbage, and onions.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 63 years old and married with three children.

Alicia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Alicia has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Alicia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Era

texts.en:
Ma. Era is 54 years old, married and has four children.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out.

Ma. Era is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,500 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Ma. Era has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her food vending.

With your help, Ma. Era can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Angelee

texts.en:
Angelee is a 24-year-old married woman with two school-aged children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur and has had a fruit vending business for 3 years. She requested 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more fruit to sell in her fruit stand.

 Angelee would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to sell in her fruit stand.

loans.name: Ma. Alma Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Alma Victoria is 48 years old and has three school-aged children.  

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. However, her business and family home was destroyed. 

Ma. Alma Victoria is taking out a 9,500 PHP housing  loan to  purchase building materials and pay for construction costs to build a house for her family. 

She has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to earn money through her food vending business.

With your help, she can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she  would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs.

loans.name: Zenda

texts.en:
Zenda is 44 years old and married, with five children.

Zenda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell.

Zenda has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from selling flowers.

Zenda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is 32 years old and has five children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

She and her family  survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was destroyed. 

Maricar is taking out a housing loan amounting to 8,500 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs to build a house for her family. 

She has been an NWTF borrower since 2012 and plans to earn an incomoe hrough her general store.

With your help, Maricar can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she  would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Arsenia works hard to support her family.

She has a rope-making business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear. Arsenia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional raw materials for her business.

Arsenia has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Revica

texts.en:
Revica is 26 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Revica works very hard to provide for them.

Revica's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Revica has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Revica has taken a PHP 4,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Revica is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Zeny

texts.en:
Zeny is 36 years old and has three children.  Zeny is married and has three children who are in school.

Zeny and her family survived super-typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

She is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 8,500 to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Zeny has been a NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Zeny can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super-typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn works hard to support her family. She has a live-in partner and has a business buying and selling firewood in the Philippines.

Jenalyn requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional firewood to sell.

Jenalyn has been in this business for five years now.

Jenalyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 34 years old and a married mother of three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Evelyn has an abaca-weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy new supplies for her abaca weaving.

Evelyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Juliebee

texts.en:
Juliebee is single and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Juliebee requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more packs of frozen foods and materials for her business.

Juliebee has been in this business for three years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen foods and materials for her business.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and requests an 8,500 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, she will be able to rebuild her devastated life.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs.

loans.name: Sunday Christopher

texts.en: Sunday Christopher is a 28-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in the commercial farming of a banana plantation and also provides motorcycle transportation services.  In his line of work, he faces challenges of the price fluctuation of bananas as well as the challenge of poor roads.  Even so, he has a vision of developing his business into a self supporting one.  Sunday Christopher needs a loan to buy doors for his house.

loans.use: to buy doors for his house.

loans.name: Peluce

texts.en:
Peluce is a 45-year-old widow with eight children; 4  attend school. 

She has been in the agriculture business for twenty years and provides rentals as additional income. 

Peluce started the business to generate income and wants money to renovate her rental houses. Peluce is a hardworking woman and is challenged when tenants do not pay on time.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Sonia Linda

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 32 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, ella esta casada y es muy trabajadora, pues da clases en un centro de bienestar infantil, también tiene una moto taxi con la que transporta gente hacia en el pueblo, su esposo se dedica a manejar una moto taxi, tienen 2 hijos.

Sonia tiene mucha experiencia de trabajo, pues tiene ya 5 años de tener moto taxi y 8 años de prestar servicio como maestra, el trabajo de maestra lo consiguió por formar parte de una iglesia, donde por el buen comportamiento la eligieron. 

El crédito lo necesita para hacerle un ajuste a la moto taxi, pues considera que anda muchas piezas malas lo cual hace que se le dañe frecuentemente, ella piensa que se le ayudaría mucho pues no cuenta con el dinero para repararla.

Sus planes a futuro son que sus hijos sean profesionales y piensa hacer muy bien su trabajo como maestra para mantener el empleo por mucho tiempo.
texts.en:
Sonia is 32 years old and has a secondary school education. She is married and is very hardworking; she gives classes in a center for infant wellbeing, and also has a moto-taxi with which she transports people in the town. Her husband works as a moto-taxi driver and they have two children.

Sonia has a great deal of work experience, as she has already had her moto-taxi for five years and she has served as a teacher for eight years. She got her teaching job because she was a member of a church where she was chosen for her good behavior.

She needs the loan to do a tune-up on her moto-taxi, as she thinks that many parts are in bad shape, which causes it to frequently break down on her. She thinks that it would help her a lot because she doesn't have the money to repair it.

Her future plans are for her children to be professionals; she plans to do her work as a teacher really well to keep her job for a long time.

loans.use: to do a tune-up on her moto-taxi.

loans.name: Victor  Hugo

texts.es: Victor de 46 años de edad desde hace muchos años se dedica a cultivar la tierra.  Con mucha dedicación cultiva sandia, plátanos y maíz, lo cual le permite llevar el  pan de cada día a su hogar. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honrado y responsable. Habita junto a su  grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposa y sus hijos. Junto a su esposa trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia y darles mejores condiciones a las que ellos han tenido. Gracias a los conocimientos en la agricultura es como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar. Con muchos deseos de superación se acerco a esta institución para solicitar crédito para la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios: semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc.  para la siembra y mejora el terreno. Confía en Dios y en su trabajo que de esta forma logrará  tener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá tener a una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en: Victor is 46 years old and for many years has worked farming the land. With lots of dedication he grows watermelons, plantains, and corn which allows him to support his household every day. He is characterized by being a hardworking, honorable, and honest man. He lives together with his family group which is made up of his wife and kids. Together with his wife they work hard to move their family forward and give them better conditions than what they have had. Thanks to the knowledge of farming he is able to support his home. With many dreams of improvement he came to this institution to request a loan for the purchase of necessary farming supplies: seeds, compost, insecticides, etc. for the sowing and improvement of the land. He trusts in God and his work that in this way he will achieve having an abundant harvest which will permit him to have a better quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, insecticides, etc. and improve the land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens in bulk and feed

loans.name: Los Lirios Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS LIRIOS” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Enola es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: taller de costura, venta de dulces, venta de ropa, venta de celulares, pensión, venta de edredones, tienda de barrio, tejido de ropa de bebe.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Enola es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió al observar que este negocio era de gran venta en el mercado paceño, es por ello que decide emprender este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de víveres por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito, los ahorro , el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Los Lirios Group is starting its sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Senkata Regional Hub. It is made up of eight members, and it is run by an executive board, of which Enola is president. The members of this community group's businesses are varied, and include a tailoring workshop, candy sales, clothing sales, cell phone sales, a guesthouse, eiderdown sales, a neighbourhood shop, and making baby's clothing.

The loan they receive will benefit member micro-entrepreneurs like Enola. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for three years, having joined on the invitation of a friend who is also a member. She currently has a business selling food, and notes that she learned this line of work on observing that it was an area of business with big sales in the La Paz market, which is why she decided to start her business. 

She will use the loan to increase her capital for buying supplies wholesale. She will purchase these in the outdoor markets of the city of El Alto, and later when the food is prepared she will sell it in her place of business. This way of working allows her to earn enough resources to support her family, since she is single and has a child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the loans, the savings facilities, the health area, and the training sessions that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Porfirio de 22 años de edad, soltero sin hijo, es originario de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal.  Lamentablemente por falta de recurso económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligado a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracia  a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de cerdos. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio unas ocho horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de cerdos en pie. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Porfirio agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Porfirio is 22 years old, single, and doesn’t have children. He is from Leon, which is located in the north of the region. He is hardworking, responsible, and wants to get ahead in life.

Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, he wasn’t able to go to high school and had to work from a young age so he could help with the household expenses.

Because of his hard work and his desire to get ahead, he has a business selling pigs. The business is located at his house. He works eight hours daily offering his product. The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock his business of buying and selling pigs, so that in the not-too-distant future he can improve his income. Porfirio is grateful that the Kiva lenders provide assistance to people of scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have dignified work.

loans.use: to purchase a batch of pigs and to purchase feed for the pigs

loans.name: Tania Maria

texts.es:
Tania de 26 años de edad, soltera con un hijo menor de edad. Es originaria de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudor cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad p ara ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a su hijo.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, tiene por actividad económica, una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, jugos, detergentes, fósforos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Tania agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Tania is 26 years old, single and has a young child.  She is from Leon, a place that is located in the western zone of the country. She can be described as a hard worker, responsible, and with the desire to improve herself.  Unfortunately, because of a lack of resources, she couldn't study for a degree and had to work from a young age to help with the household expenses. Currently, she strives day by day to provide a better future for her child.

Thanks to her effort and her desire to get ahead, she has a convenience store which is a small store that sells groceries such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, juice, soap, and matches as her business.  She works at her business for twelve hours each day, offering her products. The goal of this loan is to invest in working capital and furnish her business in buying and selling groceries so that in the not-so-distant future, she can have a better income. Tania is thankful for the help that the Kiva investors bring to people with limited resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and furnish her business in the purchase of groceries such as: rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, juice, soap, and matches.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase toiletries, medicinal plants and cooking utensils

loans.name: Dúo Villa Lobos Ll Group

texts.es: Dúo Villa Lobos Ll este dúo esta conformado por la señora Sarai Noelia de 45 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace varios años,en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de producto comestibles ya que nececita invertir mas en su negocio para generar mas ganancias.
texts.en: Dúo Villa Lobos Ll - This duo includes Señora Sarai Noelia, age 45.  She has worked selling food for a number of years.  At this point, she is asking for a loan to buy consumable supplies because she needs to invest more in her business in order to generate higher earnings.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making and selling food

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 24 años de edad trabaja como vendedor en una pequeña empresa de su ciudad, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante y poder solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Carlos esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda como arreglos en la paredes de su vivienda, piso, entre otros y también podrá comprar electrodomésticos como una cocina a gas para su hogar; así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y podrá seguir trabajando prar poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su negocio propio”
texts.en:
Carlos, 24, works as a sales person at a small business in his city, which allows him to earn the income he needs get ahead and cover his household costs.

Carlos is grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help that they have provided him he will be able to make improvements to his house like fixing the walls, floor, and others as well as to buy appliances for his home like a gas stove. With these improvements he can improve his quality of living and he can continue working towards achieving his ultimate dream of having his own business.

loans.use: to improve his life and home by fixing the walls and floor as well as to buy appliances for his home like a gas stove

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 35 years old and married with four children. With three of her children currently in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like chocolate drinks, milk, juice, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as chocolate drinks, milk, juice, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. 

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like chocolate drinks, milk, juice, canned goods, and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita, a 40-year-old married mother of two, works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for nine years, and also earns an income from food vending.

Carmelita, who has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF, has requested a new one for PHP 20000 to purchase more stocks to sell such as soap, milk, sugar, cream, canned goods, etc. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell such as soap, milk, sugar, cream, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata, age 45, runs a general store business to earn an income. She has been engaged in this enterprise for 15 years. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

She and her husband have two children, one of whom is enrolled in school. 
 
Fortunata has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 24,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase grocery items to offer for sale.
 
In the future, Fortunata would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to offer for sale

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy buys and sells dry goods such as slippers and blouses to earn an income. She is a hard-working entrepreneur and has operated her enterprise for one year. She earns an additional income from running a computer shop.

Analy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She is currently requesting PhP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of dry goods such as slippers and blouses to offer for sale.
 
She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dry goods such as slippers and blouses to offer for sale

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen del Carmen está conformado por 10 personas. Quienes realizan distintas actividades de negocios. Entre sus integrantes está DELFINA. Quien desde hace 6 años se dedica a la cría y venta de pollos. Es una actividad la cual la desarrolla con mucho amor y dedicación. Gracias a esta labor. Puede brindar apoyo en educación a sus hijos a más del sustento diario en su hogar.
Al inicio fue muy difícil. Los pollitos se morían porque no tenía adecuado el patio de su casa. Los pollos se perdían y esto generaba perdidas.
Poco a poco hizo el cerramiento del patio y organizó un lugar para el galpón.
Con este crédito, DELFINA invertirá en la compra de pollos y balanceado para mejorar su actividad de cría de pollos. 
Cuando los pollos están listos (6 semanas) ella los vende en las tiendas del pueblo y con estos recursos compra más pollos pequeños.
Ella tiene deseos de ampliar el galpón y trabajar en la cría de unos 300 pollos pos mes. Con esto aumentaría sus ganancias y mejoraría sus ingresos para pagar su préstamo y cubrir sus necesidades. 
INFORMACION ADICIONAL
Cada integrante del grupo recibe $500,00 dólares, ellos se reúnen mensualmente para acordar el pago de la letra del crédito.
texts.en:
The "Virgen del Carmen" group is formed by ten people who have a variety of businesses. Among its members is Delfina, who has made a living by raising and selling chickens for the last six years. She has run her business with a lot of love and dedication. Thanks to this work, she has been able to provide support for her children's education as well as daily sustenance for her home. It was very difficult at the beginning; the chicks died because she hadn't made the patio of her house an appropriate space for them. The chickens were lost and that created losses. Little by little she closed up the patio and organized a place for the chicken coop.raising chickens. When the chickens are ready (6 weeks), she sells them in the stores in her town, and with these resources she buys more small chickens. She wants to expand the chicken coop and work on raising 300 chickens per month. With this she will increase her earnings and improve her income to pay off her loan and 

With this loan, Delfina will invest in buying chickens and a balanced diet in order to improve her business to cover her needs.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
Each member of the group receives $500.00. They meet monthly to make payments on the loan.

loans.use: to buy chickens and a balanced diet

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
Albina is a 52-year-old married mother of four children, one of whom is still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

For three years now, Albina has run a general store in the Philippines that sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits, eggs, bread, noodles, detergent soap, etc. She has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy additional such stocks to sell.

Albina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks such as candy, biscuits, eggs, bread, noodles, detergent soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Al- Fairouz Group

texts.en:
Al- Fairouz is a group of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They requested 230,000 YER from Al- Amal Microfinance Bank.

Amel is an engaged 25-year-old  leader of the group who lives with her family. 

She loves her family very much and does her best to help her parents. Her father started to expand the house and built new rooms for the large family.  However, there are not enough rooms for the family members. Amel wants to be an active member of her family and help her family to build  new rooms.  She decided to buy some construction supplies like cement and sand. 

Due to the fact that Amel doesn’t have enough money to purchase that construction materials, she has requested 70,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to buy construction supplies. 

Amel hopes that in the future, she'll be able to help her family build the second floor of their house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies like cement and sand to build new rooms in the house.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is a 37-year-old hardworking man with 3 children ages 4, 7 and 10.  They live in Fort Portal- Uganda. 

He started an agriculture business in 2009 to generate income. He faces challenges of weather changes but has a vision to expand his tea farm. 

Jimmy needs a loan to buy tea seedlings to expand his farm.

loans.use: to buy tea seedlings to expand his farm.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a tailor. In addition to running her tailoring business, she earns a supplemental income from buying and selling scrap materials. She and her husband have two children, and she works hard to support her family.

Anecita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She is currently requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 13,000 through NWTF in order to purchase materials and tools for her tailoring business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials and tools for her tailoring business

loans.name: Set Al-Banat Group

texts.en:
This group is called Set Al-Banat. It consists of five women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are hardworking and enterprising women. They took a loan of 320,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank. Sa'ada is the leader of the group. 

Sa'ada is a 44-year-old married woman with four children living with her in their own house in the capital city of Sana'a, Yemen.  Her oldest child is 15 years old and the youngest one is 8 years old. 

Sa'ada studied until elementary school, but she couldn't complete her studies. She works as a housewife, and her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. 

She is a very dynamic and ambitious woman. She has a lot of housework. Her house lacks many home appliances such as an oven and washing machine and the others, a television and refrigerator, are very old. She wants to change them, and she can't afford them. 

As a result, she decided to improve the condition of the family. Unfortunately, the income of her husband is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. For this reason, Sa'ada applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB in order to buy home appliances.

Sa'ada looks forward to renovating her house. She hopes to open a saving accounts with AMB.

loans.use: to buy home appliances.

loans.name: Abundia

texts.en:
Abundia is 52 years old and lives in Parasan, Molave Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with one child.

She is a fruits and vegetables vendor and earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month doing this type of business.

She has requested a loan to obtain additional capital to pay for stock like bananas, camote, guava, and mangoes. Abundia has been a member of PMPC for three years. 

In the future, Abundia hopes to expand her business and to have more financial support for their lives.

loans.use: to pay for stock like bananas, camote, guava, and mangoes.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 35 years old and married with four children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Sylvia's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a 7,000 PHP housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. Sylvia is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Sylvia is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Adiya

texts.en:
Adiya is 41 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for five years.

Adiya requested a 12,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Brian

texts.en:
Brian is a 29-year-old married man with one child living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

He has a photo studio alongside farming and running a bar to boost his income. He faces the challenges of bad debtors and high rental charges. However, he has a vision of expanding his business to new areas. 

Brian needs a loan to buy films and battery cells to use in his studio.

loans.use: to buy films and battery cells to use in his studio.

loans.name: Cherilyn

texts.en:
Cherilyn is 46 years old and a married mother of five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Cherilyn has an internet café business in the Philippines. Cherilyn requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy computer supplies for her internet café.

Cherilyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Cherilyn would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy computer supplies for her internet café.

loans.name: Zanesi

texts.en:
Zanesi, age 35, is a farmer. She grows and harvests bananas, Irish potatoes, maize, and beans. Her primary business challenge is price fluctuation.

She and her husband have two children. The family lives in Fort Portal.

Zanesi is requesting a loan in order to buy building materials such as cement to be used for construction.

Her vision is to work toward an improved and expanded business.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement to be used for construction

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta, age 52, is a farmer. She grows and harvests vegetables and watermelons to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for 25 years. She earns an additional income from running a food vending enterprise.

She and her husband have three children.

Crisanta is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 30,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to sufficiently build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farm supplies

loans.name: Jeverine

texts.en:
Jeverine is 27 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jeverine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Jeverine has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, beer, canned goods, sugar, salt, eggs, diapers, etc.

Jeverine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a 36-year-old married mother of two children, both of whom are in school.  A rice farmer in the Philippines for 10 years now, Rowena has received 11 past loans from NWTF to sustain her enterprise. She is now requesting a new one for PHP 25000 to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Rowena would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 51 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family.

She grabbed the opportunity to become a full fledged member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for her capital in supporting her gardening activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizer. In the future, Nida wishes to become the supplier of flowers to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools  and fertilizer

loans.name: Avellina

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Avellina works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening. Avellina is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

Avellina has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 38 years old and married, with five children. With three children in school, Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for two years and she sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merly, age 32, raises pigs to earn an income. She has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Merly and her husband have one child.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 19,000 NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. NWTF is re-listing Merly's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Dayha

texts.en:
Dayha, age 27, sells gasoline to earn an income. She has been engaged in this retail business for three years. She earns an additional income from operating a food vending enterprise.

She and her husband have three children and she works hard to provide for her family. 

Dayha has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She is currently requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy containers of gasoline to offer for sale.

She aspires to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy containers of gasoline to offer for sale

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marta works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Marta is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Marta has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other fishing materials

loans.name: Berginia

texts.en:
Berginia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Berginia is 42 years old and has one child who is in school. Berginia has a videoke machine rental business in the Philippines. Berginia requested a loan  of 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional units of videoke machines for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Berginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional units of videoke machines for her business

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is a barber who sufficiently provides for the family. At the age of 66, he aims to live comfortably with his children. 

As a Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) member, Ernesto applied for a loan to buy wood, nails, and cement. Ernesto is thankful that the Cooperative is supporting his financial needs, for his business, the education of his children, and even for their shelter.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, and cement for house repairs.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene owns and manages a small retail store within the local community. She is 48 years old and has four school-age children. She and her husband are aspiring to become financially stable in order to educate their children and give them better lives. In this regard, she plans to improve her retail store in order to increase her income. Having insufficient capital, she would like to obtain a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy more stocks of grocery items, rice, and feeds to resell. She believes that her patience and hard work will make it possible for her to improve the business and achieve her goals in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of grocery items, rice, and feeds to sell
