loans.name: Flor Marina

texts.es: Flor tiene 31 años de edad y habita ne casa propia junto a sus padres. Ella se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace mucho  tiempo. De esta forma desde muy joven ha colaborado con la economía de su familia y poco a poco van mejorando sus condiciones de vida. Actualmente en su hogar no cuenta con el servicio de agua potable por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la instalación del vital líquido que tanta falta les hace a ella y sus padres.
texts.en: Flor is 31 years old and lives with her parents at their own house.  She has worked for a really long time providing home cleaning services.  Since a very young age she has provided to the economy of her family and little by little her life conditions are improving.  Currently they don’t have water services at home and she has decided to request a loan to FUSAI to invest in installing this vital service that her and her parents need.

loans.use: to install water service at home

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Nelly works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening and vegetable vending. Nelly is borrowing 9,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell to customers.

Nelly has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is a married woman with twelve children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Clarita is 55 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Clarita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Clarita requested a 23,500 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Clarita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Clarita would like to save enough money so that she will be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Flodeliza

texts.en:
Flodeliza is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 50,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase vegetables, meat, spices, canned goods, etc. for her restaurant business.

Flodeliza has been in this business for 5 years. She earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

Flodeliza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so that she will be able to afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meat, spices, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Bertha  Alicia

texts.es:
Bertha es una señora de 52 años, vive junto a una hija que está por ingresar a la universidad en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados, ciudad conocida en el Ecuador porque habita la etnia Tsachila. 
Bertha vive separada de su ex conyugue hace varios años, con él tuvo dos hijas, una vive en Quito y la otra niña vive junto a ella. Bertha siempre ha velado por el bienestar de su hogar, por ello ha trabajado duro vendiendo cosméticos de puerta en puerta, también visita a clientas fijas, pero este ingreso no representa mucho ya que su hija ahora va a estudiar en la universidad y necesita emprender otro negocio para poder mejorar su ingresos y darle la educación que necesita su hija. Hace tiempo a tras ha tenido un sueño, el de ponerse un local de venta de jugos y tostadas cerca de un colegio, ya tiene visto el local pero necesita capital para la compra de los activos necesarios como licuadora, tostadora, vasos, mesas y sillas para hacer realidad su sueño. Acudió a Fundación Alternativa y pudo obtener el crédito, se siente muy feliz porque la institución pudo hacer realidad su sueño, agradece enormemente ya que podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y darle la educación superior a su hija quien siempre ha estado apoyándola.
texts.en:
Bertha is 52 years old, and she lives with one of her daughters, who is about to begin her university studies in the city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados, which is known in Ecuador as a city where the ethnic Tsachila people live.  Bertha has been separated from her ex-husband for several years.  She had another daughter with him, and that daughter lives in Quito.  

Bertha has always looked out for the well-being of her household.  She has worked hard selling cosmetics door-to-door, and she also has regular customers.   However, this income does not add up to much, since her daughter will now be attending college.  She needs to start a new business in order to increase her income and provide her daughter with the education that she needs.  For some time now, she has had the dream of opening up a stall where she can sell toast and juices near a school.  She already has the location planned, but she needs capital in order to purchase the necessary items, such as a blender, a toaster, glasses, chairs and tables in order to make her dream a reality.

She came to Fundación Alternativa and has been approved for a loan.  She his very happy because the institution has been able to make her dream a reality.  She is extremely grateful since she will now be able to improve her quality of life and to provide a college education for her daughter, who has always supported her.

loans.use: to open her business selling juices and toast.

loans.name: Ramathan Group

texts.en:
Ramathan is a group comprised of five women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 190,000 YER from AMB.

Fatima is the leader of the group. She is a 47-year-old, married woman with five children.  Fatima's husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. The family lives in their own house. Her husband's income is good, but it is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. Fatima suffers in that her house lacks many home appliances, such as a refrigerator, which she can't afford. Inside the kitchen of her house, Fatima puts many kinds of drinks and sweets where they need to be, to keep them in a cold condition. Particularly, the climate has become very hot in these days. Unfortunately, she doesn't have a refrigerator in order to keep all the drinks in a cold condition. Fatima sees the refrigerator as very necessary inside the house. For this reason, Fatima is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a refrigerator to keep her drinks and water cold in her house. 

Fatima looks forward to improving the condition of her family. She hopes to open a saving account in AMB and building a second floor of her house.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator to keep drinks and water cold in the house

loans.name: Dmytryi

texts.ru:
Дмитрию — 38 лет, он — предприниматель из Павлограда. Он торгует на местном рынке мужской кожаной одеждой и сезонной мужской одеждой. Торговое место у него собственное, опыт работы — 8 лет. 
Сумму в 40 000 гривен Дмитрий намерен вложить в закупку сезонного товара, а именно спортивных костюмов, футболок, шорт и т. д., которые хорошо расходятся в летнее время года. Несмотря на спады торговли, вызванные разными экономическими и политическими факторами в стране, Дмитрий не отчаивается, стремится обновлять ассортимент и надеяться на лучшее.
texts.en: Dmytryi is a 38-year-old entrepreneur from Pavlograd.  He sells men's leather clothing & other seasonal men's clothing at a local marketplace where he has his own market stall.  He's been at it for 8 years, and is currently seeking a loan of 40,000 hryvnia to stock up on seasonal items: sportswear, T-shirts, shorts and the like, which tend to sell well in the summer.  In spite of the slump his profession has seen due to various economic and political factors in the Ukraine, Dmytryi has seen no reason to despair.  He is committed to replenishing his stock for the summer, and will keep his chin up in the meantime.

loans.use: purchase sportswear, t-shirts, shorts etc. to sell at his market stall

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois a été crée le 12 décembre 2009. Il regroupe des femmes du même village et ceux des environs. La plupart de ces femmes font comme activité génératrice de revenus le commerce et l'embouche.
Mbayang debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 24 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 2 garçons.
Avec le prêt elle envisage d'acheter 4 chèvres à raison de 22500f l'une. Le reste lui servira à acheter de l'aliment de bétail pour nourrir les sujets. Au bout d'un certains temps d’élevage elle va vendre les chèvres à 45000 et parfois même 50000f l'une.
Les bénéfices sont utilises pour entretenir la famille et épargner au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This banc villageois was created on 12th December 2009. It is made up of women from the same village and the surrounding areas. The majority of these women earn their livings through commerce and raising livestock. 

Mbayang, the woman to the far right of the photo with her hand raised, is 24 years old. She is a married mother to five children, two of which are boys.
With this loan, she is planning to buy four goats at 22,500 FCFA each. The rest will go towards feeding this livestock. After raising the animals for a certain time, she will sell the goats for 45,000 or even 50,000 FCFA each.

The profits will be used to support her family. She will also put some of this money into savings with the banc villageois.

loans.use: to purchase four goats

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Belen requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Belen has been in this business for eight years now.

Belen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works hard to support her family. Editha is married and has a buy-and-sell, ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

Editha requested a 21,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear items to sell.

Editha has been in this business for 5 years now.

Editha would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear items to sell

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 54 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, chips, groceries, etc. to sell.

Cristita has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, chips, and groceries

loans.name: Saralyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Saralyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Saralyn is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy-and-sell rice business.

Saralyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she will be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Maria Rosa works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from frozen foods. Maria Rosa is borrowing 21,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy ingredients such as sugar, flour, and yeast for her bakery business.

Maria Rosa has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sugar, flour, and yeast

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 43 years old, with five children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Luzviminda requested a 14,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets, paints, nails, and wood for the repair of her fishing boat.

Luzviminda has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Luzviminda would like to save enough money so that she will be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, paints, nails, and wood for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es:
María tiene 51 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato pero no tuvo la oportunidad de ser empleada por alguna institución, algunos años dependió de sus padres y después se casó y dependía de su esposo. 

Desde hace aproximadamente 16 años se dedica al negocio de ropa y atiende un chalet desde que sufrió una perdida por un desastre natural en 1998, sintió que había perdido todo, menos las esperanzas de seguir adelante, por supuesto que tenía la confianza en Dios y con la ayuda de pequeños créditos salió adelante. 

En esta ocasión, necesita el dinero para ayudar a una hija que tiene problemas de salud, pues tiene un tumor de tipo canceroso y necesita unos exámenes, y además para invertir en su negocio. 

En el futuro ella espera ver a su hija sana y confía en Dios que de alguna manera va a poder tener el dinero para lograr ver a su hija mejor de salud.
texts.en:
María is 51 years old and completed her high school education.  However, she did not have the opportunity for employment.  For a number of years she was dependent on her parents, and later she got married and depended on her husband.

For approximately the last 16 years, she has had a clothing business and has run a shop since she suffered a loss as a result of a natural disaster in 1998.  She felt that she had lost everything, except for her hope and her desire to keep moving forward.  Of course she had faith in God, and with the help of small loans she was able to make progress.

On this occasion, she needs the money in order to help her daughter who has a cancerous tumor and needs several examinations.  She will also invest in her business.

In the future she hopes to see her daughter healthy, and she trusts in God that in some way she will be able to obtain the necessary funds so that she will be able to see her daughter's health improve.

loans.use: to help her daughter who has a cancerous tumor and needs some exams.  She will also invest in her business.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 41 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Ma. Luz has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Ma. Luz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mame Seyni's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de trois femmes, fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 12 décembre 2009. Ce banc regroupe des femmes qui habitent dans le même village et ceux des environs. La plupart d'entre elles s'activent dans le commerce et l’embouche.
Diouma debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 9 enfants dont 5 filles. Elle fait comme activité génératrice de revenus l'embouche. Avec le prêt elle va acheter un bœuf et un bélier, qu'elle va élever. Pour une bonne embouche elle va aussi acheter de l'aliment pour la nourriture du bétail.
Les bénéfices générés par son activité lui, permettent de réinvestir dans l'embouche, de prendre en charge le besoins de la famille, de renforcer son épargne dans le banc villageois.
texts.en: This group of three women is part of the banc villageois which was created on 12th December 2009. This banc groups together the women who live in the same village and the surrounding areas. The majority of these women earn a living from trade and livestock farming. Diouma, the woman to the right of the photo with her hand raised, is 36 years old. She is a married mother to nine children, five of which are girls. She earns a living from raising livestock. With this loan, she is going to buy a cow and a ram, which she will raise. In order to successfully raise them, she will also buy animal feed for the livestock. The profits from this activity will allow her to reinvest in her business, to provide for her family and to increase her savings with the banc villageois.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and a ram

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel earns a living by running a motor-transport business. This is how he supports his family, but recently he has also been spending lots of time doing house repairs. He needs financial assistance to hire workers to help him, and has applied for a loan from PMPC. His hope for the future is to live a comfortable life with his family nearby.

loans.use: to pay for labor to do house repairs

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
This is Cecilia, 49, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. Being a mother to her six children, she solely manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Cecilia operates an Accessories stall. She buys accessory items from a wholesaler and sells them per piece/pack at a profit. Products can range from hair clips to head bands, jewelry such as rose gold, garment bags and other similar products.  Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are students and mall patrons.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of accessory products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Cecilia hopes to become a successful businesswoman and dreams of having her own cosmetics store. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 44 years old and married.

Eliza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries, such as candles, canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, body soap, sanitary pads, etc., to sell.

Eliza has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Eliza aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries, such as candles, canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, body soap, sanitary pads, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Maurecia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Maurecia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell kitchenware business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Maurecia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of kitchenware to sell for her kitchenware business.

Maurecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past twelve loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of kitchenware to sell.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson used the previous loan to buy bananas for alcohol distilling. The responsibility of looking after six of his children solely rests on him, and his desire is to educate them up to University. For twenty-three years he has been growing onions and distilling alcohol. He started distilling four jerrycans of  alcohol a month but now he can distill ten of them. He faces the hardship of price fluctuation. His dream is to supply alcohol to the whole region. Johnson needs the loan to improve his banana plantation.

loans.use: to improve his banana plantation.

loans.name: Percie

texts.en:
Percie is 42 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell, like soap, milk, eggs, noodles, chips, etc. She has been in this business for 8 years.

Percie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell, like soap, milk, eggs, noodles, chips, etc.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina 
	Cristina tiene 32 años de edad, actualmente vive con su compañero y su hija de 7 años, vive en la zona de Horquetas de Sarapiqui.  La solicitante tiene un importante historial dentro de Fundación Mujer, en la comunidad fue la artífice de la formación de un grupo  formado por jóvenes emprendedoras de la zona;  cancelaron con puntualidad el  crédito otorgado. Ella decide  optar por un monto mayor por lo que va a solicitar éste créditos. Los préstamos anteriores le sirvieron para la actividad de Pollos de engorde, la cual se ha venido manejando desde hace 3 años. Actualmente junto a su esposo, se dedican también al comercio de tenis de marca, por lo que el capital solicitado irá dirigido a la compra de esta mercadería y seguir atendiendo los pollos.
	La actividad le ha  permitido generar ingresos para cubrir el pago del préstamo y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. En este caso particular se desea retomar la actividad de comercio ya que maneja una cartera de clientes en la zona, cubrir los pedidos y seguir apoyando los ingresos familiares. Entre las labores diarias de Cristina esta llevar a su hija a la escuela y atender al alimentación de los pollos y además cuenta con una cerda de cría, en las tardes junto a su compañero, en el vehículo de la familia,  se dedican a la venta de ambos productos (pollos y tenis), en las comunidades cercanas.
	 Es el cuarto crédito que se  solicita, el segundo de forma individual, se ha demostrado una conducta de pago muy buena, y la actividad comercial a venido en aumento; según los datos recopilados en la visita a la microempresa
	Se cuenta con los gallineros y un congelador para el almacenamiento de los pollos, existe en la zona un restaurante y una soda que compra los pollos, además de los vecinos de la comunidad. Con respecto a la actividad de venta de zapatos deportivos,  esta es manejada junto a su esposo, es complementaria a los pollos. Se cuenta con una cartera de clientes desde hace 5 años, y se pretende realizar una inversión importante para cubrir los pedidos de los clientes. Las tenis son de marca y se adquieren en la frontera de Paso Canoas a un precio muy competitivo y dando facilidades de pago.
texts.en:
Cristina is 32 years old and currently lives with her common-law husband and their 7-year-old daughter.  They live in the zone of Horquetas de Sarapiqui.  She important has played an important role within Fundación Mujer.  She took the initiative to form a community bank in her area.  They paid of their first loan punctually.  She decided to seek a larger sum, so she is seeking a new loan.  Her previous loans helped her to raise chickens, which she has been doing for three years.  Currently, along with her husband, she sells tennis shoes.  The loan proceeds would be directed toward the purchase of this merchandise and also to continue attending to the chickens.

This activity has enabled her to generate income to pay back her loans and improve her family's quality of life.  In this particular case, she wishes to resume selling her goods, since she has a number of customers in her area.  She will be able to fulfill their orders and continue contributing to the family income.  Among Christina's daily tasks, she takes her daughter to school and feeds the chickens.  She also has pigs to take care of.  In the afternoon, she goes with her husband in the family vehicle and sells both of her products (chickens and tennis shoes) in the neighboring communities.

This is the fourth loan she is seeking, and the second loan she is requesting as an individual.  She has demonstrated a very good repayment record.  Her business is growing, according to the information collected when her business was visited.

She has chicken coops and a freezer for the storage of the chickens.  In her area, there is a restaurant and a soda shop that both buy her birds, as do her neighbors in the community.  With respect to the sale of the sports shoes, this is done in conjunction with her husband, and complements the income from the chickens.  She has had a steady client base for 5 years, and she intends to make an important investment in order to cover the orders from these customers.  The tennis shoes are brand name and are acquired at the border of Paso Canoas at a very competitive price, and they provide easy payment terms.

loans.use: to purchase chickens for fattening, as well as tennis shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds, as well as to improve the land.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et ont en moyenne 6 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des familles traditionnelles à KIGNAN un village dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame M’BENE debout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter un sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  90 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: The ten members of the Benkadi 1 Group are married women with an average age of 41 and an average of six children each. The majority of them live within a traditional family framework in Kignan, a village in Sikasso Cercle, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso Microfinance Institution, with whom their previous loans were paid back in full. The group's main produce is peanut plants. The group's representative is M'Bene, the woman standing to the right of the photo taken of the entire Benkadi 1 Group. With this loan, she is planning on buying one 50-kg sack of fertiliser, one can of herbicide, as well as the labour costs to maintain half a hectare of land. After the harvest, the produce is sold on a village level as well as at the markets of Sikasso to a customer base made up of both men and woman, accepting both credit and cash as payment. She is planning on making an average profit of 90,000 FCFA per season. These profits will allow her to pay off part of the loan and its interest and to also help her husband with their family's daily living expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertiliser, labour, agricultural input and seeds

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita supports her family by buying and selling rattan products in her community. She is 58 years old, widowed and blessed with five children. Despite the many hardships she has faced, she is determined to be successful and financially stable in the future. Her goal is to make her business more profitable in order to generate a higher income. She is requesting a loan for PHP 25,000 to buy more soft brooms, baskets and other rattan products to resell. She hopes to use this loan to make her business more viable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy soft brooms, baskets, and other rattan products to resell

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 67 years old, widowed and from San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City. She has a dry goods retailing business, which supported the needs of her family. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for housing materials. Teodora has been aiming to have her house repaired. She deeply desires to live comfortably with her children around.

loans.use: to pay for materials to repair her house.

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en: Rajab is 52 years old. She is a kind and smart woman. Rajab is married and has two children. She is also a business lady. Twenty years ago, Rajab began her business. She runs an agriculture business growing potatoes and crops. In addition, she feeds cattle. Rajab has great experience in this field and developed her business little by little. Now, she has regular customers in a local market. With the profit from her business, Rajab is going to repair her house. Her living house is in bad condition now. Rajab is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy cattle to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Sol

texts.en:
Sol, 54 years of age, is married to a driver and blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a junk shop at the back of their house for almost 20 years, and with this business she's earning a net income of about PHP 5,000 weekly.

Due to insufficient funds she would like to get a loan amounting to PHP 22,000 to purchase plastic bottles, scrap and steel to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her business in order to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase plastic bottles, scrap and steel to sell.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is 58, married and blessed with eight children. She and her husband work hand in hand to sustain their daily necessities and support the education of their youngest child. Angelina has been engaged in buying and reselling cosmetics, accessories and toys within the Public market for almost 10 years and her husband works on their farm. With her desire to make more improvements in the business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy more stocks of cosmetics, accessories and toys to resell. Through hard work and strong determination, Angelina believes that someday, she will improve her business and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of cosmetics, accessories and toys to resell

loans.name: Prolentina

texts.en:
Prolentina is 40 years old. She is married and together they support two adults. She has been running her business for the past five years, selling clothes to customers in her area. She currently makes an estimated monthly income of KES 20,000. 

She would like a loan of KES 30,000 with which she will add to her stock of clothes by buying in bulk. She will use her income to buy food for her family and more clothes to sell to her clients to add to her income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes in bulk

loans.name: Penina

texts.en: Penina is 30 years old and lives in Kisumu town in western Kenya with her husband and three children, who range in age from 3 to 11 years old. She has earned a living by running a beauty parlor for the last four years and earns a comfortable income of KES. 30,000 a month. She is requesting her third from loan Vision Fund Kenya, which she will to use buy a blow drier and cosmetics. She plans to use the profits she earns from this loan to expand her business. Her dream is to become a successful entrepreneur so that she can support her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as a blow drier.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 54 years old and married with two children. With her children currently in school, Emelia works very hard to provide for them.

Emelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods, such as beer, soft drinks, canned goods, toothpaste, snack foods, cereals, etc., to sell.

Emelia has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items, such as beer, soft drinks, canned goods, toothpaste, snack foods, cereals, etc. 

Emelia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods, such as beer, soft drinks, canned goods, toothpaste, snack foods, cereals, etc., to sell

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Emelia is 44 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

She has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like nail polish, nail cutters and nippers, etc. for her business.

She has been in this business for 2 years. Emelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like nail polish, nail cutters and nippers, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosa works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice grains. Rosa is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase peanuts, sugar, cooking oil, etc. for her food vending business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 31 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Sitte Hava

texts.en:
Sitte Hava is 47 years old and married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like bar soap, toothpaste, bread, chips, sugar, etc.

Sitte Hava has borrowed and paid off 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from raising pigs and from buying and selling fruit.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like bar soap, toothpaste, bread, chips, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Feviana

texts.en:
Feviana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years and earns more income from banana vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc. for her food production business.

Feviana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 34 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell of native products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Mary Ann has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell of native products for five years and earns an income from her general store and raising pigs.

Mary Ann aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more native products to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years and earns more income from buying and selling dried coconut meat.

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Susan wants to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 23-year-old single male with no children living in Kasese, Uganda. Joseph has been in the retail shop business for five years. He earns a salary for additional income. He began the business to generate income to fight the poverty that was knocking at his door. He is a hard working man and has no challenges. Joseph intends to use the loan to buy cooking oil to sell

loans.use: to buy cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Nathir

texts.en:
Nathir is a 50-year-old married man and a father of five children. His oldest child is 25 years old and the youngest one is 10 years old. Nathir lives with his family in their own house. He studied in Elementary School, but he couldn't complete his studies. He is a very dynamic and vigorous man. Before the age of 30, Nathir was able to accumulate a good amount of money and purchase a piece of land. His wife supported him with a lot of her own money. 

Nathir is the sole breadwinner of the family and his income is enough to cover all the expenses of the family, but it is not enough to renovate their house and to expand it. Over time, he built the house on the land that he bought, but now it needs renovating from the inside. As a result, Nathir is requesting a loan of 100,000YER from AMB. He will use the loan to purchase construction materials such as cement and paint in order to renovate the house.

He looks forward to purchasing another piece of land and building a house on that land in order to rent it. He hopes to send his children to a private school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement and paint in order to renovate the house from the inside.

loans.name: Costureras Clarenas Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Costureras Clareñas”, meaning “The Seamstresses from Santa Clara”, is located in the municipality of Santa Clara La Laguna in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. It is composed of nine business women who are the backbone of each of their families. They work in textile production and animal husbandry.

Maria is the 31-year-old President of the Trust Bank who is married with four children. She is an enthusiastic and very responsible businesswoman, leader and mother. Each of her children is in school and she is thrilled about this as she realizes that education is the key to a successful future. Fortunately, she was able to attend school but was not able to graduate from high school as she had to work. Maria raises chickens and cattle and hopes for a good return on her investment. She is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase more chickens to fatten up, sell, and thus create additional income. Her goal is to take care of the daily needs of her household and to see that her children finish school. 

Maria takes her job as President of the Trust Bank very seriously and tries to guide the ladies in an intelligent and compassionate manner. She urges them to use the information that they receive each month in the non-formal educational trainings given by a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer. Some of the topics covered include women’s rights and self esteem, nutrition and health as well as the use of medicinal plants. Other subjects covered include effective business practices including accounting, budgeting and customer service. It is the combination of the small loans and non-formal educational segments of the monthly meetings that Friendship Bridge calls “Microcredit Plus”.

The ladies of the Trust Bank are quite grateful to KIVA investors for funding their loans. They intend to use the funds wisely and pay them back on time. Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: To purchase more chickens to fatten up for sale.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el es un hombre trabajador, responsable y honesto, desde hace varios años se dedica a la  producción y venta de productos lácteos en la zona donde reside y también al cultivo  de maicillo. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos,  ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas y concentrado para el ganado y  asi poder seguirle dando a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en: Miguel is 40 years old and lives in a home of his own along with his wife and daughter.  He is a hardworking, responsible, and honest man who has been producing and selling dairy products in the area where he lives.  He also raises barley.  He has good customers because he has been able to gain their trust and offers quality products.  He has decided to invest in the care of his livestock because his business depends on it and is asking for this loan to buy vitamins and feed so he can continue providing a better quality of life for his family without limit.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feed.

loans.name: Jose Lucio

texts.es: Jose de 49 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol desde hace varios años. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, y es la única forma que conoce de como ganarse la vida. Es un hombre muy trabajador, honrado y responsable. A pesar de las condiciones en las que vive, las cuales son muy humildes no se cansa de trabajar y de dar lo mejor a su familia. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para comprar los principales insumos agrícolas: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotografia. Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en: Jose is 49 years old.  He works in the cultivation of corn and beans for many years.  He earns his living like this and it is what allows him to bring bread home each day.  The growth and harvest is done year after year and it is the only way that Jose knows how to earn his living.  He is a very hard-working, honorable and responsible man.  In spite of the conditions that he lives in, which are very humble, he does not tire of working and trying to give the best to his family.  He made the decision to request a loan in order to buy some important agricultural inputs: fertilizers, pesticides, seeds, etc. and to improve the land where he grows his crops, which is what is shown in the photograph.  He hopes to have improved results as he does not have any other source of income.  Jose has faith in God that he will have a large harvest which will allow him to continue bringing home bread each day to his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, seeds, etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
La socia Marleni pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” de la ciudad del Cusco- Perú. 
La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azucar, leche entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y ayudarla a mantener y desarrollarse en sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Marleni is a member of the “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” communal bank in Cusco, Peru.

She continues to run a grocery store and is a responsible and dedicated lady.  She sells different types of products such as rice, sugar, milk and other things.  She wants to continue working in this way to support her family.

She will use the money from this loan to buy milk and other things.

She is grateful to Kiva for helping her to provide her family with a better quality of life and helping her maintain and develop her business.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Dúo Mely Group

texts.es: El dúo Mely está conformado por Mervelin Maricela de 32 años de edad tiene 2 hijas (12 y 8 años de edad) ella tiene 2  locales  ubicado en ciudad vieja donde ella vende piñatas, dulces, regalos, ropa para dama y caballero  entre otros productos, ella solicita un crédito para compra de mercadería (piñatas, dulces, ropa, accesorios) ya que ella desea surtir mejor sus dos locales con la misma mercadería ya que le es difícil surtir los dos locales al mismo tiempo, su anhelo es poder ahorrar y  más adelante comprar un terreno para construir su casa y poder dejarles una vivienda mas seguirá a sus hijas y poder darles una buena educación  a sus hijas.
texts.en: The Mely duo includes 32 year old Mervelin Maricela.  She has two daughters (ages 12 and 8) and has two shops in the old city where she sells piñatas, candy, gifts, men’s and women’s clothing and other products.  She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise (piñatas, candy, gifts, clothing, accessories) so she can better stock both of her shops with the same kind of merchandise because it’s difficult to stock both at the same time.  Her goal is to be able to save some money and buy a piece of land on which to build a house in the future, so that she can provide a safer home and an education to her daughters.

loans.use: to stock her stores.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 8 membres du groupe BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et ont en moyenne 6 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à KIGNAN un village  dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame BALAKISSA assise à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter un sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  95 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: The eight members of the Benkadi 2 Group are married women with an average age of 41 and an average of six children each. The majority of them live within a traditional family framework in Kignan, a village in Sikasso Cercle, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso Microfinance Institution so that they can see through their agricultural activities during the winter period. This will be their sixth loan with Soro Yiriwaso. Their previous loans were all paid back in full. The group's main produce is peanut plants. The group's representative is Balakissa, the woman sat second from the right in the photo taken of the entire Benkadi 2 Group. With this loan, she is planning on buying one 50-kg sack of fertiliser, one can of herbicide, as well as the labour costs to maintain half a hectare of land. After the harvest, the produce is sold on a village level as well as at the markets of Sikasso to a customer base made up of both men and women, accepting both credit and cash as payment. She is planning on making an average profit of 95,000 FCFA per season. These profits will allow her to pay off part of the loan and its interest and to also help her husband with their family's daily living expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertiliser, labour, agricultural input and seeds.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
La socia Noemí pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” de la ciudad del Cusco-Perú. 
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de verduras, la socia vende zanahorias, tomates, entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera sacar adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de tomates entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Noemí is a member of the “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” communal bank in Cusco, Peru.

She sells vegetables, such as carrots, tomatoes, and other things and has been doing this for some time.  Things are going well for her thanks to the dedication she puts into her business.  She wants to continue to work and support her family

She is asking for this loan to buy tomatoes and other things.

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes and other items.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
This is Gina, 47, a resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Jimmy, a government employee, and mother to her three children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Gina operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Gina hopes to be a boss of her own business someday and plans to go abroad if given a chance. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs wholesale for sale later on.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 34-year-old female and married with three children, who are all going to school. Josephine sells cassava flour, working 7 days a week, plus farming for additional income. She began her business to earn a living, educate her children and build a permanent house to fulfill her dreams. Josephine needs a loan to pay school fees for her children despite the difficulties of competition and poor weather.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Herlinda Sofia

texts.es:
Herlinda, es una mujer de campo de 41 años muy dedicada a su familia y a su trabajo.
Ella se gana la vida criando y levantando pollos y cerdos en un galpón y una marranera que tiene instalada a un lado de su casa, oficio que aprendió desde que era una niña al lado de sus padres quienes siempre ejercieron esta actividad.
Ella se levanta todos los días desde muy temprano para atender sus animales y de esta forma tenerlos siempre listos para la  venta. Todo el dinero que genera su trabajo es invertido en su negocio, y el sostenimiento de su hogar.
La señora solicita una asistencia económica para capitalizar su negocio y comprar más crías de cerdo y pollos, con las cuales podrá seguir trabajando y ganando dinero para su familia.
En algunas ocasiones sus hijos le ayudan y unen fuerzas para sacar el negocio adelante.
texts.en: Herlinda is a country woman, 41 years old, and very dedicated to her family and her work.  She earns a living breeding and raising chickens and pigs in a shed and a pigsty built on the side of her home, a job she learned as a little girl with her parents who always worked in this activity. Herlinda wakes up very early each day in order to care for the animals and like this,she has them ready for sale at all times.  All the money that she earns through her work is invested into her business and the maintenance of her home.  She is requesting economic assistance in order to capitalize her business and buy more piglets and baby chickens, which will help her to continue working and earning a living for her family.  On some occasions, her children help her and join forces to help move her business forward.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and baby chickens.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 60 años de edad, estudió poco en la escuela, en la actualidad está acompañado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y al cuidado de su última hija que sufrió un accidente y quedó invalida para toda su vida, solo 3 personas dependen de él.


Pedro se dedica a la agricultura desde hace unos treinta años, aprendió a trabajar con su papá desde 
pequeño es así que trabaja de agricultor , también se dedica a la venta de piedra 
para construcción, trabajo que realiza quebrándola con almágana a golpes, y en la agricultura trabaja 5 horas al día. 


El dinero solicitado  a CrediCampo lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para la siembra de dos hectáreas de maíz, seis sacos de abono, tres de fórmula y tres de sulfato y en el pago del alquiler de la tierra donde va a trabajar pero solamente con el préstamo podrá hacerlo realidad 

Pedro sueña con que su hija pueda caminar  con eso su vida mejorará en grande, y espera en Dios que le dará vida para seguir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 60 years old and only attended school a bit.  He is married and his wife is a housewife and cares for their youngest daughter who suffered an accident and was handicapped for life.  Only three people rely on him for support.

Pedro has been a farmer for about 32 years.  He learned to do this kind of work from his father when he was a small boy.  He also sells Stone for building material and breaks the rocks with a sledgehammer.  He also works five hours daily as a farmer.

He will use the money from this loan from CrediCampo to buy fertilizers for two hectares of corn, six sacks of compost, three sacks of formula, and three of sulfate.  He will also pay for rent on the land where he works, but he will only be able to do this with help from the loan.

Pedro dreams of his daughter being able to walk and having a better life.  He hopes that God will give her life to continue ahead with his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and pay rent for his farmland.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan tiene 33 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato ya que se le hacía muy difícil seguir estudiando en la universidad por falta de recursos económicos, actualmente está acompañado y su esposa es empleada desempeñando el cargo de secretaria y también se dedica a los oficios domésticos, y cuando sale de trabajar cuida de su único hijo de 10 años de edad el cual estudia en la escuela.

Juan es empleado de ventas de una empresa de comunicaciones, él tiene ya 1 año de laborar en esa empresa, gracias a un amigo que lo recomendó para que pudiera trabajar y él ha visto que es un trabajo que le ayuda a sacar adelante a su familia. También él se dedica a la agricultura, en la siembra de granos básicos maíz y frijol, para llegar a su lugar de trabajo tiene que tomar un bus que tarda casi una hora de camino y el trabajo agrícola lo hace cerca de su casa.


El préstamo que solicita a CrediCampo lo necesita para invertirlo en la agricultura, en la siembra de  granos de maíz y frijol, específicamente en la preparación de la tierra, pago de mano obra, compra de abono y fertilizantes para el cultivo, con la ayuda del préstamo tendrá mejores ingresos para su familia, y también asegurará su alimentación.

Su sueño a futuro es principalmente tener su propia casa, pues donde vive está alquilando y él no se siente bien con su familia, también desea estudiar más junto a su esposa, y que su hijo estudie mucho, tener un mejor empleo que le genere mayores ingresos económicos y también tener mejores cultivos y expandirlos para obtener una mayor producción.
texts.en:
Juan is 33 years of age and completed his high school studies as it became very difficult for him to continue his studies at university due to a lack of financial resources. He is currently married, his wife works as a secretary and also as a housewife, and when she finishes work she looks after their 10 year old son who is studying in school.

Juan works in sales for a communications company, where he has worked for 1 year, thanks to friend of his who recommended him for the job. He has seen that this job can help him get ahead with his family. He also makes a living from farming, from the planting of maize grains and beans. In order to get to work he has to take a bus journey of nearly one hour, and the farming work is near his house. 

He needs the loan he is requesting from CrediCampo in order to invest in farming, in planting maize grains and beans, and more specifically in preparing the land, paying the workforce and purchasing manure and fertilisers for the crop. With the aid of the loan he will have a higher income for his family and will be able to ensure they are fed.

His main dream for the future is to have his own house, as he is currently renting and that is not comfortable for his family. He hopes to further his studies along with his wife and that his son will study a lot. He also hopes that he will have a better job through which he can earn a greater income and that he will have a better and larger crop in order to achieve increased production.

loans.use: to invest in farming, in the planting of maize grains and beans, and more specifically in preparing the land, paying the workforce, purchasing manure and fertiliser for the crop.

loans.name: Ana Delio

texts.es:
Ana es un hombre casado, padre de 3 hijos, los cuales ya son independientes, trabaja en la agricultura arduamente en compañía de su esposa para el sostenimiento de hogar.

Ana trabaja en la agricultura, trabajo que lo aprendió de sus padres que se esforzaron en enseñarle para que saliera adelante, lo aprendió a la edad de 20 años,s u trabajo está cerca de su casa donde tiene la parcela en la que cosecha, también se dedica a la ganadería ya que considera que es una fuente de ingreso  mas que le ayuda al fortalecimiento de su hogar.

Ana utilizará el préstamo para comprar una novilla de repasto para cuidarla, engordarla y venderla cuando se le acerque el plazo de vencimiento de su crédito

El sueño de  Ana es algún día tener su propio negocio y que éste le genere ganancias para un mejor bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is a married man and father to 3 children who are all independent. Ana is a farmer and works hard in farming along with his wife to maintain the home. He learned this trade at the age of 20 from his parents who encouraged him to learn it in order to come out ahead. His plot which he works on is near his home. He also works in cattle breeding as this is a source of income which helps him strengthen his home. 

Ana will use the loan to purchase a heifer to raise, fatten up and sell when his loan is close to maturity.

Ana’s dream is to one day have his own business and that it will generate earnings for the wellbeing of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a heifer to raise, fatten up and sell when his loan is close to maturity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay for labor to maintain her coffee crops

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.es:
José de 49 años d edad, no pudo estudiar por la situación económica, actualmente está acompañado, su pareja es ama de casa, no tiene hijos y su padre vive con él, por lo tanto de él depende su mujer y su padre. 

Él se dedica a la agricultura, lo hace desde que era pequeño, el trabajo lo aprendió por su padre y abuelo que ya murió, se decidió por esto ya que fue lo que a él le enseñaron y es lo único a lo que se ha dedicado siempre, el lugar de trabajo le queda a una distancia de una hora y se va caminando.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar abono, semilla de maíz, pesticidas y herbicidas, para lograr tener una mejor cosecha y así cultivar más.
Sus sueños son mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y comprar una casa.
texts.en:
Jose is 49 years old, he couldn’t study because of his economic situation.  He has a partner, she is a housewife, they don’t have children and his father lives with them.  He has to look after his wife and his father.
He works in agriculture, he learned this activity when he was a kid from his father and his late grandfather.  He decided for this as a business because it’s what he knew how to do and all he has ever done, his commute to his place of business is about one hour walking distance.
He needs the loan to buy fertilizer, maize seed, pesticides, and herbicides to have a better harvest and grow more crops.
His dreams are to improve his quality of life and his family’s as well as buying a house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, maize seed, pesticides, and herbicides to achieve a better harvest and cultivate more

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and to prepare her land to plant sugar cane

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a forty-nine-year-.old married woman living in Kamwenge- Uganda. She deals in the selling of second hand clothes as her main source of income alongside agriculture. 

She started this business to earn a living and look after her family. She faces a number of challenges including competition, seasonal customers, and weather changes that stop customers from turning up but has hopes that she will own a wholesale boutique.

She is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Kaiha Group

texts.en:
Purunari is a 48-year-old, married, hardworking Ugandan man living in Kagadi with five children aged between 20 and 10 years, and four of them attend school. He earns from farming and a retail shop business to generate income to educate his children. 

He hopes to buy more land even though he meets a problem of inadequate capital. Purunari intends to use a loan to buy sugar, soap, and cooking oil for resale. He is a member of Kaiha Group where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Cairo Group

texts.en:
Catheline, who is aged in her thirties, is single and has three kids in school. For ten years now she has helped support her family with her beverage business where she sells beer, water, soda, juices, and spirits. She does business from 8 AM to the midnight hour and is able to make a good profit each month. 

Catheline is requesting a first loan through Tujijenge Tanzania. She is requesting 4,000,000 TZS to be apportioned among four members of the Cairo group. The member of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

She will use this loan to grow her business capital with more brewers. Her ambition is to expand her business.

loans.use: to grow her business capital with more brewers

loans.name: Doralba Enith

texts.es:
La señora Doralba ha vivido toda su vida en el campo y ha aprendido diferentes actividades.
Una de ellas es la venta de mercancía como ropa y zapatos, actividad a la que se dedica actualmente y que aprendió de manera empírica.
Las ventas las realiza de forma ambulante desplazándose entre diferentes municipios del departamento de Córdoba.
Actualmente este oficio es su principal fuente de ingresos para ella y su esposo.
Solicita un apoyo económico para adquirir una mayor cantidad de mercancía en ropa y zapatos para aumentar su inventario y ofrecer mucha más variedad a sus clientes.
Este apoyo le permitirá enfrentar el reto de tener más ventas y por lo tanto más ingresos para su sostenimiento.
Su principal dificultad es el tiempo que toma cada desplazamiento ya que no tiene un vehículo propio si no que se transporta en los buses municipales.
texts.en:
Doralba has lived her entire life in the country and she has learned different businesses. 

One of these is selling merchandise, such as clothing and shoes, which is the business she is currently working in and which she learned empirically.

She does her selling on foot, traveling between different municipalities in the department of Córdoba. 

This business is currently her primary source of income for herself and her husband.

She is requesting financial support to acquire a larger quantity clothing and shoe merchandise to increase her inventory and offer her customers much more variety.  

This support will allow her to meet the challenge of increasing sales and, accordingly, increasing her income support herself. 

Her main challenge is the time is takes to travel around as she does not have her own vehicle and instead rides the municipal buses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise stock, such as clothing and shoes, to sell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna was very thankful for the assistance given to her. She previously accessed a PHP 22,000 loan that she used to purchase scrap materials needed in her business. Her profits were a big help in the education of her children and in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

To help her continue operations of her business, Myrna is requesting another loan, in the amount of PHP 24,000. She will be incorporating the loan on her current revolving fund used to buy scrap and recyclable materials. Her earnings from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Myrna hopes to gain more profits from her business and dreams to see her children succeed. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies to invest in the care and protection of her coffee plants

loans.name: Shohida

texts.en:
Shohida was born in 1981 year, in North Tajikistan. She lives near the Tajik mountains and likes her country much. Shohida is married. Her husband, Suhrob, is a carpenter. Shohida is a sewer. She sews national women's dresses. Shohida has been offering her service for more than two years, to local people. She also works in a local school, as a cleaning woman. Shohida works hard every day to earn a living.

Now, she needs financial support, because her son is ill. He has an injury to the head. Shohida is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy medicines for treatment of her son. She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: To buy medicines for treatment of her son

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is married with four children, three of whom are in school. She has a beauty salon business and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDTSACCO to buy more boxes of weaves and cream relaxers. She has been in this business for three years and works at the market six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include thieves and unreliable electricity. She is aspiring to own a generator to assist when power is off, and also to own a bridal salon. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of weaves and cream relaxers.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 40 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Emelda is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Emelda has been farming rice for eight years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bundles of flowers

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 47 years of age, married and has three schooling children. As a way of generating income, she has run a small variety store within their community for almost three years. Due to financial hardship, she aims to strengthen her business and increase her income to satisfy their necessities and support the education of her children. 

She plans to increase her product offerings, but she has not enough capital. For this reason, she would like to ask for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more stock of grocery items and Avon products to resell. She believes that she will avail her loan request in order for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of grocery items and Avon products to resell.

location.town: Brgy. Villa Flores, Sta. Fe, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Lina Maria

texts.es: Lina de 30 años de edad se dedica a la venta de café, hayacas, pasteles y variados alimentos que su clientela consume diariamente, mientras trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde.  Lina sueña con tener una gran cafetería, y mas adelante una vivienda propia y también desea lograr capacitarse para aumentar su nivel de vida. Cuando hace 2 años inició su negocio, lo hizo con conocimiento de causa, pues procedente de Montería una ciudad de la Costa Caribe, llegó con su madre a otra ciudad, donde ella falleció, victima de la violencia y  por eso desde muy niña debió trabajar para sostener a su familia. Mas adelante cuando pasó su duelo conformó su hogar en el cual tiene 3 hijos de 2 4 y 8 años y  decidió generar ingresos por su propia cuenta., para forjarles un mayor bienestar al lado de su cónyuge. En la actualidad Lina está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará azúcar, flor de Jamaica, canela, y termos portátiles, con esta inversión sus ingresos se incrementarán para mejorar aun mas el sostenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en: Thirty-year-old Lina works selling coffee, tamales, cakes, and various foods that her clientele eat daily while she works from seven in the morning until two in the afternoon.  Lina dreams of having a big coffee shop and her own home in the future and she also wants to educate herself to improve her standard of living.  When she started her business two years ago, she did so knowing what motivation is, as she is from Monteía, a city on the Caribbean coast, and arrived at another city with her mother, where she passed away the victim of violence.  For that reason, from a very young age she had to work to support her family.  Later on when her mourning was over, she redid her home, where she has three children who are two, four, and eight years old, and decided to generate her own income to increase their wellbeing alongside her partner.  Lina is currently applying for a Kiva loan, which will be her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy sugar, hibiscus flower, cinnamon, and portable thermoses.  This investment will increase her profits and further contribute to supporting her household.

loans.use: to buy sugar, hibiscus flower, cinnamon, and  portable thermoses

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace used her previous loan to buy manure and seedlings for her farm. She is a thirty-three-year-old hardworking mother of four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

She deals in agriculture as her main source of income, though she earns a monthly salary. She still faces a challenge of prolonged drought and hailstorms, though she has hopes of becoming a model farmer.

Grace is requesting a loan to buy manure for the farm.

loans.use: to buy manure for her farm.

loans.name: Ruby Isabel

texts.es:
Ruby es una mujer humilde y trabajadora, en busca de oportunidades para progresar y salir adelante.
Ella trabaja como costurera en su propia casa realizando arreglos de ropa, en su mayoría a las personas de la región. Esta actividad la combina con la venta de algunos víveres y abarrotes que compra al por mayor para luego venderlos.
Ella desea aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos, por eso solicita un auxilio económico para capitalizar su negocio y darle un impulso significativo a su actividad comprando una mayor cantidad de productos básicos de la canasta familiar.
Esto le dará la oportunidad de atender una mayor cantidad de clientes y tener los productos que ellos soliciten siempre disponibles.
Es el claro ejemplo de una mujer rebuscadora e inquieta.
texts.en:
Ruby is a humble and hardworking woman looking for opportunities to progress and move forward.  She works as a seamstress at home doing alterations for people in the region. In addition, she also purchases food and groceries in bulk and then sells them. 

She wants to increase her sales and revenue, so she is seeking economic assistance to give a significant boost to her business by purchasing a larger quantity of staple goods to sell. 

This will allow her the opportunity to serve a greater number of customers and have products that are always requested available. Ruby is a clear example of a lively and successful woman.

loans.use: to buy a wide range of staple goods to sell.

loans.name: Kampala Group

texts.en:
Nuru is a mother of nine children, of whom one is at school. The rest are grown. Nuru is aged early fifties and is married. For twenty years now, Nuru has been supporting her family by managing her catering business. She is having helpers and works at her business from 06am to 07pm, each working day. Nuru is able to make a very good profit each month.

Nuru is requesting a first loan via Kiva's partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy big cooking pans for her business. She dreams of managing a function hall. Nuru will share this loan with her loan group, Kampala, which is comprised of five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy big cooking pans for her catering business.

loans.name: Parachichi Group

texts.en:
Agnela is a mother of four, school-going girls. She is married. She has been supporting her family by managing a charcoal store, since 2012. Agnela works at the business from 7:30am to 8:00pm daily, and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her first loan. She will use it to grow her business capital, by purchasing sacks of charcoal. In the coming years, Agnela would like to grow more business capital and improve her family life. She will share this loan with her loan group, Parachichi, which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to grow her business capital by purchasing sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Maysara

texts.en:
Maysara is an ambitious woman. She is 28 years old. Maysara is married and brings up two children. Her children are little. Maysara’s husband, Gayrat, is a driver. His income is not enough to organize the circumcision ceremony of their son. 

Maysara wants to organize a business, earn additional family income, and in this way improve their living condition. She is going to start a business with selling a variety of clothes. Maysara, with this aim, took part in a course, “To get Ahead”, at a women’s organization. 

She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy clothes for organizing her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy clothes for organizing a new business.

loans.name: Donika

texts.en:
Donika is a 35-year-old, married mother of three. Her children are aged 8, 5 and 2 years. Her husband has been blind since birth.

She wants to add seven female baby calves to the existing herd of six cows and four baby calves. Currently, three of her cows are producing milk and three are pregnant. Donika’s plans are to sell only baby calves to locals, from now.

Donika is a hard-working woman; she not only takes care of her young children and her husband, but she also does business. In addition to the livestock, she has rented from neighbors some agricultural land, where she plants corn and fodder for the animals. Thus, she doesn’t have to buy these things. She plows the soil herself, with an agricultural tractor, and she grinds large quantities of corn with a grinding machine.

loans.use: to add seven female calves to her existing herd

loans.name: Katherine

texts.es: Katherine de 29 años de edad habita al sur de la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 4,6,8 y 13 .
