Ella aprovechó toda la experiencia de su  madre quien trabajaba en una confección, mientras Katherine observaba "como agonizaba mucho" y por eso decidió, desde sus 17 años trabajar con ella para ayudarla. así fue como con sus ingresos, compró a su madre su primera máquina sencilla, para que se independizara y trabajara en su hogar. Katherine compraba telas y su madre confeccionaba y luego Katherine comercializaba los productos acabados. Poco a poco fue comprando mas máquinas y negociando buenos contratos con instituciones educativas del sector, como hasta hoy lo hace. Su meta mas adelante es tener un local independiente que funcione como miscelánea y confección, para asegurar el futuro de sus hijos con una buena educación profesional. Su mayor desafío es lograr recursos económicos para lograr todos sus sueños rápidamente. Hoy Catherine está aplicando a un credikiva pues necesita comprar una máquina bordadora, debido a que este valor agregado, lo contrata y le sale costoso. así ella podrá satisfacer su necesidad de responder a su clientela con buenos acabados y ofrecer el servicio de bordado que le generará un nuevo ingreso haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Katherine is 29 years old, she lives south of the city with her spouse and their four children ages 4, 6, 8 and 13.  She took advantage of her mom’s experience in clothes making, she also saw that her mom worked really hard and decided at 17 years old to work with her to help. This is how, with her income she bought her mom a simple sewing machine, so that her mom could be independent and worked from home.  Katherine used to buy the fabrics, her mom would make the clothes and then Katherine sold the final product. Little by little she bought more sewing machines and negotiated good contracts with education institutions from the area, which she still does to this day.  Her goal is to have an independent shop that can also be a store, this way her children’s future will be secured with a good professional education.
Her biggest challenge is not having the financial resources to achieve her goals quickly.  Katherine is requesting a Kiva loan to buy an embroidery machine, because she usually outsources this and it’s expensive to do.  This way she will be able to satisfy her customer’s needs with finalized products and offer embroidery service that will generate a new source of income making her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Jakeline

texts.es: Hace 7 años, Yakeline generó una idea de negocios para generar mejores ingresos familiares, ella había logrado ahorros que invirtió inicialmente en mercancía como prendas de oro y plata y ropa y mas adelante se vinculó a empresas multinacionales para acceder a guías especializadas de productos y aumentar sus ventas. Sus compras en un mayor volumen no se hicieron esperar y sus ingresos empezaron a incrementarse y con ello ha apoyado la gestión de bienestar de su hogar, antes solamente a cargo de su esposo. Hoy ofrece, calzado, prendas, ropa femenina y masculina, artículos de tocador y bisutería en general. Sus ventas las realiza de contado cada dos días, mientras sus compras has hace de contado y a crédito en almacenes especializados para cada producto. Su meta es ampliar su negocio hasta convertirlo en un gran almacén y compra mas adelante una casa, pero su gran desafío es lograr ahorros suficientes para invertir y crecer. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará perfume, crema y ropa con ello logrará mas inventarios e impactar sus ventas y genera mas utilidades.
texts.en:
Yakeline came up with the idea for a business seven years ago so she could earn income for her family. She had saved some money that she first invested in merchandise such as gold and silver jewelry and clothing. Yakeline later connected with international companies in order to gain access to specialized product lines and boost her sales. Yakeline's husband had previously been the family's sole source of financial support, but purchasing merchandise in higher volume soon increased Yakeline's income. She was then able to contribute financially to her family's well-being. 

Yakeline now sells shoes, jewelry, women's and men's clothing, and a variety of cosmetics and personal items. She sells her merchandise every other day for cash, and purchases each line of merchandise in specialized shops, paying cash or buying on credit. 

Yakeline's goal is to expand her business and turn it into a large store, then buy a home. Her greatest challenge, however, is saving enough money to invest and grow her business. She is now applying for a Kiva loan, her first from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and will use the loan funds to purchase perfume, cream, and clothing. These purchases will boost her inventory, increasing her sales and therefore her profits.

loans.use: to purchase perfume, cosmetics, and clothing.

loans.name: Manuel Gregorio

texts.es: Manuel de 62 años de edad, habita con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 12 y 19 años, en un municipio muy cercano a la ciudad de Barranquilla. Allí tiene una miscelánea donde vende de todo un poco, como artículos para el hogar, fantasía femenina, accesorios ropa etc. Su negocio inició hace 4 años,  tomó la decisión emprender su aventura emprendedora en otro barrio, para generar una fuente de ingresos estable. El compró una pequeña vitrina, se llenó de ánimo y con esfuerzo la surtió y para aumentar sus ventas se mudó a un barrio de mayor potencial, para incrementar sus ventas. Hoy  vende de contado, diariamente, a vecinos transeúntes ofreciendo sus artículos directamente y en un buen punto comercial ubicado en su propia habitad. Sus metas están relacionadas con el fortalecimiento de su capital de trabajo,  mejorar sus ingresos y el nivel de vida y su mayor desafío es no lograr el capital de trabajo suficiente para llegar a cumplirlas. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará papelería, cosméticos, útiles de aseo y variedades comunes. Con esta inversión logrará aumentar el surtido en su miscelánea, obtener liquidez e incrementar su capital de trabajo y sus ventas, para vivir cada día mejor.
texts.en:
Manuel is 62 years old and lives with his partner and their two children, ages 12 and 19, in a municipality very close to the city of Barranquilla. There he has a notions store where he sells a little bit of everything, such as articles for the home, women's costume jewelry, clothing, accessories, etc. 

He started his business four years ago, when he made the decision to launch his business venture in another neighborhood, in order to generate a stable source of income. He bought a small display case, and filled with energy and effort he stocked it. In order to increase his sales he moved to a new neighborhood with greater potential for this. 

Today he sells to neighbors and passersby every day, selling his items directly to the public, at a good sales location located in his own home. His goals  are related to the building up of his working capital, improving his income and standard of living; and his greatest challenge is not having sufficient working capital to succeed in fulfilling his goals. 

This is the reason he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which he will buy paper goods, cosmetics, toiletries and notions. With this investment he will succeed in increasing the stock in his notions store, obtaining liquidity and increasing his working capital and sales so that he can live better every day

loans.use: To buy paper goods, cosmetics, toiletries and notions.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel tiene 39 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar y sus padres dependen de él económicamente. Miguel es un hombre muy trabajador quien desde hace 20 años se gana la vida por medio de la venta de comida en el mercado central de su localidad. Miguel es un hombre comprometido con su familia quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para dar a su familia mejores condiciones habitacionales. Miguel solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea invertir en la introducción del servicio del agua potable en su vivienda dado que no cuenta con el vital líquido y desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en: Miguel is 39 years old and lives in a house he owns with his family, his parents depend on him financially.  Miguel is a very hardworking man that 20 years ago started earning a living through food sales at the local central market.  Miguel is committed to his family and tries to do everything he can to provide his family with better living conditions. Miguel is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest it in introducing water services in his house because they currently don’t have this vital liquid and he wishes to improve the life conditions of his family.

loans.use: to install water services in his house.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Annet is 30 years old, married and the mother of four children, all of whom go to school, She lives in Kasese, Uganda, where she sells clothing in the main market. She works seven days a week for eleven hours a day, and also farms to earn additional money. She began her business to generate income and improve her family's standard of living. Her goal for the future is to buy land for farming even though her capital is limited. She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro es un joven emprendedor con gran proyección y grandes sueños.
El es dueño de dos negocios que con mucho esfuerzo logro montar y levantar.
Uno de ellos es una venta de comidas rápidas como hamburguesas, perros calientes y chuzos; el otro negocio es un café internet. Ambos establecimientos están bien consolidados.
El solicita un préstamo para realizar algunas mejoras locativas al negocio de comidas y realizar mantenimiento a uno de los enfriadores donde guarda las gaseosas.
Con este apoyo económico podrá tener sus activos en óptimas condiciones para ofrecer siempre sus productos de manera oportuna y de muy buena calidad, además de atenderlos en un ambiente cálido y con unas condiciones impecables.
texts.en:
Alejandro is an enterprising young man with a promising future and big dreams.  He is the owner of two businesses which he successfully worked hard to set up and build.  One is the sale of fast food such as hamburgers, hot dogs and grilled brochettes; the other business is an Internet cafe.  Both businesses are well established.

He is seeking a loan to carry out on-site repairs to his rented location for food sales and to do maintenance work on one of the  coolers where he keeps soft drinks.  With this financial help Alejandro will be able to maintain his assets in the best condition so as to always offer his products in an appropriate way, as well as take care of them perfectly in a warm environment.

loans.use: to carry out on-site repairs to his rented location for food sales and do maintenance work on one of the soft drink coolers

loans.name: Reina Margarita

texts.es:
Reina de 50 años de edad, estudio hasta 4° en la escuela, es soltera, pues se separó con el esposo por ser él muy irresponsable. Ella trabaja haciendo la limpieza en los baños del parque desde hace 18 años, sus 3 hijos que tiene  están en EE:UU, ella vive sola y trabaja solo para sus gastos, el dinero que le envían sus hijos lo ahorra para mejorar la casa, pues le envían poco, en el trabajo tiene mucha experiencia, pero anteriormente trabajo en una empresa durante 5 años, también en sus tiempos libres anteriormente hacia tamales, de su casa el trabajo actual se traslada e pie, donde camina media hora, aunque en ocasiones paga moto taxi por el clima o por el cansancio.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para instalar la energía eléctrica, comprara materiales, y pagara la mano de obra, pues está en construcción la casa y le falta el dinero para terminar ese trabajo, cree que se le ayudara mucho pues no tiene el dinero que necesita, y ha iniciado el invierno, por lo que le es más urgente el terminar ese trabajo, planea continuar mejorando su casa, hasta que Dios le preste vida, pues su sueño más grande es que sus hijos al regresar estén en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Reina is 50 years old and has a fourth-grade education. She is single after separating from her husband due to his great irresponsibility, and her three children are in the United States. Reina has worked cleaning bathrooms in a park for 18 years, and earns just enough to cover expenses. She previously worked in a company for five years, and also made tamales in her free time. Reina walks a half hour to work most days, but occasionally pays for a moto taxi to take her when the weather is bad or if she's very tired. Her children send her money that she saves for home improvements, but it's not much. 

Reina is applying for a loan to install electricity, purchase construction materials, and pay laborers. Reina's home is under construction, but she lacks the funds to finish the job. She believes that the home will be a great improvement when it's done, but she doesn't have the money she needs. Winter has begun, so it has become more urgent to finish construction. Reina plans to keep making improvements to her home, until God fulfills her greatest wish and her children come back and live in a comfortable home.

loans.use: to install electricity, purchase materials, and pay laborers for home construction. She lacks the funds to finish the job.

loans.name: Al-Tanmia Group

texts.en: Al-Tanmia is a loan group made up of four women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They have applied for a loan of 310,000 YER from AMB. Rathia is the leader of the group. She is 50 years old, married and the mother of three children who range in age from 3 to 11 years old. She lives with her family in their house and has a university education. Unfortunately, she cannot work at the moment because she needs to care for her family. She is very active and dynamic woman, but lacks many home appliances and the ones she does have are very old. Her house also needs an interior renovation. That is why Rathia is requesting a loan of 90,000 YER from AMB in order to buy a new TV for the house and cement and paint to do a renovation. Rathia looks forward to improving the living conditions of her family. In the future, she hopes to send her children to a private school.

loans.use: to buy a TV, cement and paint to renovate her house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell and to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his children's school expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her graduation project tools, and other study expenses

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila previously obtained a 14,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase more grocery items and other products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, this one in the amount of 18,000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products, to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase, with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lucila dreams of having her own supermarket some day, and desires to operate a public transportation unit, like a jeepney. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mayra Alejandra

texts.es:
Gracias por apoyar a Mayra en la compra de mercancías, como ropa calzado y prendas de plata y oro. Mayra se benefició porque con mayores ingresos su situación económica mejoró. En estos últimos días Mayra se ha encontrado su triste pues ocurrió el fallecimiento de su madre y ha estado viviendo su duelo; un así sus esfuerzos en la atención de su negocio ha generado aumento en sus ventas y agradece a Kiva por continuar recibiendo esa ayuda para microempresas y por apoyar a las microempresarias de Colombia.
En la actualidad Mayra está acudiendo a un credikiva, para compra ropa exclusivamente y continuar fortaleciendo su negocio.
texts.en: Thank you for helping Mayra buy merchandise like clothes, shoes and jewelry.  Mayra benefited because with more income her economic situation improved.  In the last few days Mayra has been sad because her mother passed away and she is grieving. In spite of this her efforts to attend her business have generated an increase in sales and she is grateful to Kiva for continuing to provide that help for microbusinesses and for helping micro-entrepreneurs from Colombia.  Currently, Mayra is requesting a Kiva loan to buy clothing and continue making her business stronger.

loans.use: to buy clothing for sale.

loans.name: Mayeli Alejandra

texts.es:
Mayeli es un joven de 22 años con visión emprendedora y muchas ganas de progresar.
Ella es una mujer organizada y disciplinada ya que se dedica a su negocio de venta de productos de belleza en el día, y en las noches realiza estudios universitarios. 
El oficio lo aprendió trabajando como empleada en un negocio similar y con la experiencia adquirida monto su negocio gracias  a la ayuda de su padre que confió en ella y le dio todo su apoyo.
Aunque su negocio lo inicio hace apenas un mes, tiene muchas expectativas y tiene todas sus esperanzas puestas en él.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de un amplio surtido de productos de belleza en diferentes marcas, ya que quiere competir con los grandes almacenes.
Ella es un claro ejemplo del empuje y emprendimiento que los jóvenes de hoy demuestran y que con su capacidad de trabajo y mente inquieta pueden lograr grandes cosas.
Su mayor sueño es poder consolidar su negocio como una unidad productiva prospera y duradera con muy buena acreditación y reconocimiento.
texts.en:
Mayeli is a young woman of 22 with an entrepreneurial vision and a great desire to move forward in life. She is an organized and self-disciplined woman as she works in her business selling beauty products during the day and in the evenings attends university. 

She learned her occupation working as an employee in a similar business and with the experience she acquired set up her business, thanks to the help of her father who trusted her and gave her all his support. 

Even though she started her business barely a month ago, she has great ambitions and has placed all her hopes in it. Currently she is requesting a loan in order to purchase a wide variety of beauty products of various brands, as she wants to compete with the big stores. 

She is a clear example of the drive and enterprise that today's youth demonstrate, and with their capacity for work and restless minds they can achieve great things. Her greatest dream is to be able to build up her business as a prosperous and enduring productive enterprise, with very good reputation and recognition.

loans.use: To buy a wide variety of beauty products of various brands in order to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: Mario un Hombre de 32 años de edad que se dedica a la fabricación y distribución de panes que realiza en un negocio con la ayuda de sus esposa, tales panes tiene una muy buena acogida por los vecinos que le compra ya que saben que son elaborado bajo excelentes normas de higiene y vendidos el mismo día de fabricación, a partir de la demanda que ha tenido su producto ha pensado contratar personal para que pueda dedicarse junto a su esposa en la elaboración de panes exclusivamente y tener vendedores que lo distribuyan a sus clientes y lleguen a otros sectores teniendo sus estándares de venta como lo son un cordial saludo y una desbordante sonrisa, su principal sueño es poder realizar unas reformas a su hogar y darle el estudio a sus dos hijos por lo que solicita un credito para la compra de materia prima como harina, arequipe, azucar, entre otros para fabricar su producto en mayor cantidad
texts.en: Mario is a 32 year old man who works in the making and distribution of breads that he makes in a business that his wife helps him with. His breads have a very good following from the neighbors that buy from him because they know that they are made under hygienic conditions and sold the same day they are made. Due to the demand for his product, he has thought about hiring people so that he and his wife can dedicate themselves full time to making the breads, and have salespeople that distribute to clients. They could go to other neighborhoods with their sales standards such as a cordial greeting and a big smile. His main dream is to be able to make some improvements to his house and to provide an education to his two sons. In order to do this, he is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as flour, caramel spread, sugar, and others needed for making his bread in a larger quantity.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, caramel spread, sugar, and others needed for making his bread in a larger quantity.

loans.name: Jockas

texts.en:
Jockas is a 33-year-old, married man. He has two children, both of them attending school. Jockas owns a depot of soda and beer, where he works 12 hours a day. He has been in business for four years; he earns salary as an additional source of income. Jockas began the business to look after his children.

Building a residential house is Jockas's dream. He is a hard-working man; however, low capital is a challenge. Jockas needs money to buy cement for construction.

loans.use: to buy cement for construction.

loans.name: Maria Simona

texts.es:
María Simona Jirón lleva nueve años embelleciendo las cocinas  de los hogares de su comunidad. Ella comercializa sets de ollas y pailas de acero inoxidable  para estufas. Asimismo, ofrece una variedad de cosméticos como labiales, esmaltes de uñas, perfumes, colonias,  cremas corporales y  faciales para damas y caballeros.  
Su esposo e hija son parte del éxito de su negocio. Ellos la han apoyado desde que inició.  KIVA Micrédito  ha sido otro pilar fundamental, porque le brindan capital necesario para contar con suficiente mercadería.  María Simona desea seguir trabajando de la mano de esta institución, por lo que solicitó un préstamo para la compra de perfumes, labiales, colonias, esmaltes de uña y cremas corporales y faciales.  De esa manera estaría satisfaciendo las demandas de sus clientes.  Las ganancias serán destinadas  para mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar.
texts.en:
María Simona Jirón has spent nine years beautifying the kitchens of the homes in her community. She sells sets of stainless steel pots and pans for stoves. As well, she sells a variety of cosmetics such as lipsticks, nail polishes, perfumes, colognes, and body and face creams for women and men. 

Her husband and daughter are part of the success of the business. They have helped her since the beginning. Kiva MiCedito has been another fundamental pillar, because they provide her with the capital she needs to have enough merchandise. 

Maria Simona wishes to continue working hand in hand with this institution, so she has requested a loan for the purchase of perfumes, lipsticks, colognes, nail polishes, body and face creams. This way she would be satisfying the demands of her customers. The profits will be earmarked for improving the infrastructure of her home.

loans.use: To buy perfume, lipsticks, colognes, nail polishes, body and face creams.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
This is Rodolfo. He is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to him as he was able to purchase more quantities and varieties of toys and household products needed in his rolling business. His earnings were a big help in his family's personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy more toys and household products such as pails, basins, and dippers to add in his inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Rodolfo dreams of having a fixed variety store other than his rolling store and hopes that he will able to sustain all their needs. He meets up weekly with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for toys and household products such as pails, basins, and dippers for his rolling store

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.en: Zarrina is a young and smart woman. Zarrina is 20 years old. She studies at the Khujand State University at the faculty of Finance and Economy. She is a student of the second course. Zarrina studies well and reads widely. She dreams of being a good specialist in the future. Zarrina is asking for a loan of 625 USD to pay for tuition. Her parents are poor people and can’t support her. So, KIVA lenders are the only ones who can support her. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Didas

texts.en:
Didas is a 37-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy maize which he used to grind into flour to sell. Didas has a personal goal of educating his children up to the university level. He has a maize milling business that he has operated for a year now and, with the proceeds, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and set up a business for his wife. He still faces a challenge of inefficient supply of electricity and lack of skilled labor. However he has a vision of expanding his business to new markets and hiring employees to help him in processing. 

Didas intends to buy maize which he will grind into maize flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is a twenty-seven-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy oxen for ploughing. He is a large-scale farmer and faces hardships of lack of enough manpower to do digging on time because of using manual labour. He also faces another challenge of price fluctuations. His vision is to build a house in future. 

Abraham intends to use the loan to buy more oxen for ploughing.

loans.use: to buy more oxen for ploughing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables and to renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more grocery products and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Eduardo Enrique

texts.es:
Este es Eduardo, un hombre trabajador y fiel seguidor de la independencia económica como principal fuente de ingresos.
El ha trabajado gran parte de su vida en la administración de billares y desde hace 8 meses tiene uno al que le ha tratado de poner todo su empeño para sacarlo adelante y hacerlo prospero.
Trabaja de martes a domingo todo el día y los fines de semana su esposa le colabora en las actividades del establecimiento.
En el billar ofrece algunos productos como frituras, cigarrillos y bebidas como cerveza y otros licores.
El solicita un préstamo para comprar una cantidad más grande cerveza al por mayor directamente de la fabrica y así podrá obtener algunas utilidades ya que en estos momentos compra el producto en un deposito cercano y el costo le resulta muy elevado.
Su mayor sueño es poder tener su negocio muy bien acreditado ofreciendo un servicio de excelente calidad y que resulte agradable para sus clientes.
texts.en:
This is Eduardo, a hardworking man and a loyal follower of economic independence as the main source of incomes.

He has worked most of his life administering pool halls, and for the past 8 months he has had one that he has tried to put all of his effort and determination into so that he can make it a success. 

He works all day from Tuesday through Sunday and on the weekends his wife helps him with activities in the business.

In the pool hall he offers products such as fried foods, cigarettes, and drinks such as beer and other liquors. 

He is requesting a loan to buy a larger quantity of beer at whole sale price directly from the factory so he can achieve better profits. He currently buys it from a nearby distributor and the cost is very high.

His biggest dream is to have a very well-known business that offers excellent quality service and that is very pleasant for his customers.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of beverages, such as beer, to sell in his business and increase his income.

loans.name: Devano T

texts.en:
Devano is a 50-year-old hardworking married man with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is cattle fattening and selling, and he also farms for additional income. Devano started this business to increase his income and look after his family.  His main hardships are competition, theft of his cows and dry seasons, which affect his cows. However, his vision is to increase the size of his farm. 

Devano is requesting a loan to buy more cattle to fatten and sell.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to fatten and sell .

loans.name: Afline

texts.en:
Afline. 29 years old, is from Katito, in Kisumu County, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married and she supports two people in the family. Afline has two children, ages 1 and 3.

For the last four year, Afline has operated a retail shop, earning a monthly income of KES. 9,000. She is taking her first loan with VISION FUND KENYA, which she will use to purchase sugar, cooking oil, maize flour and soap for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to increase her stock. Afline's dream is to educate her children and increase her stock.

loans.use: to purchase more shop items such as  salt, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 27-year-old lady from Nyalenda in Kisumu city which is located in the Western part of Kenya. She is married and supports seven people in her family. She has five children who are aged 13, 10, 9, 7 and 1 year old respectively.

Janet sells second hand shoes, a business she has been doing for the last three years and generates a monthly income of KES 7,000. She is taking her second loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more stock of second hand shoes. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

Janet's dream is to have better living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of second hand shoes

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo used his previous loan to pay for labor and to buy seeds for planting. He operates a general merchandise shop on a busy street, working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day. He also farms for additional income. 

Deo began his business to pay school fees for his children. His dream is to expand his business; however, low capital is a challenge he encounters. Deo is requesting a loan to buy beers and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to pay for beers and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es:
Anastacio, no estudio pues sus padres murieron cuando estaba pequeño y fue así como él junto a sus hermanos trabajaron para ir saliendo adelante.
Es padre de crianza de 6 personas quienes ya están mayores de edad, y cuatro de ellos están fuera del país donde trabajan y siempre están pendiente de él y de sus otros hermanos.
Su hermano emigro al extranjero y fue así como Anastacio se hizo cargo de los niños, pues también la madre de los pequeñitos falleció y él los creció y les enseño a trabajar para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Anastacio ha trabajado desde siempre en los diferentes trabajos de la agricultura (siembra de maíz, frijoles y maicillo) y además siempre trabajo en la elaboración de hamacas de henequén (mezcal)
Desde hace diez años trabaja también de ayudante de albañil y hace diferentes trabajos en el hogar.
El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar arena, cemento, ladrillo y otros materiales para ponerle el piso a una habitación que posee en la casa de sus hijos de crianza.
El crédito le permitirá tener una habitación donde vivir mas cómodo y por ende tener una vida en mejores condiciones.
Anastacio sueña ir haciendo su casa por etapas, el crédito le ayudara para terminar el piso de su habitación y así tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Anastacio did not go to school because his parents died when he was a small boy and so together with the other children in the family he worked to get ahead.  He is the foster father of six people who are now adults. Four of them are outside the country working and always staying in close contact with him and the other two.   His brother emigrated to another country and that's why Anastacio took charge of the children, since the mother of the little ones also died.  He brought them up and taught them to work for a better quality of life.

Anastacio has always worked in different areas of agriculture (planting corn, beans and  sorghum) and also making hammocks from henequen (agave).    For ten years he has also worked as assistant to a bricklayer and done different kinds of work in the home.

The loan he is seeking from CREDICAMPO is to buy sand, cement, bricks and other materials to install a floor in his room in the house of his foster children.   The loan will let him have a room where he can live more comfortably in better conditions.   Anastacio dreams of building his house in stages.  The loan will help him complete the flooring of his room and thus have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, bricks and other materials for installing a floor for his room in his foster children's house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and a table

loans.name: Umrijon

texts.en:
Since childhood, Umrijon has dreamed of being a seamstress. Born in 1977, Umrijon is divorced and has no children. She lives in her parents' house. 

Umrijon wants to organize a sewing business in her house. She plans to open a workshop and to teach other women to sew the national women's dresses. Umrijon took part and got a certificate in the ‘To Get Ahead’ course through a women's organization. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy an embroidery machine for organizing her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine for organizing a new business

loans.name: Ana Sonia

texts.es: Ana tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 9 y 16 años de edad. Actualmente esta en proceso de divorcio por lo que es ella quien asume la responsabilidad del hogar. Ana posee una tienda en la cual comercializa variedad de productos de primera necesidad los cuales sus clientes prefieren cada vez más. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un muro de retención para el cual necesita materiales como: arena, ladrillo, cemento y hierro. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder dar a su familia mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Ana is 37 years old and lives in her own house with her two children aged 9 and 16.  At this time, she is in the process of getting a divorce, which is why she has taken over the responsibility for the household.  Ana has a store where she sells a variety of consumer staples, and her customers increasingly patronize her business.  With the goal of improving the living conditions in her home, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in building a retaining wall.  To do this, she needs materials such as: sand, bricks, cement, and steel.  She hopes to be able to rely on this loan so that she can give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a retaining wall

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en:
Marhabo was born in 1962. She is married and has adult children. 

Marhabo has been busy for more than 13 years with animal husbandry, and now has a good opportunity to develop this kind of business because she lives in a rural area. Marhabo now feeds four cows. She feeds cows some months and then sells them in a local market where she has her regular customers. 

Marhabo is going to increase the number of cattle she feeds. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy cattle. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 32-year-old mother from Kisumu County located in the western part of Kenya. She is married and supports three people in her family. She was blessed with two children who are 14 and one years old.

She has a green grocery stall which has been operating for the last three years and generates a monthly income of 45,000 KES.

Lilian has applied for a third loan with VisionFund Kenya which she will use to purchase green groceries. She will use the anticipated profits to increase her stock.

Her dream is to run a wholesale business and build a nice home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase assorted vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Dukoretubeho Cb Group

texts.en:
Dukoretubeho is a group led by Thacienne. Dukoretubeho means “let us strive for survival” in English. All the group members operate different business types. 

Thacienne is 30 years old. She owns a boutique and has been running the business for the past three years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more items such as utensils, cooking oil, and lotions for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: to buy more items such as utensils, cooking oil, and lotions for sale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a 28-year-old married honest and hardworking male teacher living in Kagadi-Uganda with two children aged 3 and 1. He has been in the teaching service for three years as he was inspired by salary earning and he earns from farming too. He hopes to have a good and attractive house and become successful despite the lack of basic needs of shelter, food, medical and clothing at school. Daniel is asking for a loan to construct a house.

loans.use: to construct a house.

loans.name: Bakyara Tutungukye Group

texts.en:
Bakyara Tutungukye Group is located in a trading center a few kilometers away from Ibanda. The group is comprised of men and women who deal with the small retail trade. 

Perusi is a married woman with six children who are all in school. She runs a small retail shop with limited capital.  

She has applied for a loan through the group to help her add more stock to her business and use the rest of the money to renovate her house which was destroyed by a heavy storm. She hopes to build a permanent house which is strong enough to withstand harsh weather conditions.

Perusi is a very hardworking and honest woman.

loans.use: to buy stock of daily household use items for sell in the retail shop

loans.name: Katweimusye Group Kyaforongo

texts.en:
Rester is a 44-year-old married Ugandan woman living in Kagadi. She has been selling produce and farming for ten years. She hopes to grow her business and improve her living standards. 

Rester intends to use a loan to buy rice and ground nuts to sell. She is a member of Katweimusye Group Kyaforongo where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy rice and ground nuts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish the grocery store he has started building

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for gas cookers and to renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Mayramjon

texts.en:
Mayramjon lives in a village with her two children. She is widowed. Her husband died when he was young. Mayramjon’s children are adults. The family gathers their main income from farming; they feed cattle. Mayramjon feeds cows and sheep and her children help her with feeding cattle. 

Mayramjon owns the land where she grows cattle feed. She is going to increase her number of cattle and in this way, maximize profits. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS to buy cattle for increasing her working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for increasing her working capital.

loans.name: Ruhsat

texts.en:
Ruhsat is a woman with a kind heart and a good soul. She is 49 years old. Since childhood, Ruhsat has been a very hardworking girl and has helped her parents to grow agricultural products. She began her own business deal 20 years ago when her children were little. Now she brings up four children and all of them help her to grow potatoes and wheat. She also feeds cows, and sells milk and milk products to the local people.

Ruhsat always tries to develop her business and maximize profits. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 TJS to buy cows for increasing her working capital. She hopes in the future that she will sell more milk products to the local people. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cows for increasing her working capital.

loans.name: Khursanoy

texts.en:
Khursanoy was born in 1991. She is divorced and lives with her parents. She is a hardworking woman and tries to help her parents earn a living. 

She is a sewer and has offered sewing services for more than two years. Khursanoy sews national women's dresses. She likes her job well and also earns a living. She sews dresses in her house and dreams to open her own workshop in the future. 

Now, she is asking for a loan of 4,000 TJS to buy a sewing machine for increasing her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for increasing working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a plot of land to construct a commercial house.

loans.name: Kinyankoko Twanzane Group

texts.en: Emmanuelina is a 32-year-old female widow with six children who all go to school. Emmanuelina sells cassava flour, working six days a week, eight hours a day. For 14 years, she has been in the farming business to earn additional income. She began this business to educate her children. Now, she wants money to buy cassava flour to sell. Emmanuelina' s dream is to renovate her house, however competition is a challenge.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed, 30 years old, is married and the father of two children, 3 and 5 years old, living in Sana'a, Yemen. He is a university graduate, but he couldn't find a job in order to look after his family. Mohammed spent most of his life as a driver with a rented bus. The money earned from this business was very little, and it was not enough to cover all of his family's expenses. 

Mohammed sold his wife's jewelry in order to begin his own business by purchasing a taxi. He works as a taxi driver and he earns good profits from this business. Mohammed is a very active and dynamic man. He is a talented and respected professional man. Mohammed works 19 hours daily, Sunday to Sunday. He spends most of his time in this business. His taxi has become old and unable to run well. It needs repairs and maintenance. Unfortunately; this business is the family's main source of income, so the taxi must be repaired. Mohammed is requesting a Youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to repair and maintain his taxi and to buy spare parts for it.

Mohammed looks forward to purchasing a new taxi since his first has become very old and most of his earnings go towards maintenance and repairs. Mohammed has a piece of land, and he hopes to build his own house on it.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his taxi and to buy spare parts for it.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, fish, pepper, oil, onions, cold water, coal and other items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers, soap, toothpaste, etc. to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pesticides for her plants and prepare the soil for planting.

loans.name: Francisco Enrique

texts.es: Francisco tiene 30 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus padres y tres hermanos. Francisco trabaja como profesor en la escuela de su localidad. De esta forma es como colabora con la economía de su hogar y como logra ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida. Francisco desea construir una pila para almacenar el agua dado que actualmente no cuenta con un lugar adecuado y lo hace a través de guacales. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de  materiales como: cemento, arena y ladrillo.
texts.en:
Francisco, age 30, lives in his own house with his parents and three siblings.  Francisco works as a teacher at a school in his area.  This way he helps with the household finances.  It is how he is managing to improve his living conditions.  

Francisco wishes to build a washing sink to store water because they do not have an adequate place, and they do it now by using buckets.  In order to do so he is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy materials like cement, sand, and bricks.

loans.use: to buy materials like cement, sand, and bricks.

loans.name: Alphonsine's Group

texts.en:
Ishimwe Group means “Praise Group”.  The group is led by Justine. She sells foodstuffs, and has been in the business for the past five years. 

The members of the Praise Group have different business types, and they praise the Lord for the good results of each member, because they have done a lot and still have hope to improve the lives of their communities. 

With the loan, Justine would like to buy more foodstuffs, such as potatoes and beans to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes and beans to sell.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a private employee. He lives in Cirebon, a semi-urban area about seven hours from Jakarta.  Denis is married. 

To increase the family's income, Denis also works as a dealer. He joined Ruma three months ago to increase his income and he feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments for his customers.

Denis is starting to process electricity bill payments for his customers, which is a much-needed service in the area and will increase his income.  To provide this new service, Denis is required to print out receipts for customers.  A Kiva loan will be able to help him purchase this printer and be able to offer the new service.

loans.use: To purchase a printer

loans.name: Uriel Antonio

texts.es: Uriel es un humilde campesino que hace 10 años se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos, actividad que realiza junto a su esposa y que aprendió empíricamente. Para mejorar su negocio tiene muy presente que hay que invertir en este por ende solicita un crédito para comprar cerdos y realizar unas reformas locativas teniendo más establecimientos para criar más animales y tener un mayor número de ventas, a sus 45 años de edad tiene un sueño muy humilde y es poder tener una vida tranquila con sus 5 hijos, tener más producción y crecer día a día como empresa.
texts.en: Uriel is a humble countryman. For 10 years, he has been raising and selling pigs. He does this work alongside his wife and he learned how to do it through experience. To improve his business, he is well aware that he must invest in it. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to buy pigs and to make some improvements to his facilities so he can raise more animals, and thus have an increased number of sales. At 45 years old, he has a very humble dream, which is to have a peaceful life, to have higher production, and to grow everyday as a business.

loans.use: to buy pigs and to make some improvements to his facilities so he can raise more animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, coal, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Deus

texts.en:
Deus is a repeat client to the organization who has applied for a loan of ugx.3,000,000. The purpose of the loan is to buy more coffee to sell.

He is 38 years old, married, and blessed with four children. He hails from a very remote area in Nyabiteete, Bugangari, Rukungiri district.

Deus is a  farmer, and runs a coffee trading business, which he has done for over 15 years. He also does agriculture as his other source of income. It is from these businesses that he has been able to cater for his family's needs, and to pay school fees for his children.  
 
With this loan from UGAFODE, Deus is hopeful that his business is going to expand.

He appreciates the services from Ugafode and the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy coffee to sell

loans.name: Malfi Sofia

texts.es: Malfi es una experimentada productora de panes con una experiencia de más de 20 años, actividad que aprendió a partir de observación y practicas empíricas, su principal ventaja en las ventas son su carácter fuerte, rectitud, honradez y amor que pone en cada uno de sus productos puesto que cree ciegamente que para triunfar en un negocio primero hay que aprender a amarlo y con este pensamiento prevalecer pro más de 20 años en el mercado. Solicita un crédito para compra de materia prima para la elaboración de panes con el afán de tener una mejor ganancia y que su producto sea cada vez más conocido, su principal sueño es producir panes a gran escala y poder hacer llegar su producto a otros pueblos y regiones.
texts.en:
Malfi is an experienced bread producer with more than 20 years of experience, a business she learned from observation and practice. Her main advantages in business are her strong character, integrity, honesty, and the love she puts into each one of her products, as she believes strongly that to succeed in a business first it is necessary to learn to love it, and with this idea she has survived in the market for more than 20 years. 

She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for making bread, with the desire to have better profit and for the product to be increasingly better known. Her main dream is to produce bread on a large scale and to be able to get her product to other towns and regions.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for increasing her daily production of breads.

loans.name: Guljahon

texts.en: Guljahon was born in the year 1974. She is married and brings up three children. Two of them are adults and one of them is not. Guljahon’s husband is a mechanic. She began her bakery business 14 years ago. Guljahon cooks flatbreads and sells them in a local bazaar. She runs the business alone.  She has a great experience in this field so she can develop her business. She is going to increase her working capital. Guljahon is asking for a loan of 7,500 Somoni to buy flour to make more flatbreads. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy flour to make more flatbreads

loans.name: Mwanza

texts.en:
Mwanza is a hardworking and enterprising man. He owns a house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. He is married and has two, school-going children.

Mwanza sells goat meat to various butchers and hotels. He has been in this business for the past three years. He cites seasonality as his major challenge.

With the loan, he wants to purchase more goats for his business. He joined Yehu to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for his business

loans.name: Mumo

texts.en: Mumo appreciates having received his previous Kiva loan, which improved his living standard. The loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income.  Now, he is requesting a loan to purchase more goats for his business. He thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia Hilda sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de comida, la socia elabora diferentes tipos de platos como arroz con pollo, sopas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de insumos como aceite entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Communal bank member Hilda continues working in her business of selling food. She prepares different types of dishes such as chicken with rice and soups, among other items. She has been working in this business for some time, and it has brought her economic as well as personal satisfaction. She wants to be able to continue working so that in this way she can continue supporting her family.

She is applying for the loan to buy supplies such as oil, among other items.

She feels grateful for the loan offered and promises to make the established payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as oil, among other items

loans.name: Jean José

texts.es: Con un año de expereincia Jean inició su negocio apoyado por su madre experta en la línea comercial de ropa. En su pequeño local, comercializa todo tipo de ropa especialmente informal, y propias de la region caribe a visitantes del centro de la ciudad, uno de los lugares clasicos mas comerciales. Todos los dias da apertura a su tienda de ropas desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, vendiendo de contado y a crédito entre clientes fijos y transeuntes que por alli pasan a hacer sus compras. Su meta es aumentar su patrimonio y organizar su hogar y su mayor desafio es lograr posicionamiento, ante la competencia que enfrenta dia a dia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finacimeinto que hace ala Fundación mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa que se encuentra a la moda, como pantalones, blusas vestidos etc,su propósito es innovar, para impactar a su clientela y hacer de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en: With one year of experience, Jean started his business with the support of his mother, who is an expert in commercial clothing lines. In his small store he sells all types of clothes, in particular casual wear and clothing typical of the Caribbean region, to visitors in the city center, which is one of the most commercial places. Everyday, he opens his clothing store from 9:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m., selling on credit and in cash to regular customers and passersby that shop nearby. His goal is to increase his assets and organize his home. His greatest challenge is to position himself against the competition that he faces everyday. Currently, he is applying for a Credikiva, his first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which he will buy clothes that are in style such as pants, blouses, dresses, etc. His intention is to innovate in order to impact his customers and make his Credikiva a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy clothes that are in style such as pants, blouses, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a 44-year-old lady from Kisumu town, in the western part of Kenya. She is married, and she supports three people in the family. She has four children, ages 15, 13, 12, and 4 years. She has a beauty salon in her local Market. She has been operating this kind of business for the past five years. She comfortably makes a monthly income of KES 15,000.

She is taking her fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use it to purchase a mobile phone, so as to be able to communicate with her clients and family members. She will use her anticipated profit to expand the business. Her dream is to grow her business and become a successful entrepreneur, so as to support her family

loans.use: to purchase an asset, specifically, a phone

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Srey, aged 35, lives in a rural village of the Cheung Prey district. She has two children. She and her husband are farming rice and making palm juice as their main businesses, to earn a living. She has been in this business for 17 years. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day, to meet the family’s needs.

Srey is a first-time borrower with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group, to ask for a loan. As the leader, Srey wants to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to pay for farm labor. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to pay for farm labor.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 27-year-old vigorous lady.  She has been stitching gloves for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to the lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads and wool in different colors and packs of needles to create a means of increasing revenue so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her third loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads and wool in different colors and packs of needles.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Meet Emmanuel, a farmer based in Kisii area of South Nyanza Kenya, which is a very productive area for agriculture. He is married and has two children, all of whom are school-going age. In his farm he grows maize, bananas, vegetables and rears dairy cows and poultry.  He has been doing this for the past 14 years. Farming is his main source of income and he really enjoys doing it because he gets good returns out of it, but his biggest challenge is lack of capital.

Emmanuel chose Juhudi Kilimo for this Kiva loan because they offer farmers short training sessions and they also give low interest rate loans. With this loan, he will purchase a dairy cow that will boost milk production. This will help increase his income base and, thus, be able to take care of his children very well.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ashwak Group

texts.en:
This group is called Ashwak. It consists of four women who are all hardworking. They live in Sana'a, Yemen. They have taken a loan of 140,000 YER. 

Sarah is an 18-year-old married woman.  She is educated with a secondary education. She couldn't complete her studies because she got married when she was very young. She has a strong determination to improve her living standards. She said she has a small amount of money which she saved up herself. Sarah invested that money in her own business. She has run her business for many years, selling makeup and accessories in order to prepare brides for weddings. She sees this business as profitable for her. For further expanding, Sarah requested a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more accessories, makeup, and cosmetics to attract more brides to prepare them for weddings.

Sarah expects a boost in her income. She looks forward to expanding her business through opening a salon to prepare brides for weddings.

loans.use: to purchase more accessories, makeup, and cosmetics

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila is a married lady. She is keen to provide her family with better standards of living. For this purpose, she started a business selling animals four years ago with the support of her husband. She purchases small animals and after raising them a year or two, she sells them in the local market. She earns a good amount of money to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more cattle. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her third loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a mother of four girls -- two in high school, and the other two in primary school. She is also an entrepreneur, selling milk, eggs, vegetables, fruits, sugarcane and cereals, next to her home, to sustain her family. These she buys at a bigger market and sells to her local neighbours, except for the milk and eggs, which she gets from her three cows and her chickens.

Lilian has been a biogas promoter, through a group that she is a member of, called Women Of Grace, even though she didn't have a biodigester, herself. She knew it was the only way to save other women in her community the burden of walking long distances, in unsafe pathways, carrying heavy loads of firewood. Biodigesters also save the cost of buying kerosene for fuel.

With the loan she is now receiving, she can construct a biodigester of eight cubic meters, to produce enough gas for cooking and showering. She hopes that, after its completion, her husband and children will no longer have to wait for her to come cook or warm food, because the biogas stove is easy to light and use. With the biogas shower, her family will also enjoy warm baths every day, improving their hygiene. The savings from replacing kerosene with biogas for cooking and water heating, and from growing vegetables using bioslurry for fertilizer, will enable her to repay the loan and have an improved lifestyle for herself and her family.

loans.use: To construct a biodigester of eight cubic meters.

loans.name: Farrah

texts.en: Farrah is a 26-year-old married woman. She has been in the beauty parlor business for three years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials.  Over time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She needs to deal with more customers time after time. For this she requires hair care products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.  So she applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation.  She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move toward a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities

loans.name: Ronard

texts.en:
Ronard is a 31-year-old farmer who hails from the Kisii area of South Nyanza, a banana producing area. He is married and has one child who is about two years old. He loves farming as it helps him get enough for his family and he also sells his produce in the local market. His primary source of income is eggs, cereals, vegetables, and milk.  He also has a retail  business. His biggest challenge in farming are diseases affecting crops and livestock, and lack of enough capital.

Ronard chose Juhudi Kilimo for this Kiva loan because they offer their loans at a low interest rate and they help improve the livelihood of farmers.  He says that with this loan, he will get an extra dairy cow that will help boost his income since it will produce more milk. This will help him take care of his family better and also venture into other farming activities.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is 25 years old and a married woman. She has been running a business, selling milk with her husband, for the past nine years. She has one buffalo in milk. She sells milk to the people of her locality. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis, to generate an extra amount of profit. Abida has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation.

Currently she is in her third loan cycle, and she has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Abida is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.en:
Hafiza is a 39-year-old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store, for the past nine years. Her husband assists her, by purchasing goods from the market to stock the store, as he has maintained many contacts in the market for years.

Hafiza is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health care. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 45,000, which she will use to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages, to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 40-year-old man from Kisumu in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Inviolate who is a business lady, and they have five children aged eleven, nine, seven, six and four years old respectively.

Peter operates a taxi business, which he has been doing for the last ten years, and he generates a monthly income of 40,000 KES. He is taking his fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya, and he will use this to put his car into good condition so as to earn more income. He will invest the anticipated income back into his business.

His dream is be able to provide the basic needs for his family.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des familles traditionnelles à YELEKELA  un village dans la commune de KIGNAN dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame KOROTOUMOU assise  à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 3 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 4 bidons d’herbicide de marque différente et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, et à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  120 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group BENKADI 2 are married women, who average 31 years of age and four children each. The women live for the most part in traditional families in YELEKELA, a village in Commune de KIGNAN, Cercle de KADIOLO, Région de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their ninth farm loan with Soro Yiriwaso. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with Ms. KOROTOUMOU, who is sitting second from the right in the photo in this group of women. With this loan, she intends to purchase three 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and four containers of herbicide of different brands and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 0.75 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 120,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her in part to pay back the loan with interest, as well as to help out her husband in meeting day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, farm inputs, and seeds and to cover the cost of plowing

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina, a 50-year-old married woman, runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sews it, and then sells her products to the people of her locality. She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. She has gradually improved her business, with the support of Kashf Foundation.

Currently she is in her fourth loan cycle, and she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This will help her to purchase bundles of cloth, along with packs of thread, lace and zippers. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of cloth, along with packs of thread, lace and zippers.

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es:
Ana es una persona de 19 años de edad, madre de un niño de dos años de edad. Se acompaño hace tres años y esta recién casada con su esposo.
Su pequeño niño ha estado enfermo por problemas de labio endido, y ha tenido que estar yendo cada mes hasta la capital para atenderlo en el hospital.
Su esposo trabaja en los cultivos de hortalizas, pues desde pequeño sus padres le enseñaron, ella también puede cultivar las hortalizas, actualmente han sembrado, ejotes y pepinos.


Ana  trabaja por las mañanas en la comunidad, luego por las tardes ella regresa a la casa para cuidar de su hijo y estar pendiente de los cultivos de hortalizas.
Ella vende la mercadería en el pueblo cercano y a veces su esposo las vende en la ciudad. Ella aprendió a cultivar las hortalizas, gracias a que su esposo le ha enseñado el trabajo y sus padres. Desde que se acompaño con su esposo ella se ha dedicado a los cultivos.

Tambien trabaja prestando sus servicios de domestica, en un hogar por las mañanas, y tiene que caminar para llegar al trabajo durante 45 minutos a pie, pues no hay transporte en el área rural.


El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar semilla de ejote y pepino, abono, fertilizantes y cultivar 875 metros cuadrados de terreno y el resto para realizare unos exámenes a su hijo.  Esto vendrá ayudar a la familia, pues con ello recibe otros ingresos económicos para el sostén de la familia.


Ana sueña en el futuro hacer su propia casa con el esposo, espera seguir creciendo en el negocio para sacar adelante a sus pequeño hijo en los estudios, ya que ella no pudo estudiar por problemas económicos.
texts.en:
Ana is a 19 and she is the mother of a two-year-old.  She got paired up about three years ago and she recently married her husband.  Her small child has been sick from cleft lip problems and he has had to go to the capital every month to be seen at the hospital.  Her husband works in the cultivation of vegetables, and she also learned from her parents to grow vegetables since she was young.  Currently they have planted string beans and cucumbers.

Ana works in the community in the morning, and later in the afternoon she goes back home to take care of her child and keep an eye on the vegetable crops.  She sells her produce in the nearby town and sometimes her husband sells it in the city.  She learned to cultivate vegetables thanks to her husband and her parents.  Since she got together with her husband, she has made a living growing crops.  She also works as a housekeeper in a home in the mornings, and she has to walk for 45 minutes to get to work since there is no transportation in this rural area.

She is asking for a loan to buy string bean and cucumber seeds, manure, and fertilizer to cultivate 875 meters squared of land.   The rest of the loan will go towards getting some tests done on her son.  The loan will help the family since she can use it to earn other income to sustain her family.  

In the future, Ana dreams of having her own house with her husband, and she hopes she can continue growing her business so that her son can get ahead in his studies since she herself was not able to study because of economic problems.

loans.use: to buy string bean and cucumber seeds, manure, and fertilizer to cultivate 875 meters squared of land and the rest to get some tests done on her son

loans.name: Azizan

texts.en: Azizan, age 47, is a married woman. She deals in the animal-selling business. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, raises them and then sells to the market at higher prices. Azizan makes enough money through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income. She needs to improve her business to cover more of her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and increase her income level. Azizan is in her ninth loan cycle and has good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Rev Dinna

texts.en:
Rev Dinna is a 34-year-old mother from the Kisumu region which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is a married woman and supports the family by providing income. She supports three people in their family and has two children who are six and four years old respectively.

She has a kiosk where she sells cereals. She has been operating it for the last five years and makes a monthly income of KES 5,000. She is taking her first loan with Vision Fund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more cereals. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business.

Her dream is to expand her business and support the family.

loans.use: to purchase more cereals

loans.name: Fameeda

texts.en: Fameeda is 45 years old and a married woman. She has been stitching clothes for the past two years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors, and packs of lace, zippers, and buttons. These items will help her to stitch up more dresses and generate a healthier income. She is in her seventh loan cycle, with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, and packs of lace, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is hard working woman. She is been in the business of tailoring for a period of about two years. She is proud to be contributing to her household income. 

When Razia was not earning, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner as her husband was the sole bread winner of the family. Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele. 

In order to meet the demands of her customers timely, Razia applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. It will help her to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons and laces in different colours. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demands. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. 

Razia hopes to grow her business for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons and laces in different colours.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à KIGNAN un village  dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame PERPETU assise à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 3. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter un sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  93 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d'autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. 
NB : lors de la prise des photos madame SADIO était absente pour des raisons sociale.
texts.en:
The six members of the group BENKADI 3 are married women, who average 32 years of age and four children each. The women live for the most part in traditional families in KIGNAN, a village in Cercle de SIKASSO 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. 

The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their sixth solidarity loan with Soro Yiriwaso. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with Ms. PERPETU, who is sitting first from the right in the photo in this women’s group BENKADI 3. With this loan, she intends to purchase three 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and a container of herbicide and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and at SIKASSO markets. She plans on making an average profit of 93,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her in part to pay back the loan with interest, as well as to help out her husband in meeting day-to-day family expenses. 

Note: When the photos were taken, Ms. SADIO was absent due to societal reasons.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, farm inputs, and seeds and to cover the cost of plowing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to begin a business of selling vegetables, increase the sale of bread with chicken on weekends by a little, and in addition, to buy corn to sell tortillas

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des familles traditionnelles à YELEKELA  un village dans la commune de KIGNAN dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali.
