Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame BINTOU débout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 3 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 4 bidons d’herbicide de marque différente et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  140 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group BENKADI 1 are married women, who average 36 years of age and five children each. The women live for the most part in traditional families in YELEKELA, a village in Commune de KIGNAN, Cercle de KADIOLO, Région de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their ninth farm loan with Soro Yiriwaso. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with Ms. BINTOU, who is standing first from the left in the photo in this women’s group BENKADI 1. With this loan, she intends to purchase three 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and four containers of herbicide of different brands and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 0.75 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 140,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her in part to pay back the loan with interest, as well as to help out her husband in meeting day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, farm inputs, and seeds and to cover the cost of plowing

loans.name: Abadahemuka Tcb Group

texts.en: Abadahemuka Group means "faithful group" in English. The group is led by 38-year-old Gerturde; she is holding up a piece of paper for identification in the photo. She is married to a farmer and they have five children who all go to school. The members of the group run different types of businesses, yet they all have the common goal of having faith in themselves. Gerturde sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past ten years. With this loan, she would like to buy more beans and maize to sell. Profits from the businesses will be reinvested for a better future and well-being.

loans.use: to buy more beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Mehnaz

texts.en:
Mehnaz is 23-year-old married woman; she is running a business of animal sales with the support of her husband. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up, and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation; currently she requests a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals. She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 55-year-old married woman and the mother of five. She runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sews clothes, and then sells them to the people of her locality.  She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. 

For the improvement of her business, Sajida has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors. These purchases will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers on time. With a good credit history, this will be Sajida's fourth loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
Osman’s wife needs an immediate heart surgery and this is the reason why he is requesting this loan. They are parents of four. 

Their income is generated from agriculture and livestock; they own five dynyms (five thousand square meters) of agricultural land where they plant and sell in the dried form mostly potatoes, beans, garlic, and onions and also some fresh seasonal veggies; they also have a dairy cow and five sheep, and a horse that they use for transportation since their village is very high, built almost at the top of the mountain. The dairy product that they make and sell the most is unsalted butter and cottage cheese.  

Their village and almost the entire region is known for the best quality of walnuts and cherries.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's heart surgery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for rice production

loans.name: Rosa Maricela

texts.es:
En la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo De Crédito La Alborada. Este lugar está rodeado de mucha vegetación y los habitantes además de ser muy honestos son personas muy trabajadoras.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 21, 17, 15 y 11 años, los tres menores estudian en colegio y escuela, todos ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Rosa es una mujer que con sus ganancias puede darles lo necesario a sus hijos más que todo cubrir gastos de sus estudios que para ella son muy importantes, ella se dedica a la venta de artículos para el hogar, así como también ropa, zapatos y varios productos más, el sistema de ventas es por cartillas, casi todos los días ella sale a ofrecer sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y que cobra cada semana, lleva más de 2 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual ayuda a su marido a sacar adelante a su familia.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería ropa, zapatos y varios artículos para el hogar. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 3 ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales,
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the members of La Alborada ("The Dawn") credit group meet in the Colon parish, in the city of Portoviejo. This place is surrounded by a lot of vegetation, and its inhabitants are not only very honest, but also very hard-working.

Rosa lives in this place. She is 37 years old, married, and has four children from this relationship, ages 21, 17, 15 and 11. The three youngest are studying in primary and secondary school, and all of them still live with her. Her husband is a mason.

Rosa is a woman who can use her earnings to give her children what they need, mostly covering study expenses, which for her are very important. She makes a living selling household items, as well as clothing, shoes and various other products. The sales system uses a payment book. Almost every day, she goes out to offer her products, distributing them on credit and collecting payments weekly. 

She has been doing this work for more than two years, and with it she helps her husband to get their family ahead. She will use this loan to buy more merchandise: clothing, shoes, and various household articles. 

She has been in the credit group for three loan cycles and she likes it because of the help she receives with the loans. Her dream is that her children will finish their studies and become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, and various household articles

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan carlos tiene 25 años, vive en el distrito de Ocucaje, trabaja desde hace 6 años como obrero en un fundo y tambien trabaja como agricultor en una pequeña parcela que posee.

Juan esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que graciasd a su apoyo podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes y brindar sostenimiento a su cultivo de pallar, de esta manera podrá tener una mejor cosecha, mejorar sus ingersos y trabajar para hacer realidad  su gran sueño:” Mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y poder tener mas parcelas para cultivar”.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 25 years old, lives in the Ocucaje district, and has worked for six years as a laborer on a farm as well as working as a farmer on a small parcel of land that he possesses.

Juan is thankful to the Kiva lenders because, thanks to their support, he will be able to buy compost, fertilizer, and provide sustenance for his lima bean crops. Because of this, he will be able to have a better harvest, improve his income, and work to realize his great dream of improving his family´s quality of life and being able to have more land to cultivate.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizer, and sustain his crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for clean and thermally efficient cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Maa Mangala Shg Group

texts.en:
Puspanjali is a 47-year-old lady with four children. She lives in a small village called Haradkhola in the Sonepur district of Odisha, India with her husband and her children. Fifteen years ago, she started growing vegetables and paddy rice. She grows different types of vegetables in her field, depending upon the demands of her customers and the season. 

The group is requesting a loan of 150,000 INR. Puspanjali will use her part to buy more supplies such as fertilizers, seeds, manure, etc. With this investment, she will expand her business so that she can generate more income and improve the quality of life for herself and her family. She is part of a group of 10 members, all of whom are women who live in the same community. They named their group “Maa Mangala Self Help Group”, and it is located in the Sonepur district of Odisha, India.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, manure, etc.

loans.name: Mahalaxmi Shg Group

texts.en:
Mahalaxmi SHG self-help group consists of eight women from a village in Odisha. They formed a group to help themselves and solve their problems by themselves. All the members of this group are engaged in different business activities like selling milk, flower plants, fish, etc. so that they can make money to better help and support their families. 

One of the members is Jashabanti, who was selected as the president of this self-help group. The lady standing third from right with a raised hand in the photo is Jashabanti. Jashabanti is 26 years old and is living with her husband and her three children. She hopes to build a house for her family. She has a four-acre plot of land in her village and she is using her land for paddy (rice) cultivation. Her husband is supporting her in this activity. Jashabanti has requested a loan of 160,000 Indian rupees (INR) for her group. She will use her portion to purchase the required resources for paddy cultivation. She says her portion of the loan will help her to purchase paddy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides and cover operational expenses like labor charges.

loans.use: To purchase paddy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides and to cover operational expenses like labor charges.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 40 sheep

loans.name: Janelard

texts.en: Janelard is a  40-year-old  married female with seven children, all attending school. Janelard is a food vendor in the main market; she works seven days a week, eight hours a day, and has been in business for thirteen years. She also does farming for additional income. Janelard began her business to have a source of income, having not been educated. Educating her children and expanding her business are her dreams, despite being challenged by price fluctuations for the food products that she cooks. Janelard is accessing a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en: Esmeralda was able to do some repairs to her poorly built home; she is not finished yet, though, and this is why she is requesting another loan to do the work during summertime, to have the home finished by the time fall season starts with its heavy rains.

loans.use: to install doors in their one-room family home for four

loans.name: Maa Bhubaneswari Shg Group

texts.en: Saraswati is in her first loan cycle with "Maa Bhubaneswari SHG" self-help group through People's Forum. In the picture, the lady standing fourth from right in first row with her hand raised is Saraswati. She likes this type of funding because it allows her to grow her businesses. Saraswati is 33 years old and married. She has two children. Her husband is also in business. He works in mobile village markets on market days. Saraswati makes a living raising and then selling goats to the local butchers in the nearby market. She has been doing this business for the last six years. She spends most of her time taking care of her business but she also raises chickens to help her husband with the household expenses. She will use the loan to buy more goats, goat kids and feed. Her goal is to have a bigger goat business. All the members of this group are women and all are sharing a common goal to give a better life to their children. All the group members live in a small village in Odisha, India, and all are engaged in different activities. On behalf of this group, Saraswati says, "We are very grateful to Kiva and its lenders for giving us this opportunity to grow."

loans.use: To purchase more goat kids, goats and feed.

loans.name: Bhagabataswami Shg Group

texts.en:
From a small village in the Sonepur district, Odisha state, India, nine women stepped out and made a self-help group having the name of "Bhagabataswami SHG" to earn some money from different activities to support their families. All the group members are engaged in different business activities like paddy cultivation, vegetable cultivation, etc. 

Sunayana, age 51, is a widow with two children. The lady standing first from right in the first row is Sunayana. To provide a living, she has been planting rice and farming for 17 years. From farming, she earns an income of 3,500 INR per month. Now she is the leader of this group and they are seeking their first loan with People's Forum (Kiva’s partner) for 135,000 INR. As the group leader, she is going to use her loan portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes she will have a good rice crop yield to earn a profit to support her business.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Anatoli

texts.en:
Anatoli is a 47 year old male. He lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda. Anatoli has a retail business that sells salt, sugar, soap, and general merchandise located on a highway where the general public can access him with ease. 

He has a great dream of educating his children. However, he is challenged by competition. Anatoli needs a loan to buy sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Prewesh

texts.en:
Prewesh is very happy with the help of all Kiva lenders and thanks them a lot.

He repaid his loan fully, and the profits helped him save for his sisters' studies. He also bought two cows.

Prewesh asks Seva MFI and Kiva lenders to help him with another loan of SRD 10,000 so he can save more for his sisters' studies.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides for his rice production.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 49-year-old married man who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his five children and own an advanced farm of pigs. His main hardships are price fluctuations, inflation and seasonal weather. Charles has a vision of buying land to grow crops, moving his business to a more permanent location and expanding it to new markets. 

He is requesting a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizers for his banana farm.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers for his banana farm.

loans.name: Shehaaf

texts.en:
Shehaaf is very grateful to know how Kiva lenders help him in realizing his long-terms goals.

He repaid his loan of last season fully. With the profits, he started building his own house. 

He asks for more help from Kiva lenders for purchasing fertilizers and pesticides for his rice production so he can save more and finish building.

He needs a new loan of SRD 10,000 for this.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Eddy

texts.en:
Eddy is a 40-year-old married female with six children who all attend school. 

Eddy owns a cloth shop at the main market and works 4 days a week, 11 hours a day plus farming for additional income. Eddy began the business to generate income as she wishes to educate her children at higher institutions of learning. She wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. 

Eddy is hard working, however, inflation and competition are challenging.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Zaverio

texts.en:
Zaverio is a 37-year-old married male with four children; three attend school. Zaverio is a farmer who works six hours a day, six days a week plus has a male salon for additional income. Zaverio began the business to increase his income and cater to his family's needs. 

He intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children, after vowing to take them to school until they attain degrees. Zaverio is hardworking and meets the challenge of unexpected climatic changes.

loans.use: To pay for school fees

loans.name: Nazier

texts.en:
Nazir is very happy with all the help he got from all his Kiva lenders. He thanks you a lot.

Nazir could save some money for future costs when their children will enter higher education. He needs to save more, because the small savings he made to date will not be enough. 

That’s why he will continue doing rice cultivation so he can save more. For this he needs another loan of SRD 7,000 for the purchase of inputs like diesel and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase diesel and fertilizers for his rice cultivation.

loans.name: Rawin

texts.en:
Rawin is so glad that Kiva lenders helped him with his rice cultivation.

He repaid his loan on time and with the profits he could expand his rice production.  He wants to save for his own house.

Rawin wants more help for his rice cultivation so he can have his own house. He needs SRD 12,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his rice cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.ru:
Любовь — из Орджоникидзе. Она арендует торговое место в местном торговом центре, реализуя сувениры и мобильные телефоны. Бизнес ведет уже 4 года. Открыла его в то время, когда на фабрике верхнего трикотажа, где Любовь тогда работала бригадиром, возникли трудности и работникам перестали платить зарплату. Любовь понимала, что нужно было решать, что дальше. И тогда ей пришла мысль поработать в торговле, чтобы со временем открыть свою точку. 
На полученные от КИВА средства в размере 30 000 гривен Любовь хочет купить сувенирную продукцию и мобильные телефоны под реализацию. Дополнительную прибыль затем Любовь планирует потратить на развитие своего дела и на некоторые собственные нужды. В планах на будущее у нее есть намерение открыть свой магазин и купить под него помещение.
texts.en: Lubov is from Ordzhonikidze. She leases a retail outlet at a local shopping center and sells souvenirs and mobile phones there. She has been running the business for 4 years. She opened it at a time when the textile factory, where Lubov then worked as a supervisor, had experienced difficulties and employees stopped receiving salaries. Lubov understood that she had to decide what would be next. And then she got an idea to work in retail in order to open her own store with time. Lubov wants to use the 30 000 hryvnia received from Kiva to purchase souvenirs and mobile products for resale. Lubov then plans to use the additional profit to spend on developing her business and on some personal needs. Her future plans include opening her own store and purchasing a space for it.

loans.use: to purchase souvenirs and mobile products for resale

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: Jose de 34 años de edad vive en casa alquilada con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la venta de papas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia posee mucha clientela, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la comprar sacos de papas así como muestra la fotografía para seguir con sus ventas y poder obtener mejores ingresos para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Thirty-four-year old Jose lives in a rented home with his wife and their two children.  He sells potatoes for a living; his business is located in the market that is close to his home and he has a lot of clientele.  Jose is requesting a loan to buy sacks of potatoes like the ones in the photograph to continue with his sales and be able to make better income to give his family a better quality of life without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes

loans.name: Yanira Elizabeth

texts.es: Yanira de 38 años de edad se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado central de donde ella reside, posee mucha clientela porque sus productos son frescos y a buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de verduras y fruta por mayor para poder tener más productos que ofreces y asi obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Thirty-eight-year-old Yanira sells fruits and vegetables for a living; her business is located in the central market where she lives.  She has a lot of clientele because her produce is fresh and her prices are good.  With the earnings from her sales she is able to cover some of her household expenses.  She lives in her own home with her husband and their two children.  She is requesting this loan to buy vegetables and fruit wholesale so she can have more produce to offer and thereby make better profits and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruit wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies to help her coffee crop this season.

loans.name: Gabriela Noemí

texts.es:
En la parroquia Lodana de  la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son muy visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito  Lodana.
En este lugar vive la señora Noemí, tiene 19 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de 1 año de edad. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Noemí es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para que su marido lo utilice en su negocio, el arrienda un local en la ciudad de Santa Ana en el cual vende todo tipo de embutidos, carnes y pescado por libras,  ella le ayuda en su labor ya que a veces llega mucha clientela, son seis meses que llevan con este negocio pero cada día este mejora ya que cuentan mas clientela. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pescado, carne y embutidos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 2 ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños es tener un local propio.
texts.en: In the Lodana parish in the city of Santa Ana, known for its gorgeous landscapes and beautiful, fresh water hot springs that attract many tourists, the members of Grupo de Credito Lodana meet every two weeks. Noemi lives in this area, and she's a 19 year old in a common-law marriage which has produced a 1 year old daughter. Her spouse is a businessman. Noemi is a very good wife who's requesting the loan so her spouse can use it for his business. He rents a location in the city of Santa Ana in which he sells all types of cold cuts, meats, and fish by the pound. She helps him with the job since sometimes there are many customers. For six months they have been working in this business and it gets better every day, since they now have more customers. This loan will be used to buy fish, meat, and cold cuts. She's been in the Grupo de Credito for the last two cycles and likes it because of the help she receives with loans. Her dream is to have a location of her own.

loans.use: To purchase fish, meat, and cold cuts.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel de 40 años de edad vive  con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos, desde hace 5 años posee un molino tiene mucha clientela principalmente las señoras que elaboran tortillas pues ahi llegan a moler el maíz para elaborarlas ya que el es una persona muy amable y responsable, Manuel solicita un crédito para poder comprar cuchillas, discos y todas las herramientas necesarias para tener un buen molino y así seguir con su trabajo para darles el sustento diario a su familia sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Manuel is 40 years old and lives with his partner and three children. For the last five years he's had a mill and since he's very friendly and responsible he has many customers, mainly the tortilla-making women who show up to grind their corn so they can make tortillas. Manuel is requesting a loan to be able to purchase blades, discs, and all of the tools necessary to operate a good mill so he can continue his job and put food on the table for his family without exception.

loans.use: To purchase blades, discs, and all the necessary tools.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana tiene 53 años de edad y habita en casa propia y se dedica a la venta de variedad de frutas y hojas de banano (hoja utilizada para hacer tamales). De esta forma es como logra mantener la economía del hogar y ganarse el sustento diario. Ella es una mujer muy conocida en su localidad como una persona integra, responsable y trabajadora. Susana solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea reparar el techo y el piso de la vivienda por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, polines, cemento, arena y grava.
texts.en: Susana is 53 years old, lives in her own house, and works in the sale of a variety of fruits and banana leaves (leaves used to make tamales). This is how she pays household expenses and supports herself. She's well-known in the area as a woman who's trustworthy, responsible, and hard-working. Susana is requesting this loan from FUSAI because she wants to repair the roof and floor of her home. For that reason she has asked FUSAI for this loan to purchase galvanized metal, wood, poles, cement, sand, and gravel.

loans.use: To purchase: galvanized metal, wood, poles, cement, sand, and gravel to repair the home's roof and floor.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is a 30-year-old married female with three children, two of whom go to school. Eliza operates a clothing shop at the main market, a business she began to have a source of income and to be self employed. Her dreams are educating her children, buying land and expanding her business. Her challenges are inflation and competition. 

Flavia is asking for a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some pigs so she can sell the meat.

loans.name: Maria Fernanda

texts.es:
Maria tiene un negocio de tienda de abarrotes en el que ofrece gran variedad de productos alimenticios, carnes, licores, golosinas, entre otros.
El negocio era de propiedad de un tío que se vio obligado a dejarlo porque se trasladaba de ciudad y no podía atenderlo más. Ella decidió hacerse cargo de él y empezar a capitalizarlo para hacerlo más productivo.
Hoy en día considera que necesita un impulso para aumentar sus ventas, por esta razón pide un auxilio económico para diversificar su oferta de productos y ofrecer más productos  a sus clientes.
Tiene grandes expectativas en su negocio y le a puesto mucho empeño para que sea prospero y reconocido.
Su mayor sueño es poder consolidar su actividad y tener siempre ingresos disponibles para brindarles una educación de calidad y un mejor estilo de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria has a grocery store where she sells a large variety of food products, meat, liquor, sweets and other things.

The business belonged to her uncle but he had to give it up when he moved from the city and was unable to look after it any longer. She decided to take over and started to make better use of it, making it more productive.

At the moment, she believes that she needs to do something to improve her sales, so she is asking for a loan to be able to diversify the products she sells and offer more to her customers.

She has great expectations for her business and has worked very hard to make it profitable and well-known.

She dreams of making it a long-term success and always having a disposable income to provide an education and a better standard of living for her children.

loans.use: to buy a wide range of products to sell to her clients and improve her sales.

loans.name: Arturo Hermenegildo

texts.es:
En la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo De Crédito La Alborada. Este lugar está rodeado de mucha vegetación y los habitantes además de ser muy honestos son personas muy trabajadoras.
En este lugar 	vive don Arturo, tiene 52 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 5 hijos, cuatro mayores de edad y la menor tiene 8  años y estudian en escuela. La mujer se dedica a la casa. 
El señor Arturo es un hombre que le gusta trabajar en el campo y así salir adelante, el se dedica a la agricultura y venta de sus productos, tiene cultivos ya sea en la época invernal y también en el verano ya que arrienda terrenos que son adecuados para este tipo de cultivos, actualmente tiene sembrado maíz y maní para lo cual requiere del crédito para pagar el trabajo de recolección de los productos y con esto poder guardarlos por un tiempo ya que al venderlos ahora los vendería a precios bajos por eso espera que el crédito le ayude para pagar la mano de obra para después vender a buen precio, el en verano también siembra verduras y frutas con lo cual se mantiene todo el año y les da lo necesario a su familia.
Este crédito es para pago de mano de obra para la recolección de los frutos.  Lleva 5 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así sale adelante con los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the members of the credit group "La Alborada" meet in the Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo. This area is surrounded by vegetation and the people are not only very honest, but also hard-working.

This is where Arturo, 52, lives.  He is married and has five children.  Four of them are now adults, and the youngest, who is eight, is studying at school. His wife dedicates her time to the housework. 

Arturo likes working in the fields and earning a living for himself. He works in agriculture and sells his produce. He has crops both in winter and in summer because he rents land which is suitable for both. 

At the moment, he has corn and peanuts growing so he needs a loan to pay labor costs to collect the harvest.  Then he will store them for a time, because if he sells them now, he would do so when the market price is low. 

Therefore, he hopes the loan will allow him to pay for help, so he can later sell his produce at a good price. In summer he also sows vegetables and fruit, so he supports himself throughout the whole year and can provide for his family.

This loan is for labor costs to collect the harvest.  He has been a member of this credit group for five cycles and he likes it because the loans help him to progress in his work. He dreams of being able to provide all that his family need.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs to increase the number of animals she can offer to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, sheets and nails to make some home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her kitchen where she prepares the food she sells.

loans.name: Dolores Monserrate

texts.es:
En  la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo De Crédito La Alborada. Este lugar está rodeado de mucha vegetación y los habitantes además de ser muy honestos son personas muy trabajadoras.
En este lugar vive la señora Dolores, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 16 y 14 años  y  el menor de 10 meses  de  edad, los dos mayores estudia en colegio. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Dolores con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogos, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada ocho o quince días. Lleva  cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo y ayuda a su marido el cual no siempre tiene trabajo.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 3 ciclos  y le gusta porque los créditos le sirven para financiar su negocio. Sus sueños es darles todo a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the members of the credit group "La Alborada" meet in the Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo. This area is surrounded by vegetation and the people are not only very honest, but also hard-working.

This is where Dolores, 33, lives.  She is married and has three children aged 16 and 14 and another who is only ten months old.  The two older children are at school. Her husband is a builder.

Dolores tries to earn her own living and contribute to the household expenses so she sells clothes by catalogue.  She sells door-to-door, selling on credit to her customers and receiving payment every eight to 15 days. She has been doing this for five years and it helps her to earn some money and help her husband, who doesn't always have work.

She is going to use this loan to buy more products such as trousers, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing. She has been in this credit group for three cycles and she likes it because it allows her to finance her business. She dreams of being able to give her children all that they need.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Katherine Lisbeth

texts.es:
En  la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo De Crédito La Alborada. Este lugar está rodeado de mucha vegetación y los habitantes además de ser muy honestos son personas muy trabajadoras.
En este lugar vive la señorita Katherine, tiene 22 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva tres ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y de mucha ayuda.
Doña Katherine es una joven que le gusta trabajar para ayudarles a  sus padres que son de escasos recursos, ella trabaja en un programa del Estado por contrato por lo cual recibe un sueldo mensual pero también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa, sabanas, cortinas y varios artículos para el hogar, ella y su mamá que es la que le ayuda en sus ventas recorren varios lugares donde tienen clientela ya sea los fines de semana o en momentos que están desocupadas, dejan a crédito y que cobran por quincena, ya son varios años que tiene este negocios el cual le permitió sacar adelante sus estudios. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, sabanas y artículos para el hogar. Sus sueños es seguir trabajando y mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the members of the credit group "La Alborada" meet in the Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo. This area is surrounded by vegetation and the people are not only very honest, but also hard-working.

This is where Katherine, 22, lives.  She is single and lives with her parents. She has been a member of this credit group for three cycles and she likes it because the loans come quickly and they help her a lot.

She likes working to help her parents who are not so well-off. She has a job in a state program on a contract which earns her a monthly salary.  

However, she also is a trader. She sells clothes, sheets, curtains and other items for the home. With the help of her mother, they go round various places where they sell to customers, either at the weekends or whenever they have a spare moment. They sell on credit and collect payments every two weeks. They have been doing this activity for several years.  In the past, it allowed her to pay for and complete her studies. 

This loan is to buy clothes. sheets and other items for the home. She hopes to continue working in the future and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, sheets and other items for the home.

loans.name: Carmen Graciela

texts.es:
En  la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo De Crédito La Alborada. Este lugar está rodeado de mucha vegetación y los habitantes además de ser muy honestos son personas muy trabajadoras.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores  de edad, uno de  ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Carmen y su esposo se dedican  a la artesanía, ellos compran la piel de las vacas las mismas que luego procesan y curten con líquidos especiales para esto, así una vez que ya la piel esta curtida y seca la venden a  comerciantes de la localidad o de ciudades de la sierra los mismos que las utilizan para fabricar riendas de caballos, montura y zapatos, esta actividad la viene realizando su marido desde hace mas de 30 años y es la forma como el siempre se ha ganado la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar cuero de vaca y químicos para curtir esta piel. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque es así como ellos salen adelante. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the members of the credit group "La Alborada" meet in the Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo. This area is surrounded by vegetation and the people are not only very honest, but also hard-working.

This is where Carmen, 55, lives.  She is married and has four grown up children.  One of them still lives in their home. Her husband is a salesman.
They both make leather products, buying cow hide and processing it, tanning it with special liquids used for this work. Once the process is complete and it is dry, they sell the leather to traders in their area and in the mountain villages.  These people then use it to make reins for horses, saddles and shoes. Her husband has been earning a living from this for more than 30 years.

This loan is to buy cow hide and chemical agents to tan the skin. She has been a member of this credit group since it started and she likes it because it helps them get on in business. They dream of having good health in the future.

loans.use: to buy cow hide and chemical products.

loans.name: Juan Evangelista

texts.es: Juan es un veterano agricultor de mil batallas que ha vivido en carne propia diferentes eventos que en otra persona serían suficientes para abandonar esta labor tan admirable, eventos de violencia que marcaron una época negra para el pueblo colombiano, pero a pesar de todos estos hechos el nunca renuncio a su labor y con la ayuda de su esposa y sus 8 hijos sacaron su familia adelante brindando productos al pueblo, solicita un crédito para seguir ejerciendo su admirable labor, necesita comprar insumos que en el momento le es imposible comprar ya que el invierno le ha generado muchas pérdidas, solicita semillas y algunos pesticidas para acabar con unas plagas que rondan sus cultivos
texts.en:
Juan has a lot of experience in agriculture.  He is a veteran who has seen thousands of battles.  He has experienced in the flesh different events that would have put other people off this respected line of work. Those events were a terrible time for the Colombian people. 

However, despite all this, he has never neglected his work and with the help of his wife and his eight children, they have got along as a family and produced food for the people. 

He is asking for a loan to continue with this work for which he is admired. He needs to buy supplies but at the moment it is impossible for him to pay for them because this winter has not been very profitable. He needs to buy seeds and some pesticides to treat the plagues that are surrounding his crops.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Roberto De Jesus

texts.es: Roberto de 52 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarlos a los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, El está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, controles de plagas, etc.  para poder continuar con sus cultivos y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Roberto is 52 years old. For many years he has worked in agriculture and he mainly plants corn. After the harvest, he stores the corn in the granary which is shown in the picture, and then he sells it in various markets near his home. 

He asks for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, pest control, etc. in order to be able to continue with his crop and to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Idaelda Aida Felicidad

texts.es:
En la parroquia Lodana de  la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son muy visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito  Lodana.
En este lugar vive la señora Aida, tiene 67 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esta relación tiene cinco hijos mayores de edad, uno de  ellos aun vive con ella. 
Doña Aida es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma para salir adelante, ella tiene un bazar y papelería en su casa, allí vende ropa, perfumes, bisutería y cosas para regalos, así como también útiles escolares lo cual en esta época es lo que más vende razón por lo cual necesita de este crédito. Tiene más de 12  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa,  perfumes y útiles escolares. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son mejorar su negocio y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the credit group Lodana meet in the Lodana parish of the city of  Santa Ana. It is known for its beautiful scenery and lovely fresh water beaches that are much visited by tourists.

This is where Aida lives. She is 67 years old. Several years ago, her husband died, but from that relationship she has five grown children. One of them lives with her. Aida is a very hardworking woman who likes to depend on herself to get ahead. She has a miscellaneous and paper store in her house. She sells clothing, perfume, jewelry and gift items. She also sells school supplies which are what sell the most at this time of year. That is why she needs this loan.  She has been doing this job for more than 12 years and with it she gets ahead. She has been in the credit group since the beginning and she likes it because the payments are easy to make. Her dream is to improve the business and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfume, and school supplies.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: Moises de 51 año de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar el se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, Moises está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, control de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía y así continuar con sus siembras y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Moises is 51 years old. He lives in his own home with his family group. He has worked as a farmer for several years. His main crop is corn. He sells his products in different markets that are close to his residence. Moises is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, pest control, herbicide, etc, as well as to improve the soil seen in the photograph. This way, he can continue with his crops and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pest control, herbicide, etc. and improve the soil.

loans.name: Dharmradj

texts.en:
Dharmradj is very thankful to Kiva lenders for helping him with his rice cultivation. 

He has repaid his loan fully and on time to Kiva lenders. With the profits that resulted from this loan, Dharmradj hoped he could save enough money for his new tractor. However, he was not able to save enough money!

Dharmradj would like additional help from Kiva lenders and Seva MFI so he can save enough to buy a tractor. He requests another loan of SRD 10,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his rice production business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides so he can expand his rice production business.
